story:
Dear Friends,

My name is Austen Wagner and I am 15 years old, My passion is gymnastics and cheer tumbling. Ever since I was 3 I took dance classes until I was 13. Now I am taking two classes a week at Vasi’s International Gym: Cheer Tumbling and Freestyle Gymnastics. I realized that this is my strong true passion. The owner of my gym is a gold medal Olympian from Romania. The other is a finalist on NBC's hit show America’s Ninja Warrior. They push me and expect perfection and teach me not to give up. It gives me a lot of life lessons. Because I am new to tumbling I want to improve my skills by going to Camp Woodward. Camp Woodward is a week long camp where you stay overnight. It is very difficult but you improve tremendously. Last year they had Gold medal Olympian Jordyn Wieber who won in the 2012 London Olympics. They always have special celebrity guests which is very inspirational. Each day there is over 7 1/2 hours of practice for 7 days. This would extremely help me as an athlete.

My goal is to get enough skills and technique from Camp Woodward to qualify to compete at the World Championship competition in Orlando, Florida, which is a competition where over 40 countries including the U.S compete for gold, silver and bronze medals. I know that attending the Woodward Cheer Camp will help me tremendously improve my skills and technique. I love to learn, I'm very engaged, I focus a lot and don't mess around or think it's a joke or talk while teachers are instructing. I’ll take a lot away from this opportunity. If you want something you need to be motivated, do what your heroes do, put your mind to it and never give up. 

Thank you for any way you can help me attend Woodward Camp.

Every little bit helps :-)

Sincerely, 

Austen Wagner

story:
For the parents of a child with food allergies or other special care needs, it can be a daunting task to share care information with caregivers. For the caregivers, providing care for these children can be complicated and scary. InVitalShare wants to change all of this by revolutionizing the way people share vital care information.

We are passionate about helping families make it easier and safer for others to care for their children, and a successful IndieGoGo campaign will allow us to develop the amazing tool that we’ve been designing for over a year. It will also provide us with the funds needed to ensure that this life changing service is available for many years to come.




What Is InVitalShare

InVitalShare is a website and mobile app that allows parents to share their child’s vital care information with caregivers. Whether it’s a friend’s parents, the babysitter, grandma and grandpa, the camp counselor, or the school nurse, parents will now have a way to securely and easily share care information with anyone, anywhere.

When a parent needs to share care information with someone else who will be taking care of their child, details are often jotted in a quick note, sent in a text message, or quickly talked about in a phone call. When this happens, usually only one caregiver receives the information, it’s not kept up-to-date, and it sits somewhere out of sight and out of mind. This creates a huge problem for the caregivers and a potentially dangerous situation for the child. In other cases, the amount of information that needs to be shared is simply overwhelming for the caregiver.



With InVitalShare, this all changes. Parents can capture important information, share only what they want caregivers to see, and make sure that those individuals always have the most current and useful information wherever they are.




How Does InVitalShare Work

First, the parent of a child with a special care need, in this case a food allergy, signs up and creates a profile for their child. This profile includes basic information like their name, age, height, and weight. The parent then enters details regarding their child’s care needs such as:

  • Allergies
  • Triggers
  • Favorite foods and snacks that they can safely eat
  • Dangerous foods that should be avoided
  • Restaurants and menu items that are ok to order
  • Special care instructions on what to do if a problem should occur
  • Emergency contacts that can be called in the event of an emergency.

The items listed above are just examples of the types of lists that can be created. A user has the ability to create as many lists as they want, name them accordingly, and enter any type of information within that list. InVitalShare is completely flexible and allows you to share ANY type if information with ANYONE.




Once a profile has been created, the parent enters the email addresses of the caregivers, selects only the pieces of information they want to share, and the amount of time that the information can be seen.


The caregivers then receive the invitation by email and can instantly view the details through a mobile app or the inVitalShare website. Once the caregivers have this information, it’s always available and accessible wherever they are. Users of the inVitalShare mobile apps, which will be available for iPhone, iPad, and Android devices, also have secure access to the information even if an internet connection isn’t available.




How Much Will InVitalShare Cost

inVitalShare is designed to be extremely secure, easy to use, and cost effective for any parent. As a subscription service, parents sharing information (Sharing account) can do so for under $5 a month. Caregivers that receive access to this information, pay nothing at all.


Why Is It Called InVitalShare

Because Invitation based Vital information Sharing was too long of a name!


Why Do We Need Your Help

We recognize how important your family’s vital care information is, so we want to do this right. Building an app is easy. Building an extremely secure, yet easy to use system which includes web access and mobile apps for both IOS (iPhone, iPad, etc) and Android devices however, is very complicated and expensive. It takes a team of skilled professionals with the right experience and resources to create a service like InVitalShare. We’ve got the team, now we need to put them to work!


You may ask, “That’s a strange number. Why $143,000?” Well, that’s a fair question. Most importantly, it provides what we need to get the first version of InVitalShare built and into the hands of the families who need it by the end of the summer. Anything we raise above this amount will help us get additional features and new functionality built in faster. There is a lot we hope to do with this incredible service so don’t be bashful about sharing if we cross the $143,000 mark. As for the unusual amount, 1-4-3 has a significant meaning for us. Check out the story behind 1-4-3 at the bottom of this page. If you can't decide on a contribution level, we'd recommend the $143 perk.


What happens if we don’t meet our goal? Well, we will use the money our supporters have contributed and secure the funding needed to complete the project through other means. Our hope though is that a small number of the millions of families who deal with food allergies and special care needs will help us surpass our goal and allow us to focus on making InVitalShare available as quickly as possible. You have the power to make that happen!


Who Is Behind InVitalShare


Drew Smith is the founder and president of InVitalShare. As a father of four, Drew has learned first hand how food allergies and special care needs can impact a family. It was while watching one of his daughter's friends that an incident took place which sparked the idea for InVitalShare. He later experienced the complexities involved with having his own child requiring extremely specialized care. These experiences have resulted in a strong belief that a combination of technology and human interaction can work together to significantly improve the lives of those who deal with food allergies and special care needs. As a successful entrepreneur with a background in broadcasting, information technology, product development, and business management, Drew understands that it takes forethought, planning, the right resources, and a tight team to turn a good idea into a success. Drew is passionate about combining business and technology to help others and InVitalShare is the culmination of those passions.

Adam Simcock is the president of Earthling Interactive, a web and mobile application development company located in Madison, Wisconsin. An anthropologist, environmental scientist, and mathematician by training, Adam’s real talent is understanding the way things work. Adam leads Earthling Interactive which approaches every project as a partnership, and that is why we chose them as our development partner for InVitalShare. When we decided to find a developer, three big items needed to be checked off of our list. First, the company had to be US based and have its own staff in-house. Second, the company needed to be willing to work with us long-term and operate almost more as a business partner than a vendor. Third, they needed to have experience designing and developing healthcare related applications and systems. Working with sensitive health information is subject to many regulations and special security considerations. A complete understanding of this area and the skills to apply that knowledge to the design process was paramount. Earthling Interactive surpassed our requirements in each of these areas and we are extremely glad to have chosen them as our development partner. If you have the next big web, mobile, or e commerce idea, be sure to visit Earthling Interactive after you contribute!

Kevin Selle wears many stylish hats and we love them all! Kevin leverages his skill sets as a broadcaster, communicator, teacher, and geek to enable more effective digital communications with audiences that need the right information, at the right time, in the right form. Kevin is also very familiar with the special considerations and challenges associated with children that have special care needs and the impact that they have on families and caregivers. He is a master of understanding how to craft a message, identify who needs it, and reaching out to those people in an effective and personal manner. The human element of communication is a core component of Kevin’s communication philosophy and he understands that people are much more likely to respond to a personal message than something that feels canned and pulled from a machine. We hold our relationship with our contributors and futures users in the very highest regard and we want them to feel like there are real people working to improve their lives, not just some computers in the corner of a data center churning away and sending automated responses to each inquiry we receive. Kevin is quite possibly the best “people person” we know.

The Advisers aren’t a group of mystical beings that communicate with us by means unknown. They are the people who represent every single person that will ever use InVitalShare (woah... no pressure). This incredible group of moms has helped InVitalShare to orient itself and truly understand how our products and services will be used to change lives. Some of our advisers are parents of children who suffer from food allergies and others are parents who regularly care for other children with food allergies and special care needs. These moms are true heroes and there is no way to even begin describing the energy, courage, attention to detail, and unwavering determination they possess in order to ensure that their children and the children they care for live in the safest and most comfortable environment possible. After a successful IndieGoGo campaign, our advisers will play a critical role in helping us to truly revolutionize the way families share vital care information.


The Perks

We value every single dollar we receive! You have worked hard for it and we want to make it work hard for us. There are a lot of different things we could give you as a way to say thanks for your contribution, but our goal is to help families by making this incredible service available at the most affordable price possible. As a result, our perks will mainly include different lengths of free service for contributors. Don’t need the app yourself, but still want to contribute? First of all, You Rock! Second, you can share your perks with someone who would benefit from them. For those of you who are in a position to really pay it forward, we have a few special ways to say thanks.

Take a look at our perks and contribute what you can. If you don't see an option that fits into your budget, simply enter the amount you'd like to contribute in the "Your Contribution" area at the top right side of the page and click "Contribute Now". If you need help deciding, consider the "1-4-3 Dedicated to Success" perk. Remember, every contribution is important no matter the size. Contribute and share right now!


Unable To Contribute? You Can Still Help

Not everyone can make a financial contribution and we understand. You can still help us though! Share our crowdfunding campaign with everyone you know. Post on Facebook, tweet on Twitter, and blog in the blogosphere. Let others know about this life changing project and how they can help us turn an amazing idea into a reality!



The Story Behind 1-4-3

**A note from Drew**
My entire family has shaped me into the person I am today and I'm eternally grateful for that. As an example, my grandfather, Lawrence Sr., introduced me to technology and sparked a lifelong love affair with understanding how it could be used to do amazing things (ahhhh that ham radio and Commodore 64). He also introduced me to the story of 1-4-3. As the story was told, lighthouses many years ago would flash the pattern 1-4-3 to signal “I LOVE YOU” to the sailors on passing ships. That simple number holds a very important place in our family’s life and is used by everyone as the signature of emails, the closing of a quick note, and a general reminder of how we feel about one another. It has also become the reminder to us at InVitalShare of how parents feel for their children and the responsibility we are given when parents entrust their children's care information to us. At InVitalShare, we love what we do and we love who we do it for. #143


Lodge Roasters Coffee

What does coffee have to do with this project? Well, the rewards are called "Perks" right? It just so happens that we know of another new business that hand roasts some of the most amazing coffee you'll ever taste. If you are someone who is constantly working hard to care for those around you, a phenomenal cup of coffee is just what you need.

For any stellar supporter that contributes $5,000 or more, you will have an opportunity to enjoy one of the most unique coffee experiences available. The Lodge Roasters Explorer Experience takes roasting coffee to the next level by letting you pick from a list of breathtaking outdoor locations and creating your custom roast on the spot. In addition, you receive a video of the adventure! This is the first time that you've ever been able to enjoy your coffee long after drinking it.

Check Out Lodge Coffee Roasters


A Final Note

If you've read to this point, I can't say thank you enough. We sincerely appreciate the time you've taken to watch our video, read our message, and learn about what drives us to do great things. If you are able, please consider making a contribution even if food allergies and special care needs aren't a part of your life. For so many, these are conditions that are faced on a daily basis and your contribution could have a huge impact on their lives. Help us help others.

God bless,

Drew Smith
Founder - InVitalShare

story:
Hello, I'm Andrea and I'm a biomedical researcher.  Last spring I got my PhD in immunology.  I studied how to get our immune systems to recognize breast cancer cells and get rid of them.  I identified a portion of a protein expressed in breast cancer cells that may be used in vaccines to prevent breast cancer recurrence.  You could say I'm a big advocate for breast cancer research, treatments, and prevention.  This is a terrible disease that will affect 1 in 8 women in the US.  Death rates for breast cancer have been decreasing, mostly due to the fact that it is detected at earlier stages now because of better screening.  However, treatments for breast cancer and particularly advanced breast cancer still have a long way to come.      

This year I found out my grandma has stage 3+ metastatic infiltrating ductal carcinoma. Basically she has a very aggressive form of breast cancer.  This is the second time she has had breast cancer.  She beat it the first time and we know she can beat it again, but she needs help with the cost of the treatments and the travel costs.

She is currently undergoing chemotherapy.  She will have to endure getting radiation 5 days a week for 5 weeks.  She has to go to the hospital frequently for checkups and to meet with surgeons and oncologists.  Several months from now she will need a double masectomy.  The cancer has also spread to her lymph nodes and lungs, meaning the treatments will need to be more intense and there may be a need for additional surgeries to get rid of the cancer that has spread.   

My grandma lives on an island in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.  It's pretty isolated up there.  She has to take a ferry and drive 200 miles anytime she goes to the doctor.  Sometimes the weather is bad and she has to pay to stay overnight near the hospital.  When she has radiation she will have to drive 5 hours away to a hospital in Marquette, MI.  It isn't feasible for her to drive that distance everyday for the radiation, so her and my grandpa will have to find a hotel to stay in and pay for travel costs in addition to medical costs.  My grandparents are retired and live on a fixed income.  These expenses are going to be a big financial burden and they are not sure how they will pay for everything.  The medical costs themselves are extremely expensive.  For one treatment alone she needs 10 shots.  Each shot costs her $1000 after insurance has paid their part.  This is only one of the many treatments she is receiving.

She may also go to the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN to get a second opinion.  She could have her treatments done there and enroll in a clinical trial.  If she goes there, the medical costs would increase as well as the travel costs.  However the quality of care would be top-notch and we would know everything that could possibly be done is being done!

We are asking for $25,000 to help pay for some of the medical expenses associated with the chemotherapy, radiation, and all of the surgeries.  Some of the costs will also go to pay for transportation and lodging during the 5 weeks my grandparents will need to be in Marquette for the radiation treatments.  

Anyone can donate!  Donate as little as $1.  Every little bit helps.  Your reward for donating - you can feel good all day knowing that you helped out a loving, kind grandma and put a smile on her face.  Even if you can't donate, how about sharing the link to this fundraiser on twitter, facebook, and other social media sites?  With your help we can show Grandma Karen how much we love and support her!  And we can kick breast cancer to the curb!

 

UPDATE 3/31/13: 

Hi Everyone! Only 6 days left for the fundraiser and we are almost at $2000. Do you think we can make it? I hope so! Share the link again and spread the word. Grandma Karen needs our help.

As an extra incentive, anyone who has donated already and anyone who donates from now on will be sent some of Grandma Karen’s favorite recipes by email after the campaign ends. We all know Grandma loves to cook, she even compiled a huge cookbook for her family a few years ago. One donation means you will get access to recipes for some tasty food – Christmas cookies, the best birthday cake, salads, and dinners. All are Grandma approved!

Thank you for your donations and for your help spreading the word.
story_txt:
Hello, I'm Andrea and I'm a biomedical researcher.  Last spring I got my PhD in immunology.  I studied how to get our immune systems to recognize breast cancer cells and get rid of them.  I identified a portion of a protein expressed in breast cancer cells that may be used in vaccines to prevent breast cancer recurrence.  You could say I'm a big advocate for breast cancer research, treatments, and prevention.  This is a terrible disease that will affect 1 in 8 women in the US.  Death rates for breast cancer have been decreasing, mostly due to the fact that it is detected at earlier stages now because of better screening.  However, treatments for breast cancer and particularly advanced breast cancer still have a long way to come.      
This year I found out my grandma has stage 3+ metastatic infiltrating ductal carcinoma. Basically she has a very aggressive form of breast cancer.  This is the second time she has had breast cancer.  She beat it the first time and we know she can beat it again, but she needs help with the cost of the treatments and the travel costs.
She is currently undergoing chemotherapy.  She will have to endure getting radiation 5 days a week for 5 weeks.  She has to go to the hospital frequently for checkups and to meet with surgeons and oncologists.  Several months from now she will need a double masectomy.  The cancer has also spread to her lymph nodes and lungs, meaning the treatments will need to be more intense and there may be a need for additional surgeries to get rid of the cancer that has spread.   
My grandma lives on an island in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.  It's pretty isolated up there.  She has to take a ferry and drive 200 miles anytime she goes to the doctor.  Sometimes the weather is bad and she has to pay to stay overnight near the hospital.  When she has radiation she will have to drive 5 hours away to a hospital in Marquette, MI.  It isn't feasible for her to drive that distance everyday for the radiation, so her and my grandpa will have to find a hotel to stay in and pay for travel costs in addition to medical costs.  My grandparents are retired and live on a fixed income.  These expenses are going to be a big financial burden and they are not sure how they will pay for everything.  The medical costs themselves are extremely expensive.  For one treatment alone she needs 10 shots.  Each shot costs her $1000 after insurance has paid their part.  This is only one of the many treatments she is receiving.
She may also go to the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN to get a second opinion.  She could have her treatments done there and enroll in a clinical trial.  If she goes there, the medical costs would increase as well as the travel costs.  However the quality of care would be top-notch and we would know everything that could possibly be done is being done!
We are asking for $25,000 to help pay for some of the medical expenses associated with the chemotherapy, radiation, and all of the surgeries.  Some of the costs will also go to pay for transportation and lodging during the 5 weeks my grandparents will need to be in Marquette for the radiation treatments.  
Anyone can donate!  Donate as little as $1.  Every little bit helps.  Your reward for donating - you can feel good all day knowing that you helped out a loving, kind grandma and put a smile on her face.  Even if you can't donate, how about sharing the link to this fundraiser on twitter, facebook, and other social media sites?  With your help we can show Grandma Karen how much we love and support her!  And we can kick breast cancer to the curb!
 
UPDATE 3/31/13: 
Hi Everyone! Only 6 days left for the fundraiser and we are almost at $2000. Do you think we can make it? I hope so! Share the link again and spread the word. Grandma Karen needs our help.
As an extra incentive, anyone who has donated already and anyone who donates from now on will be sent some of Grandma Karen’s favorite recipes by email after the campaign ends. We all know Grandma loves to cook, she even compiled a huge cookbook for her family a few years ago. One donation means you will get access to recipes for some tasty food – Christmas cookies, the best birthday cake, salads, and dinners. All are Grandma approved!
Thank you for your donations and for your help spreading the word.

story:
Blindsided

A couple of months ago, my aunt was admitted to the hospital for stomach pains and bleeding. Tests later revealed that she had a mass in her liver, but doctors were optimistic that surgery could help her get better.

Further tests brought on less optimistic news. They found that the mass in her liver was metastatic and that they could no longer determine the organ from which the cancer started. The blockage in her bile duct was going to be a permanent situation, and so was the tube coming out of her stomach to drain the fluids from it. The cancer has now spread to her pancreas, and neither chemotherapy nor surgery are viable options.

In a short span of time, all this unraveled. My aunt and our entire family were blindsided.

 

Coming to Terms

Although she was in the loop with the test results, she had yet to receive a definitive diagnosis. 

At her next visit to the oncologist following her stay at the hospital, she was encouraged to ask questions. The first question she asked was "At what stage am I?"

With two daughters ages 13 and 12, she knew that she had to hear the diagnosis no matter how tough a pill it was going to be to swallow. Time was no longer a luxury to be had. With her family at the forefront of all her priorities, her main goal was to exhaust every avenue possible to get better, or to at least buy a little more time.

 

My Aunt

Her name's Maricel. Actually, it's Maria Cecilia Theresa. My grandparents had a lot of fun with names the day she was born. Her six other siblings only bear one name. Just by that merit, she became special. But to the family, she's affectionately called Ceng.

She chose one of the noblest professions I know and became a teacher, taking after my grandmother. I grew up thinking she was one of my stricter aunts, but I now realize that it was her way of imparting the values that she felt were important for us to learn.

Her laughs are infectious, her voice carries across three rooms, and she quite possibly first exposed me to the wonderful world of OCD. She loves her family fiercely, she is deeply connected to her faith, and she lives each day with purpose.

 

About Me

My name is Billy and I am Ceng's niece. My parents had me young, so my aunt in reality was always more like a big sister to me. I have so many fond memories of her and all of my dad's side of the family--the shenanigans at summer trips, the loud Christmas and New Year celebrations (and I'm not talking about the fireworks, either), even weekly visits to my grandfather's grave that only my family can turn into a (literal) picnic.

Six months ago, I became a mom to a beautiful girl. Now, my aunt's plight hits awfully close to home. I look at my daughter and I imagine myself in her shoes. I imagine my daughter in my little cousins' place. In my gut, I know that I would fight the hand I've been dealt just as hard as my aunt is trying right now.

 

With your help...

  • My aunt would be free to explore the natural and alternative solutions she'd like to try to help improve the quality of her life without burning through her family's savings.
  • My aunt and her family can go on trips they've planned on (and maybe ones they never thought they could do) and create more happy memories.
  • You would ease the financial burden that cancer patients are inevitably riddled with.
  • You would contribute to any unforseen medical expenses, and hopefully also augment their family's savings.

 

How You Can Help

If you can relate or even just sympathize with our family's plight, you can help by spreading the word to your family and friends.

There are no perks to be offered, no gifts to be given. Just our appeal to the kindness of others, and our never-ending gratitude that you opened your hearts to us.

story:
I have had the honor to meet someone who has taught me so much about family, life and ultimate happiness. My friend Mark a 28 year old University Professor has done everything “right” in his life, saved money, bought a house, a car, bought his mom a restaurant  and takes care of his parents . Makes a great living in Chinese eyes and is so caring and loving to everyone around him. He is an only child whose only goal is to be a “strong man” and take care of his family.

His dad was diagnosed with Kidney Failure 13 months ago and is father has been on Dialysis ever since. His Kidneys were just removed on 9/3/2012 and right now we are waiting on a transplant. While we wait, Dialysis will continue we have no idea how long this will be or how long he can really keep going without Kidneys. The insurance company is only covering part of the payment, we need to raise an additional $8000 USD. In China the transplant procedure is devastating. When someone is waiting for an Organ they must be prepared at all times with the 50,000 RMB ($8,000 USD) Cost .(AMAZING when in the US this procedure is upwards of $150,000 USD)  If an organ were to present itself and you cannot come up with the cash immediately, you lose the organ. I couldn’t imagine having this pressure, where my parent’s life depends on the money that I do not have. We are so close to saving this mans life and all that stands in the way is $8000 USD.

 

Personally it is my goal to raise this $8000.00 USD for my friend and inspiration. The US Dollar can go a long way here in China. Please help me to help someone who deserves this more than anyone. We have planned many events here In Beijing but the biggest fear is that an Organ will come at any moment and we will not have the money.

Please help us! ANY amount helps!

story:
We are Brandon's caregivers trying to help him get a stool transplant in order to treat his re-occurring C-diff infections, in order to treat his colitis. Doctors have labeled his condition as "Indeterminate Colitis", still not certain whether it was caused by C-diff or an underlying Inflammatory Bowel Disorder-such as Ulcerative Colitis or Crohn's. However, some doctors have had the opinion that his first sigmoidoscopy when he was first admitted to the Hospital in May 2011, showed strong evidence of C-diff perhaps being the cause.

By May 2011, he was going to the bathroom with watery stools and bleeding over 8 times a day, and suffered from anemia, dehydration, and malnutrition. He finally decided he could no longer ignore these symptoms, and forced himself to go to the ER.

A frightening experience awaited him, when he was told the news that these symptoms indicated a "colitis" of some kind and that doctors were not certain what exactly caused these symptoms so suddenly, with no prior history of symptoms such as the one's he was suffering from.

Brandon has been to see various doctors, has had colonoscopy, sigmoidoscopies, and other imaging done. There have been several theories, but no definitive answers on what kind of Inflammatory Bowel Condition he actually has.

The facts remain he showed very few signs of the Inflammatory Bowel drugs working to treat his symptoms, but Vancocin and Flagyl did. Whenever he was on those specific drugs his frequency of watery and bloody stools decreased (from over 13 times to 2 per day), however his insurance would only ever pay for a 10 to 14 day supply and after those days were up, his symptoms would return again, and he would have to wait and wait for results of another stool test in order to prove he would qualify for further drug therapy. Basically, because his symptoms of C-diff have re-occurred, and not resolved, he is considered to be a candidate for fecal transplant.

This condition has been a vicious, debilitating, and life-threatening one, with the cycle continuing on and on with no relief in site. One doctor he has seen will not even consider surgery (which is the standard treatment of Ulcerative Colitis and Crohn’s) unless the C-diff has been resolved. Brandon has been suffering 2 years now with re-occurring C-diff infections and colitis symptoms, and his only hope is a stool transplant.

This campaign is important to Brandon, because it really seems his only chance at recovering from C-diff. We have heard good stories from articles about stool transplants and have contacted a GI clinic that has had successful treatment.

The magnitude of your contribution will dramatically offer a real chance for Brandon to recover from C-diff and potentially improve the inflammation caused by the colitis aspect of it. You will help fund a procedure that has a greater background of safety. You will support a treatment that has saved lives. Your participation will raise awareness of the disease and this treatment becoming more available.

We are in contact with a GI clinic in near Harrisburg, PA.

See articles:

 

 http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/health/story/2012-08-16/deadly-bacteria-hospital-infections/57079514/1

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/11/30/stool-transplants-clostridium-difficile-gut-bug_n_2216991.html

http://www.ctvnews.ca/health/are-fecal-transplants-the-answer-to-c-difficile-1.1075786

http://www.gastrojournal.org/article/S0016-5085%2811%2901634-9/abstract

story:
Anlässlich des Welt-Aids-Tages möchten wir von Do Not Tell on Your First Date und Shirthunters euch ein Angebot machen. Ihr schickt uns eure T-Shirts und wir machen etwas Neues daraus. Für das kleine Re-Design gebt ihr einen Spendenbetrag eurer Wahl, der an die Deutsche AIDS-Hilfe geht. Alternativ gibt es die Möglichkeit für einen Spendenbetrag ab 5 Euro ein selbstgestricktes feuerrotes Kondom von unserem Flyer zu erhalten. 


Unsere Spenden-Aktion


Es gibt also zwei Möglichkeiten zu Spenden.

Zunächst bieten wir euch an, uns eure T-Shirts zu geben oder zu schicken, die folgende Bedingung erfüllen müssen:  Sie zeigen zum Beispiel freiliegende Brüste, entblößte Scham, heraushängende Hintern, oder was auch immer ihr für bedeckenswert haltet. Die Idee: Wir ziehen euren Shirts was drüber, vornehmlich in gestrickter Form. (Siehe dazu auch weiter unten zum Hintergrund der Aktion). 


Step 1: Bitte macht zunächst hier eure Spende in der selbst gewählten Höhe, denn ihr bestimmt, was euch das kleine Re-Design wert ist. Gern variieren wir dann beim Anziehen auch mal zwischen Bikini und Pullover. 


Step2: Schickt uns das Shirt und legt dem Päckchen bitte auch einen frankierten und an euch selbst adressierten Rückumschlag bei. Das Shirt schickt ihr dann bitte an die folgende Adresse:


Thomas Piekarczyk

21669497 Packstation 103

53111 Bonn Germany



Ihr bekommt das umkreierte Stück dann so schnell wie möglich von uns zurück. Wie lang das dauert, hängt natürlich davon ab, wie viele von euch mitmachen.


Wer keine passenden T-Shirts im Schrank hat, kann sich gern auch auf einem alternativen Weg an unserer Spendenaktion beteiligen.


Für Spenden ab 5 Euro (ca $7) bekommt ihr von uns ein gestrickte Kondom, wie es auf unserem Flyer abgebildet ist, zugeschickt. Eure Adresse könnt Ihr uns dann per Mail (thomas@shirthunters.com) zuschicken. Das Porto hierbei übernehmen wir, sodass das Geld auch voll und Ganz dem guten Zweck zufließt.


Die Aktion läuft bis zum 18. Dezember. Alle Re-Designs, für die bis dahin gespendet wurde, werden wir übernehmen.


Wir sind gespannt, was wir von euch bekommen und freuen uns über hoffentlich viele Spenden für die  Deutsche AIDS-Hilfe.


Der Hintergrund


Kürzlich habe ich, Julia von Do Not Tell On Your First Date, im Fundus von den Shirthunters gewühlt und dieses T-Shirt hier zutage befördert.

Das Shirt, bzw. das Mädchen darauf, hat bei mir nicht nur etwas Mitleid ausgelöst, weil sie sich den Platz mit Monstern teilte, sondern auch Beschützerinstinkte geweckt. Ich wusste, dass es bei mir in gute Händen sein würde, ich könnte der Dame ihre Scham nehmen, und ihr etwas überziehen. Einen Tag später trug sie einen selbstgestrickten Bikini und ich warte seitdem, dass sie nach dieser Ent-Schamung auch wieder die Farbe wechselt.


Diese junge Frau ist sicher nicht die Einzige, die so leicht bekleidet, schamvoll von einem T-Shirt blickt, haben wir uns dann gedacht und möchten gern helfen....

story:
Not since Jesus' times has someone attempted to walk on water.  We're going one up on him and doing 5km in an open Gulf for charity's sake - and possibly setting a Guinness World Record in the process (without swallowing too much water). 

Don't worry, we're not the second coming - just trying to raise funds for charity and attempt a feat yet unconquered. 

We're going to walk a cylindrical inflatable - called the ZURF - from Takapuna Beach to Rangitoto Island, a total distance of 5km. 

Why, you ask?

Because the views are great from Rangitoto Island, that's why. 

Plus, it's for a good cause. Plus plus walking this type of distance, or rather- 'walking on water' - on such a device has never been attempted before so we may as well make a go at setting some world record while we're at it (and possibly get in the New Testament?).

Assuming we don't get washed ashore, it'll take us about eight hours to complete, there will be three of us and a safety boat will follow us on our entire journey, which will conveniently double as a 'refuelling station' for our fifteen-percent grape juice (don't be silly, we can't turn water into wine!)

You can follow our four-week journey on the blog as I audition my friends, interview the Harbourmaster, triy to find a Zurf, and raise funds for the quest and charity. 

http://www.yeity.com/features/vow-to-get-dirty-for-carnival#.URSzLOjrbdE

What I'll Need to Walk on Water

I know you're all bursting at the seams to see me take on fast moving currents but here's what I need first to make it happen:

  1. The ZURF itself 
  2. Guiness World Records application
  3. $16 worth of beer on the day... for fuel and all. 
  4. CHARITY MONEY!!! For two awesome organisations. 
 
If we can get the Zurf sponsored - any sums we raise over and above this will go to the wonderful chairty 'The Girl Effect', and Y for Youth.
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I'd really appreciate it if you could help fund some of my madness, but understand that not everyone can contribute, that's not to say you still can't play a vital part in this crusade.
 
To help me on this quest, please share this page with your friends and followers and help spread the word.

Thanks a million in advance!

 

Find Out More

The idea was inspired by a mad South African and took root from the travel website Yeity.  Check out the later to find out more about me (you don't want to know about the mad South African...he's mad).
story_txt:
Not since Jesus' times has someone attempted to walk on water.  We're going one up on him and doing 5km in an open Gulf for charity's sake - and possibly setting a Guinness World Record in the process (without swallowing too much water). 
Don't worry, we're not the second coming - just trying to raise funds for charity and attempt a feat yet unconquered. 
We're going to walk a cylindrical inflatable - called the ZURF - from Takapuna Beach to Rangitoto Island, a total distance of 5km. 
Why, you ask?
Because the views are great from Rangitoto Island, that's why. 
Plus, it's for a good cause. Plus plus walking this type of distance, or rather- 'walking on water' - on such a device has never been attempted before so we may as well make a go at setting some world record while we're at it (and possibly get in the New Testament?).
Assuming we don't get washed ashore, it'll take us about eight hours to complete, there will be three of us and a safety boat will follow us on our entire journey, which will conveniently double as a 'refuelling station' for our fifteen-percent grape juice (don't be silly, we can't turn water into wine!)
You can follow our four-week journey on the blog as I audition my friends, interview the Harbourmaster, triy to find a Zurf, and raise funds for the quest and charity. 
http://www.yeity.com/features/vow-to-get-dirty-for-carnival#.URSzLOjrbdE 


What I'll Need to Walk on Water
I know you're all bursting at the seams to see me take on fast moving currents but here's what I need first to make it happen:

The ZURF itself 
Guiness World Records application
$16 worth of beer on the day... for fuel and all. 
CHARITY MONEY!!! For two awesome organisations. 


 
If we can get the Zurf sponsored - any sums we raise over and above this will go to the wonderful chairty 'The Girl Effect', and Y for Youth.

 
 
Other Ways You Can Help

I'd really appreciate it if you could help fund some of my madness, but understand that not everyone can contribute, that's not to say you still can't play a vital part in this crusade.
 
To help me on this quest, please share this page with your friends and followers and help spread the word.
Thanks a million in advance!
 
Find Out More
The idea was inspired by a mad South African and took root from the travel website Yeity.  Check out the later to find out more about me (you don't want to know about the mad South African...he's mad).

story:
This is Clyde.

A cross between ZZ Top and a lawn gnome, Clyde is a member of the esteemed Weasels a “drinking club with a motorcycle problem,” owner of the small business DirtWerx, and a kick-ass 4x4er. He is also a good friend to many of you and a dad to a Marine, a Navy officer, and me, a normal (but awesome) young lady.

In 2007, Clyde slipped and fell, hurting his back which resulted in him heading to the hospital. This event was painful, but fortunate, because it was on that trip that the doctors discovered advanced bladder cancer. If that cancer had not been found, he may not still be with his family and friends today. Clyde’s battle with bladder cancer was long and difficult, and in the end resulted in him losing an organ that many people don’t even think about.

Life after bladder cancer is not easy. A non-painful hernia resulted post bladder surgery, and worse, Clyde began developing kidney stones as a result of the low grade infection his body was constantly fighting off. Due to the back injury and hernia he spends many nights sleeping in a comfy armchair rather than in bed with my mom (where she likes him).

Clyde had to quit his job. But this didn’t stop him in the slightest. He worked hard to build his own business, DirtWerx, an excavating and digging company.

In September, Clyde encountered complications due to those kidney stones and had a near brush with death. This in turn lead to an extended stay in the hospital and many painful but life-saving procedures. Despite his fear of becoming like that guy in 28 Days Later who woke up to find the world infested with zombies,

Clyde made it out of the hospital.

But, like any medical service rendered, the procedures and supervision time by the wonderful people who saved his life cost money. And, like millions of other Americans, Clyde does not have health insurance (a political subject that we will not discuss here). Unfortunately, this means that times are about to become very tough for this guy that we all love and care about so very much. Possibly resulting in the bankruptcy of the company which he worked so hard to build.

BUT YOU CAN HELP!

How? Well, I'm glad you asked. There are a couple ways

Give To This Campaign

Our goal is to raise $2,500 through this campaign. Helping offset the cost of medical bills and personal expenses (already ranging into the hundred thousands), this money could be the difference between saving or losing his business. Whether it's five dollars, twenty-five dollars, or a hundred dollars, every donation counts and every donation is gratefully appreciated.

Donate your skills, services, or YOURSELF!

In order to help raise funds, we are also putting on a fundraiser in the Denver area on November 3, and you are all invited! The fundraiser will feature a raffle of prizes from local businesses and artists and will include an auction of Denver's most eligable bachelors and bachelorettes!

If you are interested in taking part in one or more of the following, you can contact me through my facebook page at facebook.com/eyaanya:

  1. Donate your skills as an artist by allowing us to raffle off one of your pieces!
  2. Donate your services as a handyman or mechanic for our auction!
  3. Donate yourself as one of our Denver's most eligible bachelors! It's for a good cause, and will be great fun!
  4. Tell your friends! Visit www.fixingclyde.com for more information and for a link to our facebook page.

story:
Hello to you. We are campaigning for Ann Marie, our mother. Ann Marie was diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer in 2008. This type of cancer is much more aggressive and difficult to treat than most types of breast cancer. Read about it here-- http://www.breastcancer.org/symptoms/types/infl.... More recently, the cancer has now metastasized to other areas, causing a multitude of health problems for Ann Marie. Her medical bills and prescriptions for chemotherapy have been difficult to pay and are piling up unfortunately. She is disabled now, and has a limited income. Ann Marie has been fighting this now for 4 years without an end in sight. We really want to eliminate the stress of money for her, and not have her even think twice about accepting a treatment option because of what the cost may be. We would love to be able to take her on a vacation as well, seeing as she hasn't traveled anywhere in over 20 years. She really needs this monetary gift as a boost for her spirits and a reason to keep on fighting this horrible disease. Thank you for taking the time to read about our mother. Any gift to her is a blessed gift and will be truly appreciated by her and us.

 

~Laurie, Leslie & Nick

story:
N.B. Because of the nature of our project we can't put everything in here. So if you'll have any questions(and we bet you will after reading our story), please contact us via Twitter, mail or youtube. We'll gladly answer more! 

Our Story

Hi! I'm Damir Docter and some of you know me as slacker animator who didn't create a thing in the past 2 years. The reason is that I am also a 3rd year student of Russian National Innovation Medical University of Pirogov (slides right of your tongue), so as the few guys from my team.

And we are about to change the very core of Medical Service. Being on the 3rd year I've seen a lot of stuff going on behind the scenes of Med Care. And it sucks! Surely there are a lot of great doctors and hospitals in every country and they can help those who really need help! But the problem is that all hospitals are pretty much divided within themselves. Oncologist never knows what Anesthesiologist is planning to do, and these guys donâ€™t know what Surgeon is up to. Plus you need to keep in the head how to maintain dozens of departments, maintenance, offices and tons of paper work!

What happens on the other side seen by the patient? Let's say you have pain in your chest somewhere near the shoulder. You come in the hospital, you wait in line, then you search for the right room, then you're being told that you need to go to the orthopedic department (and what does this word means anyway?)! Then you're doing your analyses, waiting for another 3 years and after that you're being prescribed some drugs that you should go and buy in the drugstore miles away. 

It's a mess!

Our idea is to fully control every aspect of Patient Care! Build the Ultimate Clinic. Where 3 to 5 doctors are helping them as a standard and where there are only 3 departments which even a normal human being (as opposed to the God-like doctors) can pronounce without much effort: Therapy, Family and Dentistry. How is it possible? By integrating a network system and creating new class of specialist (it's kind of a secret for now). That's it! And why does patient have to worry about some insurance numbers, papers, documents and names of the doctors? Even that problem will be resolved.


The Hospital must be a complex interlinking system and it should be maintained on its own. As a little universe. And the Patient is a center of it!


It's a long shot. But it has to be done. The Medical Care is the last fortress in the modern world that hasnâ€™t significantly changed in centuries.


It's time to push it Forward!


The Impact

- Absolutly new way of intaraction with the patients, where one patient = three doctors as a standart. Means better service and almost 0% of medical mistake and misdiagnosis.

- Easy-to-use system. Only three departments: Therapy, Family, Dentistry. Yet every spectre of possible Medical service is there! So you will still have cardiology, physisons, nephropathology, neuropathology, ophthalmology etc.! But it all will work behind the scene, without any distraction for patient! Leave the long unpronauncable words to the one who use it.

- Medicine is not only about fixing, but also about prevention diseases and keep the body in a good shape. Every clinic will have it's own fitness club, swimming pool and sun bathes. But because all this are the branches of the company - our doctors will always be keeping an eye on you and your progressions. And always be there to help you!

- Atmosphere of the place where you know - here they'll help me! Already in the hall or lobby each assistant or doctor should always ask patient if he needs help. And special construction of the clinic prevents busy doctors to sudenly colapse with the patient, hence less distraction from work. 

- Stylish yet Simple architecture of the Clinic makes it a pleasure to go there. Each department has 8 universal cabinets where YOU decide which cabinet to go to. And each of them has one plus 'two aditional consultant'. Which makes it three doctors. In Each Cabinet! As Standart! Wicked! Also every hall, every room, every restroom, every ventilation shafts are being though and re-though about several times. Every screw in the wall will do it work and be a part of very precise mechanism. 

- No paper works, no insurence numbers, only one 'electronic passport' that will be with you all the time. And we are not speaking about your typical plastic card.

- New reaserch centers. With continius profit, we'll invest it into building new research facilities after which we will have total control of. Means - encouraging young people to do science and discover stuff which will be directly used by our clinics without waiting 100 years until it goes 'public domain'. All because of full integration of Medical Service.

- Begining of something big of which you can be the part of!



What We Need & What You Get

At this point you may ask - Ok, the ambitions of those nice fellows are sky high, but why does they need so little? $18888? Why such random number? It's barely enough to buy some of the drugs let alone to build a Clinic.

Well here is the deal! As this is quite a cumbersome project we've divided the process into 3 stages.


Stage 1:


With your support we'll spend every cent we get on:

   - hiring designers to draw proper concept arts based on our doodles so they could be comprehensible for possible investors.

   - paying for statistic office work. So they could do the analysis of the market, which we personally hate to do, but it's a necessary step to do a proper business plan. Without which the whole idea is just an air trembling.

   - hire some IT specialists and engineers to program the Data Base demo application. Because we need something physical to show to the future investors.

   - lawyer fees. Russia is a bureaucratic country. We need to know everything about protocols, laws, every aspect of it, so we won't get stuck on every underwater stone out there on the later process of development.

   - getting a patent for our ideas. We have a few things that need to be patented. They are pretty neat and also crucial in fulfilling the idea of the Ultimate Hospital. But in order to do it a lot of payments need to be made, which is a shame, because it stops the progress and encourage stealing.

   - paying to the registration office.

The more money we raise - the more things in that list can be done. Means - better chances for the stage 2.

We will keep you posted every step of the way so you could see where every dollar of yours went to!


stage 2:

All these are needed to prepare the reliable presentation for angel investors. Who doesn't know - those are guys just like you! But a bit richer, very interested in searching new creative ideas and making more money out of it. 

With support you'll give us it's 99,9% we'll catch their attention with our project.

And with their money we can start to fulfill our dreams: namely, building the Ultimate Clinic and start searching for professionals we will work with.


stage 3:

After the construction is started and every bureaucratic work is completed - we need to go search for Big Players - Investors!

Even though angel investors could pay for the most work - to expand and finish building the Hospital we need some real big money. 


Why do we need stage 2 then if we could just cut that step and go straight to the Big Guys? Well the thing is, they are very suspicious and tough-headed. No way they'll invest into some utopic idea of medical school students. But when they see that the tedious work already finished, construction have started and everything they need to do is just pay more, they surely be more diplomatic.


Building the future is a risky process. Trying to stop a Goliath in the form of present Medical Services is barely possible. But we'll take our chances! And you can be part of it!


We determent to see this project through to the end! So there is no risk for you if you'll decide to help us. Only your will to try change something! 


*about 8 digit thingy - It's this August Ferdinand MÃ¶bius's stuff which basically means 'to Infinity and Beyond' for us. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even a little contribution will help enormously! But even if you can't do it, either way you can still help! Tell about Those Nutcases Who Want To Declare War To Old-fashioned Medical Services And Organizations to your friends and relatives! Surely there will be enough nice folks who are willing to help any way they want.


We could do it!


Because the times they are a-changin'!

story:
THE CAMPAIGN IS OVER!

NOW WE HAVE TO FIND OUR CHAMPIONS!

The Champions project team of Betty Norlin, Jennifer Broder and  yours truly Randy James, are so grateful to all of the folks that contributed to the Champions for Health project.   Thank you!  But now, the hard work begins!

As a reminder, the goal of this project is to produce a book that showcases 12-15 dynamic individuals who have developed affordable and effective health improvement programs and ideas that can be utilized by the everyman and everywoman to lead happier, HEALTHIER lives.

But first, we have to find our Champions!   While we're excited about our first Champion, Medical Nutritionist Jennifer Broder, we need help finding the rest of our Champions. 

That's where you come in.  We need you to forward us nominations of individuals that you feel should be considered for our final list of Health Champions.  Remember, the final 12 to 15 Champions that we select will have an entire chapter devoted to them in the Champions for Health ebook and print edition.  Please send us  your name and contact info,  the name and contact info of your Champion, and a short description of their health related activities or programs and why you think they should qualify as one of our final Health Champions!   Please send your nominations:

BY MESSAGING US THROUGH FACEBOOK AT:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Champions-for-Health-by-G-Randal-James

OR BY EMAIL TO: 

ChampionsforHealth@jamesgroup.com

PLEASE REMEMBER that we'll consider Champions who have innovative and affordable health programs that address any type of health condition or challenge,  but we're especially interested in nominations of people who have programs or approaches focusing on diet, exercise, nutrition, weight, pain management, sleeplessness, anxiety and depression.  

TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THE INSPIRATION FOR THIS PROJECT AND FURTHER PROJECT DETAILS, PLEASE SEE BELOW!  WE LOOK FORWARD TO RECEIVING YOUR NOMINATIONS!  :-)

 

 

PROJECT BACKGROUND AND OVERVIEW:

My good friend and project team member Betty Norlin and I both dealt with a condition called Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (“CFS”) in our 20’s.  We went from being energetic, optimistic and cheerful young adults to exhausted, weak, and frustrated young adults, unable to even handle routine daily chores due to our acute lack of energy.   Our schooling and careers ground to a halt.  Fortunately, with the help of family and friends, we slowly healed.     We regained our health primarily because we learned to listen to our bodies and we  experimented with approaches that seemed to accelerate our healing process.   Having been hard driving type A personalities, we slowly but surely discovered that reducing stress, eating healthier and fewer  processed foods, reducing alcohol consumption and slowly increasing exercise  were key approaches that helped us heal.  

 

 

 SO FRUIT AND VEGGIES ARE GOOD FOR ME?

 

We consider ourselves very fortunate to have  conquered CFS and regained our health.   Betty and I moved forward with our lives, enjoying full careers and traveling to interesting places.  All was going well and our CFS experience was a distant memory when we suddenly hit MIDDLE AGE!  Now, I’m not saying that this was a bad thing.  On the contrary, by middle age, most people have figured out what makes them tic, and you’re still young enough to look forward to many more of life's adventures.  Middle age, however, is a time when weight, cholesterol, low energy and other heatlh issues can surface. 

Betty and I were absolutely COMMITTED to maintaining our health and the health of our parents.   Frustration set in, however, when we  kept encountering difficulty finding answers to our health questions.  We discovered that too often, medical professionals neither had the time nor the focus to help us address the underlying causes of our health challenges.  It seemed that the preferred approach was to prescribe a pill, with another pill prescribed if the first pill's side effects were too severe, and so on and so on.  We also found it INCREDIBLY hard to keep our weight under control with one diet after another failing us.  We came to understand that our health CARE system had become more of a health SICK system, set up to TREAT diseases, but rarely focusing on PREVENTION.

 

 

WHAT DO YOU MEAN  MY DIET OF HOT DOGS AND BEER ISN'T NUTRITIOUS? 

 

 

A NEW DIRECTION IN HEALTH THINKING:

 

FORTUNATELY, it appears that a new consciousness is starting to arise around health.  It looks like we're finally starting to enter the AGE OF PREVENTATIVE HEALTH.    It cannot come a moment too soon.  In the USA alone, nearly 32% of adults over 20 are now considered OBESE according to World Health Organization statistics.  Amazingly,  23 countries have obesity rates HIGHER than the USA!    Per the U.S. National Institutes of Health, obesity has doubled in America’s children ages 2 to 5 and TRIPLED for young people over the age of 6 in the last 30 years.    When we add to these figures those suffering from chronic pain, high cholesterol, high stress, sleep disorders, anxiety and a myriad of other issues, the magnitude of the health challenges facing us becomes clear.

 

 

 

THIS USED TO BE SO MUCH EASIER!

 

 

This project then is alll about bringing forth the best ideas that we can find to help individuals optimize their own health.  And by this approach, we can help countless individuals PREVENT health problems from arising in the FIRST PLACE.

How are we going to do this?   Well, let's be very clear.  We don’t claim to have any magical solutions.   But what we do have is a PASSION about learning techniques and programs for leading healthier, happier lives and SHARING what we learn with others.  Our book project, “Champions for Health”, will help us fulfill this passion by showcasing a dynamic group of individuals who we are calling our “Champions for Health”.  These Health Champions will be unique individuals, selected from many qualified candidates, for their effective, affordable health programs and approaches.

How are we going to find this dynamic group of “Health Champions”?  To locate many of our Champions, we will develop a Champions for Health  web site and use it to solicit nominations of candidates from the general public.   From the list of nominees, and from our own independent research, 10 to 15 final "Health Champions" will be chosen.  A chapter in the Champions for Health book will be devoted to each Champion, describing not only their unique health program or approach, but also showcasing their inspirational lives and what led them to become a Champion for Health!   Medically trained professionals can certainly be among our final list of Champions, but we look forward to selecting Champions from all walks of life.

One of the MOST exciting aspects of this project is the potential of discovering creative, new, widely unknown or long forgotten approaches to maintaining optimal health.   Not being trained health professionals, neither Betty nor I can endorse or recommend a particular Champion’s program or approach.   And our readers should always consult their medical advisers before starting a new health program.  At the end of the project, our goal is to produce a book that not only provides concrete, easy to use approaches for achieving healthier, happier lives, but just as importantly, inspires people to achieve better health and happiness through the inspirational  lives of our Champions.

 

(PSSST!  THE PROJECT HAS A LITTLE TEASER!)

While we anticipate that the book will not come out until December of this year, we plan to pre-release short "teaser" stories about a few of the Health Champions and their "prescriptions" on the Champions for Health web site on several occasions prior to the book release.  As a contributor, you will have access to these pre-releases.   Just keep checking the Champions-for-Health.com web site and be sure and give us your email so we can send you the access code and project updates!

 

 

WHAT WE NEED:  

 

Frankly, a large portion of project funds raised will be devoted to travel costs AND to providing the great rewards that we're offering to our wonderful Contributors.    We feel that we can tell the stories of our Champions much better if we are able to personally meet and interview them. Therefore, around $15,000 of the project funds will be devoted to bringing our final Champions to us or sending us out to meet with them and around an equal amount will be spent providing our rewards.      For logistical purposes, we are primarily focusing on Champion candidates located in the US and Canada.   However, we will consider Champion candidates from other countries and we are certainly open to interviewing them using Skype, email, phone etc. given that travel costs will be prohibitive for these candidates.

A great deal of time will be devoted to researching the Health Champion nominees that we receive.   Approximately $5,000 to $10,000 of project funds will therefore be used to compensate Betty and others to help sift through the candidates and understand better their programs and health techniques. We will need to check out testimonials for each Health Champion as well.  

The remaining project funds raised will go toward the cost of a web developer to  help us set up the Champion’s web site, and toward covering the production costs of the Ebook and print editions.  If we are able to raise the project funding goal, I think this all can be done.  If not, we plan to still pursue the project, but perhaps with less travel, perhaps 10 to 15 Champions instead of 15 to 20,  and more phone and Skype interviews to save travel costs.  

 

WILL YOU BE MY CHAMPION?

 

 

OUR PERKS AND REWARDS!

 

I am REALLY excited about the perks and awards that this project offers its contributors.  Contributors at every contribution level will obtain at least a Champions for Heatlh Ebook  with signed and print copies of Champions for Health and  Betty’s book Our Bodies: The Optimal Design being important rewards as well.

One VERY UNIQUE reward being offered to contributors is a  Health and Nutrition Consultation("HNC") by Champion Jennifer Broder,  where Jennifer arranges and performs a DETAILED analysis of contributor blood tests,  obtains and reviews nutrition, diet and lifestyle information and delivers individualized lifestyle, diet and nutrition recommendations to contributors.  A HNC can really turn a person's life around.  I have personally known people who have availed themselves of Jennifer’s HNC program and they have been very happy with the results: 

 

"I have referred other gastric bypass patients to her....She has been able to help every one of them".  Katherine, satisfied client. 

"The Membership gave the highest praise for your program....Your presentation was excellent and had us all diving for our pens to take notes...."  Valerie, Programs Committee Co-Chair,  MacDill Air Force Base Officers Spouses' Club, Tampa, Florida.

 

 

Let's not forget another really cool reward being offered to contibutors as well.  At the levels noted, contributors can receive ORIGINAL Champions for Health art wall pieces produced by Teresa Turner, the gifted  Champions for Health artist who produced the official Champions project image that you see below.   Each art piece will be an original 18" by 24" framed wall piece that you can proudly display on your wall.  

Of course, being listed as supporters and Bronze, Silver and Gold Champion Circle members on the project’s print, Ebook and web site are wonderful rewards in their own right as well.   I encourage you to check out the rewards and pick the level that fits you best!

 

PLEASE NOTE:   WHILE THE CHAMPIONS BOOK IS SCHEDULED FOR DELIVERY IN DECEMBER, 2013,  JENNIFER WILL START SCHEDULING HNC'S AND TERESA TURNER WILL START PREPARING ORIGINAL ART  PIECES DURING THE MONTHS RIGHT AFTER THE PROJECT END DATE. CONTRIBUTORS CAN THEREFORE EXPECT TO RECEIVE THEIR ART WORKS AND HNC'S DURING THE JULY THROUGH OCTOBER TIME FRAME.

PLEASE ALSO NOTE:  FOR SILVER AND GOLD CHAMPION CIRCLE MEMBERS, RANDY WILL BE SCHEDULING LECTURE AND BOOK SIGNING VISITS DURING THE JANUARY THROUGH MARCH 2014 TIME PERIOD.

 

THE  IMPACT

 

Think about it.   There are approximately 250 million adults in the USA alone.   If 32% are obese-- not overweight-- but OBESE, that’s 80 million Americans who could benefit from the nutritional, exercise and weight loss ideas that this project can generate. Add to this health programs and tips addressing other health issues as well as the  millions of non-US residents confronting similar challenges, and the potential impact from this project could be big.

Keep in mind that we do not have a rigid,  pre-selected list of health issues that our Champions must cover.    That said, given the prevalence of weight, stress, sleep, nutrition, anxiety, and chronic pain issues, we will make a special effort to solicit and include Champions from these categories.

Please also keep in mind that our goal is to showcase easy to follow, easy to use and relatively inexpensive health programs and approaches.     Examples could be a simple but effective exercise program, a relatively low cost diet or an easy to use technique for reducing stress or enhancing sleep. We feel that people are often intimidated by the cost and/or complexity of many health programs and products.   Our goal with this project is to break through the intimidation and fear factor and make people comfortable with adopting the health ideas being offered by our Champions.

While we’ve never done a project JUST like this, Betty successfully produced her book “Our Bodies: The Optimal Design” while teaching full time and serving as a foster parent.  Betty and I produced the health web site, PitchinintheKitchen.com,  while I was taking care of aging parents, and running a busy law practice.   As a practicing attorney, I am certainly no stranger to meeting deadlines.   I feel confident that with Betty’s help, I can bring this project to fruition!

 

 

 IMAGE BY CHAMPION'S ARTIST TERESA TURNER

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

If you support our campaign, PLEASE help us spread the word using Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth, even your book club!   And please don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out too.    Betty and I want to thank you for your support and we hope that this project in some way can help you find health and happiness throughout your life!
story_txt:
THE CAMPAIGN IS OVER!
NOW WE HAVE TO FIND OUR CHAMPIONS!
The Champions project team of Betty Norlin, Jennifer Broder and  yours truly Randy James, are so grateful to all of the folks that contributed to the Champions for Health project.   Thank you!  But now, the hard work begins!
As a reminder, the goal of this project is to produce a book that showcases 12-15 dynamic individuals who have developed affordable and effective health improvement programs and ideas that can be utilized by the everyman and everywoman to lead happier, HEALTHIER lives.
But first, we have to find our Champions!   While we're excited about our first Champion, Medical Nutritionist Jennifer Broder, we need help finding the rest of our Champions. 
That's where you come in.  We need you to forward us nominations of individuals that you feel should be considered for our final list of Health Champions.  Remember, the final 12 to 15 Champions that we select will have an entire chapter devoted to them in the Champions for Health ebook and print edition.  Please send us  your name and contact info,  the name and contact info of your Champion, and a short description of their health related activities or programs and why you think they should qualify as one of our final Health Champions!   Please send your nominations:
BY MESSAGING US THROUGH FACEBOOK AT:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Champions-for-Health-by-G-Randal-James
OR BY EMAIL TO: 
ChampionsforHealth@jamesgroup.com
PLEASE REMEMBER that we'll consider Champions who have innovative and affordable health programs that address any type of health condition or challenge,  but we're especially interested in nominations of people who have programs or approaches focusing on diet, exercise, nutrition, weight, pain management, sleeplessness, anxiety and depression.  
TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THE INSPIRATION FOR THIS PROJECT AND FURTHER PROJECT DETAILS, PLEASE SEE BELOW!  WE LOOK FORWARD TO RECEIVING YOUR NOMINATIONS!  :-)
 
 
PROJECT BACKGROUND AND OVERVIEW:
My good friend and project team member Betty Norlin and I both dealt with a condition called Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (“CFS”) in our 20’s.  We went from being energetic, optimistic and cheerful young adults to exhausted, weak, and frustrated young adults, unable to even handle routine daily chores due to our acute lack of energy.   Our schooling and careers ground to a halt.  Fortunately, with the help of family and friends, we slowly healed.     We regained our health primarily because we learned to listen to our bodies and we  experimented with approaches that seemed to accelerate our healing process.   Having been hard driving type A personalities, we slowly but surely discovered that reducing stress, eating healthier and fewer  processed foods, reducing alcohol consumption and slowly increasing exercise  were key approaches that helped us heal.  
 
 

 SO FRUIT AND VEGGIES ARE GOOD FOR ME?
 
We consider ourselves very fortunate to have  conquered CFS and regained our health.   Betty and I moved forward with our lives, enjoying full careers and traveling to interesting places.  All was going well and our CFS experience was a distant memory when we suddenly hit MIDDLE AGE!  Now, I’m not saying that this was a bad thing.  On the contrary, by middle age, most people have figured out what makes them tic, and you’re still young enough to look forward to many more of life's adventures.  Middle age, however, is a time when weight, cholesterol, low energy and other heatlh issues can surface. 
Betty and I were absolutely COMMITTED to maintaining our health and the health of our parents.   Frustration set in, however, when we  kept encountering difficulty finding answers to our health questions.  We discovered that too often, medical professionals neither had the time nor the focus to help us address the underlying causes of our health challenges.  It seemed that the preferred approach was to prescribe a pill, with another pill prescribed if the first pill's side effects were too severe, and so on and so on.  We also found it INCREDIBLY hard to keep our weight under control with one diet after another failing us.  We came to understand that our health CARE system had become more of a health SICK system, set up to TREAT diseases, but rarely focusing on PREVENTION.

story:
Moving MS

Move! Meditate! MS! I know! I know! How do you move and meditate at the same time? How do you do it when you have MS? Why do it at all?

It's been scientifically proven that both gentle exercise and meditation helps those with multiple sclerosis. I have remitting/relapsing MS and am working on my PhD in depth psychology and somatics. For my fieldwork (research toward my dissertation), I've been studying and creating classes for others with MS using movement meditation - a combination of qigong, authentic movement, yoga, and guided meditation.

This summer, I'm going to Israel to continue my studies in movement at a dance class called Gaga People. When I return, I'll be teaching a free 6-week movement meditation class to people with MS. 

Your contribution will help me pay for my training and also help me keep the classes I offer free. You'll also be helping me do further research in how to help those with MS better manage their symptoms.

A Thank You!

I'm requesting funding to help me get to Israel for the class and to help me pay rent for the practice space and buy exercise equipment such as yoga mats and chairs for seated movement. 

Any surplus funds will be donated directly to the Multiple Sclerosis Society, which is promoting my class this summer.

For those who donate $200 or more, I will be giving away a signed copy of my newly released novel, The Witching - Book I of the Endor Trilogy.

The Impact

Using different forms of dance, yoga, and meditation have given me a lot more mobility and peace of mind around the sometimes confusing and debilitating symptoms of MS. I'm excited to share what I've learned with others who have MS.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate cash right now, I'd love it if you could spread the word to family and friends about my project!

story:
Hi Everyone! I’m Robbie Kaye and I am a photojournalist originally from New York, now living in Santa Monica, CA. I am so excited to share my project with you! I traveled throughout the U.S. by car, interviewing and photographing women in their 70’s, 80’s and 90’s at the beauty parlor. My goal is to widen the perception of beauty in a culture that is primarily focused on the beauty of youth. My intention is for my images to evoke a new view on aging, to shed light on this almost forgotten generation and to preserve the ritual and technique and the history that these women have contributed so greatly to. These women are our mothers and grandmothers and I would like to make them visible.

I would be so delighted to have your participation in the completion of my work for the documentary, exhibit and book. I am planning to take additional video and photographs. Some cities and states that I have already photographed women in are: Memphis, California, New Orleans, Alabama, Santa Fe and Baton Rouge.

Your participation and funding provides me the opportunity to submit “Beauty & Wisdom” to contests and reviews so it can be presented to reviewers and curators for galleries and exhibits. There are two reviews that will cost at least $4000.00 in total. This includes travel and lodging to where the review is in Portland, OR. The other is in Los Angeles and the cost of 1 review is $100.00 per session. I would like to have at least 5 sessions, 5 chances to get my work in front of people who can represent my project and share it with many. Your support will help me get closer to exhibiting this work that I believe in with all my heart. I appreciate any participation and feel free to send me your stories of your mother or grandmother at the beauty parlor and I just might post it on my blog!

This year I turned 50 and started thinking about the aging process and my options for how I will view the future. As I photographed these fearless women and heard their stories about life, I was inspired and realized that I can look forward to getting older and so can you. This fading generation of women will not be around forever and it is important to recognize their contribution as they paved the way for all of us and to honor their beauty and wisdom that they have earned and are so willing to share.

Perks for the donations will include public thank you(s) on my Beauty & Wisdom blog, Personalized music CD from the Robbie Kaye Band, original photo thank you card, set of handmade cards with signed original prints, signed and matted prints, special thank yous listed in the documentary and book… and a personal portrait (depending on location-this includes your mom or grandmother (70 or over) at the beauty parlor and their possible inclusion in my book, exhibit or documentary).

“…because in the midst of real heartaches that women are experiencing (I hear other customers talk of divorce, cancer, death, etc.) these women are still validating life and doing something positive for themselves, and it’s so true that no matter what is going on in their lives, if they can get to that appointment, all is not lost.”
-Eileen/Imperfect Women (Comment from the Imperfect Women interview with Robbie Kaye)

Her project is called Beauty & Wisdom and it seeks to redefine what the word beautiful means as we age. Robbie Kaye pointed her lens at women in their 70s, 80s and 90s and wants YOU to take the next step.
Katy Widrick, Growing Bolder (Webchat with Robbie Kaye)

story:
Austin Deere was killed Monday night when debris from a severe storm collided with his vehicle.

I would like to set up this fundraising page to help the family cover funeral expenses for Austin. All procedes will go to the family.
