story:
Thank you for making this campaign a success! If you happened to missed the deadline but still want to be a part of #TeamParr2014 and get sweet perks, just email me at andrewDparr@gmail.com.




THANK YOU TO ALL WHO HAVE BEEN A PART OF THIS, I'M HUMBLED.


In the Media:

http://scoregolf.com/blog/bob-weeks/2014/april/parr-meets-his-goal

The Globe and Mail - Roy Macgregor: Plucky Canadian uses crowd-sourcing to get back into the golf game

National Post - Scott Stinson: Faced with the ruthlessly capitalist reality of pro golf, Canadian Andrew Parr tries 'something completely different' in search of sponsors

Huffington Post - Mei Mei Fox: How overcoming a stroke taught this pro golfer the meaning of life

Golf Canada - Andrew Parr: The winding road to pro golf

Wei Under Par - Stephanie Wei: Meet pro golfer Andrew Parr and hear his inspiring story

http://www.lfpress.com/2014/04/25/funding-allows-london-golfer-andrew-parr-to-chase-dream-without-having-to-worry-about-money

CJBK Radio interview



    For most of my life, golf has been at the core of what I do and who I am. 

                               

I was born and raised in London, Ontario, Canada. I won my first top amateur prize in 2004, I was medalist at the Canadian Amateur, top-10 at the US and British Amateurs, and I competed collegiately as an All-American and All-Big 12 with Texas A&M University (2002-2006). In 2007, I turned pro and won my first-ever pro tournament on the Gateway Tour. Then something happened that changed my life....

I had a stroke.


I was only 24 and in what I thought was great health, yet I had a stroke. The event changed my life. My father had died suddenly at age 40, when I was 12 years old. These two events shook me. As I recovered, I grew to see an undiscovered world that lay beyond the golf course. I came to a new appreciation of every day, seeing the good in the people I met, embracing the rich diversity of beliefs and experiences that exist around the world. Rather than just be about winning, I became about living.

Strokes usually cause brain damage. For me it was my left hemisphere (which controls the right side of the body, language and speech). I had to literally re-learn so many things that were once routine.

As I started to get feeling back in my right side, still many simple tasks like typing were nearly impossible. I was stumbling in my speech. This was obviously an extremely frustrating time. I was reteaching myself all basic movement. I would move all day until exhaustion for months on end relearning some functions I had taken for granted. A friend gave me a book on Tedy Bruschi, the Patriots linebacker who would return to football after he had gone through a similar incident. This provided great inspiration to know that I could come back. I became fascinated with how the brain and body works, and human potential.

I was determined to get back to golf.  Six months after having a stroke I qualified for the Shell Houston Open on the PGA Tour. That same summer in 2008 I would tie for firsts before losing in a playoff on the Canadian Tour. I posted another 2nd place a few months later. In 2009, I qualified for and briefly led the U.S. Open after a rain-delayed first day. In 2012, I competed in several European Tour events and played in the final grouping on Sunday in Sicily, where I would finish 6th.  In the Joburg Open I played in the second to last group on Sunday to finish 13th in my European Tour debut.  In 2013, I qualified and played on PGA Latinoamerica. The following are tours and tournaments in which I have competed in:



In the years following the stroke, I traveled around the world, questioned my beliefs and my path, experimented with connections between good health, diet, and nutrition, met many amazing people and learned about their journeys.

All the while, I’ve been trying out new approaches to the game of golf. I’ve been finding connections between the way I’ve changed as a person with the way I need to play on the golf course to win at the highest levels.  I’ve come close many times and am now poised for a major breakthrough for my career. 

Through it all, I have come to fully understand something about myself. I LOVE THE GAME OF GOLF.  It’s a beautiful game, and it’s a beautiful way to learn who you are. People call it a mental game. I feel like it's more of an emotional awareness. To compete and win at the highest possible level. To live with passion, humility, and grace.

Over the years, a small group of dedicated sponsors gave me the opportunity to pursue my professional career. I’m so grateful for their support. This year I am going to try a new approach to sponsorship. My plan is to be sponsored by a collective.

With the proven support of my local community and the network I have formed throughout my career, I’ve found a large community of people who tell me they want to support me on my path. These people see my potential in golf, but also connect with me as an individual as I go through all of life’s ups and downs.

That’s why I want to do something different this year. I want to get a whole community of sponsors like YOU behind me for this 2014 season. No matter the size of financial contribution you make, I want to provide you with access to the world of professional golf and to life as a professional athlete. 

2014 is going to be a big year for me. I've played on nearly every major world tour at some point in my life. I have the industry's best coaches in my corner. I feel more prepared and poised than ever before to take the next major leap in my career.

Now I'm looking for another very crucial part of my team. I'm going to need your help to get there. For 2014, I need $75,000 in financial support to cover the significant expenses (see the full cost breakdown below).

I’m going to provide sponsors with exclusive updates during the season, interactive video calls with Q and A, handcrafted golf bags, hats, and the perfect polo. There are opportunities to receive virtual coaching, or chances to spend a training day on the course. If you run a business, I can take your best clients out for an unforgettable golf experience. There is also a once in a lifetime opportunity to work with the best golf coach on the planet, Sean Foley!

In 2014, I hope to be lifted up by the support of a whole community as I reach for new heights in my career. It's the richness of relationships that make this endeavor worth pursuing. Let’s go do this together.

Thank you!

Andrew

ps- Even if you can’t to be a sponsor, you can still contribute by helping my campaign go viral! Share the video or like the page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pintrest and other social media. Thanks! #TeamParr2014   

          



Video Chat Q and A

Ask me anything! Will send out an invite to sponsors. Interactive video chats via google hangout, skype, etc. Also receive exclusive updates, tips, and upcoming event details.




The Perfect Polo
This polo has been in the works for a few years now. I've worn nearly every polo known to man and created my favorite with my friends at Taylor Stitch in San Francisco. This is a super lightweight cotton micro pique with a touch of lycra for the most comfortable performance polo, timeless style, and great fit. Available in White. Made in San Francisco.


                                                                                          


The Hat

This 5 panel hat is a collaboration with Taylor Stitch. Made in USA. Grey Cotton Twill. Great for on or off the course. This is the hat we will all be wearing as a part of Team Parr.


Belding Golf Bags 
From its inception in 1965,  Belding's commitment to quality manufacturing has not wavered. This hand crafted American vintage carry bag with a leather bottom and shearling top is part of their heritage series. Manufactured for a lifetime of authenticity and experience.


One on One Coaching with Me

Whether you want to shave strokes off your round, enjoy the game more, or feel healthier, let me help point you in the right direction with systems that have been tried and tested over the years. I will provide customized lessons. You will learn the fundamentals of golf and how they affect ball flight, try my favorite practice drills and gym training routines, and learn how nutrition affects performance and health. I have various stages of coaching available to suit your needs. Visit me in San Francisco or Toronto to play and practice. Don't want to travel? I can do virtual lessons, by video chat. Everything you need to be a better, healthier golfer. Junior packages available.


Golf with Lorne Rubenstein 

Lunch and a round of golf with renowned golf author and writer Lorne Rubenstein at a club in the Toronto area. Lorne is one of the most respected writers in the golf world. Spending a day with Lorne on the course and to hear first hand his accounts of the golf world is truly a pleasure! Greens Fees included for you and two friends.


Your chance to work with the best coach in golf!!!

One day of private instruction with Sean Foley. Sean is the coach of Tiger Woods, Justin Rose, Hunter Mahan, among many others. This is an extremely exclusive offer, as Sean Foley is not available for coaching to the general public and only one package is available. You and up to five friends will have the opportunity to spend five hours with Sean in Orlando, Florida. The day includes two hours of morning instruction, lunch, and then two hours of instruction in the afternoon.  This will likely be the most memorable, entertaining and fascinating days of golf instruction you will ever have. This package also includes a round of golf with me. I will meet you in Orlando for a round of golf the day before or after your day with Sean.

This package is available within 1 year.


If there are other perks you would love to see as sponsors, please leave me a comment and I will see what I can do!

.


My Yearly Expenses

I'm planning on playing 20-25 weeks this year. $75,000 will cover my expenses for the full year whether I play a schedule of Monday Qualifying on the Web.com Tour or play on the European Challenge Tour. My weekly expenses are pretty much the same on both tours. I also have costs when working with my coaches.




+   Weekly Caddy $1000 =  $20,000 This would be a huge plus




Q School

Qualifying School is a very important part of professional golf.

European Q School $2,500 entry fee + $8,000 in travel expenses = $10,500

Web.com Q School $5,000 entry fee + $7,000 in travel expenses = $12,000




Thanks for reading!

If you have any questions please feel free to email me at andrewDparr@gmail.com
or leave a comment.

story:
Short Summary

Tyler Jenkins is an amazing person with a sunny personality and smile that is simply unforgettable (as you can see in the photos here). He does not deserve what has happened to him.

On November 12th 2013, the day before his 23rd birthday, Tyler found out he has an aggressive form of bone marrow cancer. Ewing sarcoma is the name of the affliction. It is a very rare form of cancer and is usually not found in adults. After days of rigorous testing, it was found inhabiting his left and right hips, cervical spine, spinal cord, chest, right shoulder, ribs, and liver.

It is believed that this disease has been spreading through his body for around 2 years, but was misdiagnosed as sciatica. So, for the last two years his pain has been growing along with the cancer. He felt helpless to it, but did his best to push through day-to-day life acting like nothing was wrong.

On Friday, November 22nd, Tyler began his first round of chemotherapy. He will continue to get chemo on a bi-weekly schedule (one treatment every two weeks) until further notice. In between these major treatments he will need to be medicated with various drugs for pain, nausea, etc.  

Since the day of his diagnosis, Tyler has spent most of his time inside a hospital and hospitals are expensive! The medical debt accrued from an illness such as this is simply unfathomable. He has minimal health insurance, which isn't going to cover much at all, and no savings to support him through this. He needs our help! The ONLY thing he should be thinking about right now is getting better.

The Impact

Every penny earned here will go to help pay Tyler's medical bills. Chemotherapy, medications, blood tests, MRI's, x-rays, a hospital bed for his home, radiation therapy, hospital stays... that is what your money will buy for a truly deserving person.

Donate and join Team Tyler! Let's ease the financial burden from him so he can focus on what is really important.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially spread the word! The more people who know Tyler's story the better!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Keep Tyler in your thoughts and prayers.

story:
WHY IS DE:TERMINENCE AND THIS CAMPAIGN IMPORTANT?

Whether it’s Cancer or Diabetes, Friedreichs Ataxia or Asthma, Thyroid complications or MS, we all know somebody whose life has been drastically impacted or altered due to a disease or disorder. Some people have inspired us to live every day to the fullest extent possible, and others have unfortunately let their circumstances get the best of them. No matter who you are or what you’re up against, everybody wrestles with hopelessness at times. With the help of our contributors and the mission of de:terminence, we are setting out to inspire hope, create hope, and to show the world that a more fulfilled and engaged life can be lived NOW, no matter the circumstances.

INTRODUCTION

My name is Sean Baumstark and in 2007 I was diagnosed with a debilitating disease called Friedreich’s Ataxia (FA). FA is a rare, degenerative, neuromuscular disease that causes progressive damage to the central nervous system, threatening to put me in a wheelchair and cause an array of other issues including loss of vision, fatigue,  scoliosis of the spine, slurred speech, diabetes, and ending life much too early due to heart disease. Since my diagnosis I’ve run a half marathon, competed on a 12-man relay team running 178 miles in 32 hours, hiked several mountain peaks, pedaled my bicycle from Sacramento CA to Las Vegas NV, competed on a 4-man team in Race Across America (cycling 3,012 miles from coast to coast), and carried the Olympic Torch during the 2008 Olympic Torch Relay.

When I realized that my ability to walk, run, or really get around on my own will eventually go away, I was immediately determined to do what I can, while I can, because I can! I refuse to let my circumstances dictate or govern my everyday life – and I hope to inspire other people to live beyond their own circumstances no matter what disease or disorder they are up against. Beyond inspiring them, I want to help people accomplish their own physically challenging adventures for the sake of awareness, health, and life. 

THE MAGNITUDE OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION

We believe de:terminence can and has the ability to impact the lives of thousands all over the world as we build, launch, and grow. de:terminence is not about Sean or Friedreichs Ataxia. Instead, it’s completely about inspiring, enabling, and assisting others to live a more fulfilled life in the midst of whatever disease or disorder they are up against. Although important, we aren’t setting out to directly fund research or cures…We are on a mission to help those in need of a cure live a more fulfilled life NOW. Hopelessness and a life lived on the sidelines are our enemies.

You will be helping build de:terminence from the ground up. First things first, de:terminence needs to file for 501(c)3 status (non-profit), write our bylaws, put a board in place, and lay all the basic bricks necessary for an organization to legally operate and do so for decades to come. We are not organizing an event, or just looking to influence our neighborhood. Instead, we are facilitating a way of life for people all over the world.

We are looking for people like you to be a part from the very beginning.

We have vision. We have passion. We have courage. We have ambition. We have creativity. We have great talent and advisors behind de:terminence. What we need is a jump start on our startup capital.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

At the very least, we have launched this campaign to enable us to file what is necessary to legally start the organization – from filling for 501(c)3 status with legal help, pay state and federal fees attached to filing, state and federal fees required to start a business, to drafting our bylaws and furthering our launch promotions.

Also, we’ve assembled a team of 12 to compete in the Reno-Tahoe Odyssey, May 31-June 1, in order to raise awareness of de:terminence and promote this campaign. The Reno-Tahoe Odyssey is a 178-mile relay run beginning in Reno, NV running south around the west side of Lake Tahoe and back to Reno via the east side of the lake, non-stop over the course of 30 hours. Some funds raised in addition to startup costs will be used to send our team with all necessary equipment and enhance the team’s promotional efforts and its brand presence during the race (i.e. appropriate gear, supplies, vehicle magnets, etc.). Participation in the Reno-Tahoe Odyssey 2013 is Team de:terminence’s inaugural launch event.

Beyond filing the start of a business, applying for 501(c)3 status, tying up loose ends for the “team de:terminence” relay in the Reno-Tahoe Odyssey, any additional funding will be used toward the design and development of the de:terminence website and the design and implementation of a pilot program for 3-5 individuals in the United States.

No matter what is raised from this campaign, those behind this launch are committed to being transparent with the use of our funds and allowing others to view and advise on the management and expenditure of funds in order to foster strong financial practices, sound use of funds, and allow for accountability.

 

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T HIT OUR GOAL?

All funds will be used to help legally and formally establish and launch de:terminence as a non-profit organization and will advance the vision and passion of its decision-makers to impact the world. The funds raised or lack thereof will not determine the existence of de:terminence, it will however impact the degree and speed at which things develop.
 

THE IMPACT

Many sources tell us that there are over 7,000 rare and orphaned diseases in our world today. Of those diseases, an estimated 30 million Americans are affected and more than ten times that are affected around the globe. Somewhere between 75 and 85% of those diseases are caused by damaged genes. (That “7,000” does not include the more “common” diseases).

Hundreds of organizations, researchers, and doctors are working feverishly to treat, cure, and eradicate some of those diseases. In the meantime, those of us waiting (hoping) for a cure are trying to find ways to live more fulfilled lives - despite disease, disorders, disabilities, and limited financial resource to support the necessities of life AND manage health to the degree that is necessary. (No matter what age, social security and/or disability aid is, in most cases, laughable).

SOME HISTORY

Sean has been able to participate in and accomplish several amazing feats considering his disease. He’s also been given many opportunities to travel and share his story and the vision behind de:terminence, over the last couple years, inspiring hundreds of people to take an interest in the vision and mission of de:terminence. Now it’s time to move people into action in order to inspire and enable others living with a disease or disorder that jeopardizes their quality of life, or life itself.

To see more on Sean and/or de:terminence, please visit            www.seanbaumstark.com

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Make some noise:

Money isn’t everything. Whether you contribute or not, the noise you can make that will bring attention to this campaign is essentially invaluable. We can’t do it ourselves. If you believe in the movement and the legacy that de:terminence is setting out to develop, spread the word about this campaign. Utilize every medium you have in regards to social media – Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, personal websites, blogs, texts, emails, phone calls, faxes and telegrams! Link people to this campaign so that we not only increase the funding potential, but more importantly gain attention for what de:terminence is and what we will do to impact the world. Throughout the length of this campaign, please constantly remind your friends and family to check it out and to share amongst their own circles of influence.

Volunteer your skill:

If you have a skill that may help someone else conquer something great (i.e. trainer, moutaineer, rock climber, cyclist, runner, etc) and are willing to accompany team de:terminence on an excursion(s) to help others achieve, make yourself known. You can email:

info@determinence.com
story_txt:
WHY IS DE:TERMINENCE AND THIS CAMPAIGN IMPORTANT?
Whether it’s Cancer or Diabetes, Friedreichs Ataxia or Asthma, Thyroid complications or MS, we all know somebody whose life has been drastically impacted or altered due to a disease or disorder. Some people have inspired us to live every day to the fullest extent possible, and others have unfortunately let their circumstances get the best of them. No matter who you are or what you’re up against, everybody wrestles with hopelessness at times. With the help of our contributors and the mission of de:terminence, we are setting out to inspire hope, create hope, and to show the world that a more fulfilled and engaged life can be lived NOW, no matter the circumstances.
INTRODUCTION
My name is Sean Baumstark and in 2007 I was diagnosed with a debilitating disease called Friedreich’s Ataxia (FA). FA is a rare, degenerative, neuromuscular disease that causes progressive damage to the central nervous system, threatening to put me in a wheelchair and cause an array of other issues including loss of vision, fatigue,  scoliosis of the spine, slurred speech, diabetes, and ending life much too early due to heart disease. Since my diagnosis I’ve run a half marathon, competed on a 12-man relay team running 178 miles in 32 hours, hiked several mountain peaks, pedaled my bicycle from Sacramento CA to Las Vegas NV, competed on a 4-man team in Race Across America (cycling 3,012 miles from coast to coast), and carried the Olympic Torch during the 2008 Olympic Torch Relay.
When I realized that my ability to walk, run, or really get around on my own will eventually go away, I was immediately determined to do what I can, while I can, because I can! I refuse to let my circumstances dictate or govern my everyday life – and I hope to inspire other people to live beyond their own circumstances no matter what disease or disorder they are up against. Beyond inspiring them, I want to help people accomplish their own physically challenging adventures for the sake of awareness, health, and life. 
THE MAGNITUDE OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION
We believe de:terminence can and has the ability to impact the lives of thousands all over the world as we build, launch, and grow. de:terminence is not about Sean or Friedreichs Ataxia. Instead, it’s completely about inspiring, enabling, and assisting others to live a more fulfilled life in the midst of whatever disease or disorder they are up against. Although important, we aren’t setting out to directly fund research or cures…We are on a mission to help those in need of a cure live a more fulfilled life NOW. Hopelessness and a life lived on the sidelines are our enemies.
You will be helping build de:terminence from the ground up. First things first, de:terminence needs to file for 501(c)3 status (non-profit), write our bylaws, put a board in place, and lay all the basic bricks necessary for an organization to legally operate and do so for decades to come. We are not organizing an event, or just looking to influence our neighborhood. Instead, we are facilitating a way of life for people all over the world.
We are looking for people like you to be a part from the very beginning.
We have vision. We have passion. We have courage. We have ambition. We have creativity. We have great talent and advisors behind de:terminence. What we need is a jump start on our startup capital.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
At the very least, we have launched this campaign to enable us to file what is necessary to legally start the organization – from filling for 501(c)3 status with legal help, pay state and federal fees attached to filing, state and federal fees required to start a business, to drafting our bylaws and furthering our launch promotions.
Also, we’ve assembled a team of 12 to compete in the Reno-Tahoe Odyssey, May 31-June 1, in order to raise awareness of de:terminence and promote this campaign. The Reno-Tahoe Odyssey is a 178-mile relay run beginning in Reno, NV running south around the west side of Lake Tahoe and back to Reno via the east side of the lake, non-stop over the course of 30 hours. Some funds raised in addition to startup costs will be used to send our team with all necessary equipment and enhance the team’s promotional efforts and its brand presence during the race (i.e. appropriate gear, supplies, vehicle magnets, etc.). Participation in the Reno-Tahoe Odyssey 2013 is Team de:terminence’s inaugural launch event.
Beyond filing the start of a business, applying for 501(c)3 status, tying up loose ends for the “team de:terminence” relay in the Reno-Tahoe Odyssey, any additional funding will be used toward the design and development of the de:terminence website and the design and implementation of a pilot program for 3-5 individuals in the United States.
No matter what is raised from this campaign, those behind this launch are committed to being transparent with the use of our funds and allowing others to view and advise on the management and expenditure of funds in order to foster strong financial practices, sound use of funds, and allow for accountability.
 
WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T HIT OUR GOAL?
All funds will be used to help legally and formally establish and launch de:terminence as a non-profit organization and will advance the vision and passion of its decision-makers to impact the world. The funds raised or lack thereof will not determine the existence of de:terminence, it will however impact the degree and speed at which things develop.
 

THE IMPACT
Many sources tell us that there are over 7,000 rare and orphaned diseases in our world today. Of those diseases, an estimated 30 million Americans are affected and more than ten times that are affected around the globe. Somewhere between 75 and 85% of those diseases are caused by damaged genes. (That “7,000” does not include the more “common” diseases).
Hundreds of organizations, researchers, and doctors are working feverishly to treat, cure, and eradicate some of those diseases. In the meantime, those of us waiting (hoping) for a cure are trying to find ways to live more fulfilled lives - despite disease, disorders, disabilities, and limited financial resource to support the necessities of life AND manage health to the degree that is necessary. (No matter what age, social security and/or disability aid is, in most cases, laughable).
SOME HISTORY
Sean has been able to participate in and accomplish several amazing feats considering his disease. He’s also been given many opportunities to travel and share his story and the vision behind de:terminence, over the last couple years, inspiring hundreds of people to take an interest in the vision and mission of de:terminence. Now it’s time to move people into action in order to inspire and enable others living with a disease or disorder that jeopardizes their quality of life, or life itself.
To see more on Sean and/or de:terminence, please visit            www.seanbaumstark.com
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


Make some noise:
Money isn’t everything. Whether you contribute or not, the noise you can make that will bring attention to this campaign is essentially invaluable. We can’t do it ourselves. If you believe in the movement and the legacy that de:terminence is setting out to develop, spread the word about this campaign. Utilize every medium you have in regards to social media – Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, personal websites, blogs, texts, emails, phone calls, faxes and telegrams! Link people to this campaign so that we not only increase the funding potential, but more importantly gain attention for what de:terminence is and what we will do to impact the world. Throughout the length of this campaign, please constantly remind your friends and family to check it out and to share amongst their own circles of influence.
Volunteer your skill:
If you have a skill that may help someone else conquer something great (i.e. trainer, moutaineer, rock climber, cyclist, runner, etc) and are willing to accompany team de:terminence on an excursion(s) to help others achieve, make yourself known. You can email:
info@determinence.com

story:
Hello, my name is Janine Morris. I'm about half way through a masters degree in Somatic Counseling Psychology, and I am passionate about embodiment, and developing resources within the body.

For the next stage of my journey, I would like to enroll in a 3 year Somatic Experiencing training, to give me the skills to work with individuals dealing with trauma. Please help me to fund the first of this 3 year training!

Somatic Experiencing

Somatic Experiencing is a somatic therapeutic modality developed by Dr. Peter Levine. He based it upon the realization that humans, like all animals, have an innate capacity to overcome the effects of trauma. Our bodies contain a profound capacity for resilience and self-regulation.

Animals in the wild experience instances of traumatic stress on a daily basis, yet continue on every day with the full range of their physical and emotional resources.

Humans, however, seem to now live lives that do not allow for a natural discharge of the energy accumulated in the body by experiences of trauma. When the body perceives a threat to itself, the pre-reptilian brain mobilizes huge amounts of energy, and floods the limbs with it, giving it a set of instructions for how to avoid danger. These instructions need to be fully carried out in order for the energy to be discharged. It is when we do not carry out these instructions for safety, or our bodies are not given given the time, space and containment to fully discharge that this energy gets stuck and leads to issues like PTSD, chronic pain and anxiety.

Somatic Experiencing is a type of therapy that works to release these blockages from the body by utilizing our natural abilities for resilience.

The first rule of any therapy is always safety. A client and therapist must build a rapport before healing work can be done. A somatic therapist, especially one practicing SE, must also be very attuned with the signals coming from their own body, and those of their client. They must be able to tell my looking at and listening to someone if their nervous system in a socially engaged state, hyper aroused with fear or anger, or immobilized with trauma. This recognition will help them guide their client along their journey, making sure the charge is manageable, and the client does not become re-traumatized or frozen. Recognizing these signs requires a great deal of self-work and training. 

Therapist and client go on a journey together, this begins by the therapist promoting safe exploration of the body. For many traumatized people, the body does not feel like a safe place. A therapist will help a client focus in on specifically what feels good in the body, what feels joyous and expansive. Once these resources are found they can be expanded, becoming just as big as the trauma. The client can move between these good sensations, and the sensations of trauma and anxiety, taking in a little bit of each at a time. This demonstrates to the client that they have choice, that they are not a victim of the frightening sensations in the body.

This act of switching between sensations is called pendulation. Pendulation creates a rhythm, which helps the body become unstuck. 

Slowly, over time, client and therapist can tap into the sensations arising from the muscles, and follow them as they turn into gestures, movements and emotions. With guidance from a therapist, a client can allow these movements to play themselves out, old instructions are able to play themselves out to completion, and stuck energy can finally be discharged, a little at a time.

With every little bit of energy discharged, we have a little piece of ourselves back. More of us is in the present, no longer stuck in the past, looking to repeat past traumas for reasons we can't understand.

Underneath defeated and collapsed muscles remain the active responses that were ready to protect us. The body learns it not a helpless victim!


Please support me!

By contributing to my training, you are helping me to become one of those embodied therapists who can sit and attune to another, and help them find the freedom, ease and wellness in their body that is their birthright.

Not only would I like to work on an individual level, but I would like these skills to help me support my community, creating a space of safety, understanding and spaciousness that perhaps allows less trauma to become stuck in the first place. If we can build an understanding of how trauma becomes locked in our bodies, and it's impact, perhaps we can all gain the skills to support each other when traumas occur. That may mean something along the lines of learning to slow down. To sit on the ground with a friend when they've gotten hurt, holding their hand, and letting their body tremble rather than encouraging them to get up right away and running for the band aids.

I would like us all to be able to move through life with flow and resilience, with the full range of our resources at hand.

Any contributions are greatly appreciated!

My goal of $2550 goes towards:
3 4-day weekend training sessions at $750 each
4 required consultations at $75 each.

Thank you!

Check out http://www.traumahealing.com/somatic-experiencing/




Here are pictures of some of the prizes:


Handmade nontoxic tinted lip balms:



custom framed glass paintings:

  


Organic raw pie:




Handmade custom leather journals:

story:
Short Summary

My name is Adam Reed and Mixed Martial Arts training has been a passion of mine for quite some time now. I've moved around a bit lately and my training slowed down because of that, but I'd like to get back into it and expand both my abilities and knowledge.

What We Need & What You Get

I jumped into this goal by putting down all of the money that I needed for the first month's membership at a Muay Thai gym. For each month's membership fees I'll need $160 dollars, or if I want to add Jiu Jitsu (I do) it'll be an additional $60 for a total of $220. My goal is to get the first three months paid for, and if I have success with this then maybe more! 

The reason I have set the dollar amount at $710 is because IndieGoGo takes a small fee in order to cover their costs. If we raise $710 I'll get exactly $660 dollars and be able to pay the gym membership.

The Impact

I've been super close to this dream before but I haven't quite been able to attain it. With your help I know I can make it happen, and I'll even keep you updated with progress on my Facebook page!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help me out but can't afford to donate anything there are still ways to help! Share my page with people you know, talk about my goal with your friends, anything helps. I'm pretty sure if enough people get behind me on this the sky is the limit!

story:
Hello World. As you may already know the Philippines have been hit with a powerful typhoon named Haiyans. This has caused mass destruction across there country. Injuring and killing thousands of people and also cutting power to homes. 

We need your help!

We need power generators to help power homes for around 5 - 10 families. The purpose of the generators are to provide power to people so they can cook food and also keep warm. 

Donation:

Anything you have will be a big help whether it's from $5 - $100.  We are very grateful for anything you can give. 

Facts:

Haiyan’s Impact:

  • An estimated 10,000 people killed
  • An estimated 330,900 people displaced 
  • 4 million children affected


Please help by donating money to this cause and make our Christmas Special.

story:
Short Summary

Who am I? 

Hi! I'm Lakshman Mody. I LOVE TEA! Follow me and join the anti-oxidant movement!

I recently graduated from Northwestern University with a degree in Economics and I am currently a masters student at the Kellogg School of Management.  I am from Bethesda, MD, I like to learn, and I love to make things.


Why did I create these teas? 

Throughout college, I always wanted an edge.  I wanted some way to move faster and think deeper.  I started drinking coffee in the mornings, but would only feel a short performance boost and then feel terrible the rest of the day.  So I started looking for a better solution.  I knew that I LOVED  tea.  Tea comes in delicious flavors and is rich in antioxidants and caffeine.  However, I noticed that tea did not give me the same energy boost that I got from coffee.  

Through my interest in how the brain works, I tried many different memory enhancers and finally discovered lion's mane mushroom, which "can induce NGF (Nerve Growth Factor) synthesis in nerve cells."  NGF determines the rate at which new brain cells are produced.  Essentially, it helps with your memory (and even your mood!).  Incorporating lion's mane mushroom and caffeine into tea gave me the edge that I needed, and I hope to share that edge with everyone else.  One example of the edge it gave me...  As brain enhancing remedies like Nootropic Tea come on the market, you DON'T want to be competing at a disadvantage!

Go to articles on lion's mane mushroom:

1. National Center for Biotechnology Information Article 1

2. National Center for Biotechnology Information Article 2

3. Fun One: Huffington Post


What's the status? 

I have already created my first batch of custom tea blends: Ginger Apple Black Tea, Apricot Cherry Green Tea, and Mango Orange Oolong Tea. 

You may request the teas with lion's mane mushroom and caffeine, just caffeine, or just lion's mane mushroom.

The teas smell great, taste great, and look great too. Now, I need your support to take this to the next level.


Why our tea is great for you:

The benefits of drinking Nootropic Tea are extensive, since we are combining three extremely healthy ingredients - tea, lion's mane mushroom, and caffeine - so we get all of the benefits in a single drink.

  • Benefits of Tea: High in antioxidants, cardiovascular benefits, synergy with antibiotics, helps fight free radicals, lower waist circumference
  • Benefits of Lion's Mane Mushroom: Helps your memory abilities and keeps you brain healthy by repairing nerves
  • Benefits of Caffeine: Increases memory, replenishes muscle glycogen, detoxes the liver, but most importantly, GETS YOU GOING!

Best way to drink: Brew and drink in the morning while eating eggs.  This way, you get an ample source of choline (used for production of cell membranes) from the eggs and the tea can be ultra-effective!

Can be enjoyed hot or cold.

What You Get

I've got some great perks for you for donating (listed on the right), but lets see the teas you will be getting!

Ginger Apple Black Tea

Apricot Cherry Green Tea

Mango Orange Oolong Tea

How we compare:



Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute financially.  That's okay!  If you believe in my ability to make these teas into a business, I am asking you to:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools listed at the top of this page!
  • And just in case you were wondering, if I don't reach the goal, I will use the money raised to push the project forward regardless.

In the Future

  • I hope to release other nootropic blends with new and enhancing additives!
  • If you have question, please shoot me an e-mail at lmody2014@kellogg.northwestern.edu
  • Twitter: @LakshMody


Legal Disclaimer

  • The claims made about Lion's Mane Mushroom are based on the studies cited by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (study links listed near the top)
  • This statement has not been evaluated by the FDA.  This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

story:
Hi, my name is Nancy Mobley and I am raising money for the seniors we have rescued from abuse and neglect. My partner, Burt Nydahl and I own and have operated Oceanview Retirement since 1999. Most of the seniors that are in our care have been neglected or abused by either their families or the system or both.

These seniors have diminished mental and or physical capabilities but the health care system has determined they are "not yet ready" to be moved into a "facility", so they try to survive on very limited incomes while falling deeper through the widening cracks in the system. This is their shocking story.

Six years ago a home support worker told us about a man living in a small trailer in our town. The worker told us the man didn't know where his family was and he was living on a small $900 a month pension. The trailer was all he could afford.

 That day she was particularity concerned because it was snowing. My partner and I found him inside, huddled by his heater. The front of the trailer had a large gap in the siding and you could actually see the ground outside. We could see his breath when he spoke. We invited him to come with us to Oceanview and have lunch. He stayed with us for two years and he was the first of about 20 seniors we have since rescued.

 Another living in a 100 bed senior complex called to tell me she was being "kicked out". I asked our handyman and his 20 year old helper to come with me to collect her and her belongings. When we got to her room, it required both guys to push the junk out of the way of the door before we could get inside.

When we did get the door open, the smell of urine was overpowering. There was so much debris everywhere you couldn’t see the floor. The bathroom was a total mess, with pills and even used toilet paper on the floor. We had to leave her belongings behind because the complex had a bed bug infestation.

The first thing we did was to put her in the bath to check for the nasty beasts. While she was relaxing in the warm water, with tears in her eyes, she told the care aide that "this was the first bath she had in ages".  I called her family to tell them she was staying with us. Her daughter told me she had tried to get her mom to clean the apartment but she would get angry, so she was left to live in filth and squalor. She has been with us now for two years and has brought us all so much love and joy.

 Another man had moved in with his daughter-in-law after his son died. Within two years the daughter-in-law had spent all his money and then literally dumped him on our door step. She said that she just couldn't put up with him anymore. He is the most quiet, polite man I know.

 Oceanview provides volunteers to take these people to doctors, dentists and even the ER when families can't or won't and of course we pay for the gas. We buy diabetics special foods so they can eat desserts like the other folks. We buy toothpaste and soaps, haircuts and even disposable undergarments for the incontinent.. On one occasion we even bought an entire wardrobe when the lady had to leave all her infested clothes behind. We bring in entertainers to visit. All these things cost money which we don't receive from our residents, but it is these very things that give our seniors back their dignity.

Oceanview was managing to get by until this last year. when our property taxes were vastly increased. With the rising cost of doing business, we are now struggling. Our bank has been great but we are coming up short each month. We will not close our doors- that's the promise we made to our residents and to God a long time ago.

If you are not in a position to help financially, please let your friends and networks know about our work. Perhaps they can help.

 

OUR TRACK RECORD

A few years ago, Oceanview was involved in a study of nursing homes specializing in dementia in British Columbia by a student from Bath England getting her Masters. Read her full report on our website.She determined that Oceanview should be the model for all nursing homes for people living with dementia in Canada. She said that we were the most home like she had ever seen.

She was delighted that we tell each resident that this is their home and they can have visitors whenever they want. They can invite friends and family to dinner whenever they want and they can hang pictures on the walls and stay up till they want to go to bed. They even get up when they want to get up in the morning.

When people first walk into Oceanview, they don't realize that it is a nursing home. There are no rules and regulations posted on the walls, only art. There are no names posted by each bedroom. Everyone sits at one big long table for all meals and the staff eat with them just like at home.

We encourage families to drop in anytime and if it's meal or tea time, they eat with us. We celebrate individual birthdays, just like at home. The only thing we do have in common with institutions is that each bedroom has a number in case of an emergency.

WHERE THE MONIES WILL BE SPENT

The monies we receive will fund some of the necessities of life that we take for granted such as the toothpaste and soap I talked about earlier. We will be able to hire a part time coordinator to ensure our residents have both sensory and mental stimulation on an ongoing basis rather than a once monthly visit by a volunteer.

We will be able to buy clothing or a new pair of eye glasses, even make sure a dentist sees our residents at least once a year. We will finally be able to start the long planned for vegetable garden built closer to the house for our not so able gardeners to tend. We will be able to consult a dietitian to make sure our residents receive the proper nutrition.

 Our commercial dishwasher is held together with prayers so if there is any extra that would be a bonus! Even our repair man would thank you!
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Nancy Mobley and I am raising money for the seniors we have rescued from abuse and neglect. My partner, Burt Nydahl and I own and have operated Oceanview Retirement since 1999. Most of the seniors that are in our care have been neglected or abused by either their families or the system or both.
These seniors have diminished mental and or physical capabilities but the health care system has determined they are "not yet ready" to be moved into a "facility", so they try to survive on very limited incomes while falling deeper through the widening cracks in the system. This is their shocking story.
Six years ago a home support worker told us about a man living in a small trailer in our town. The worker told us the man didn't know where his family was and he was living on a small $900 a month pension. The trailer was all he could afford.
 That day she was particularity concerned because it was snowing. My partner and I found him inside, huddled by his heater. The front of the trailer had a large gap in the siding and you could actually see the ground outside. We could see his breath when he spoke. We invited him to come with us to Oceanview and have lunch. He stayed with us for two years and he was the first of about 20 seniors we have since rescued.
 Another living in a 100 bed senior complex called to tell me she was being "kicked out". I asked our handyman and his 20 year old helper to come with me to collect her and her belongings. When we got to her room, it required both guys to push the junk out of the way of the door before we could get inside.
When we did get the door open, the smell of urine was overpowering. There was so much debris everywhere you couldn’t see the floor. The bathroom was a total mess, with pills and even used toilet paper on the floor. We had to leave her belongings behind because the complex had a bed bug infestation.
The first thing we did was to put her in the bath to check for the nasty beasts. While she was relaxing in the warm water, with tears in her eyes, she told the care aide that "this was the first bath she had in ages".  I called her family to tell them she was staying with us. Her daughter told me she had tried to get her mom to clean the apartment but she would get angry, so she was left to live in filth and squalor. She has been with us now for two years and has brought us all so much love and joy.
 Another man had moved in with his daughter-in-law after his son died. Within two years the daughter-in-law had spent all his money and then literally dumped him on our door step. She said that she just couldn't put up with him anymore. He is the most quiet, polite man I know.

We buy diabetics special foods so they can eat desserts like the other folks. We buy toothpaste and soaps, haircuts and even disposable undergarments for the incontinent.. On one occasion we even bought an entire wardrobe when the lady had to leave all her infested clothes behind. We bring in entertainers to visit. All these things cost money which we don't receive from our residents, but it is these very things that give our seniors back their dignity.
Oceanview was managing to get by until this last year. when our property taxes were vastly increased. With the rising cost of doing business, we are now struggling. Our bank has been great but we are coming up short each month. We will not close our doors- that's the promise we made to our residents and to God a long time ago.
If you are not in a position to help financially, please let your friends and networks know about our work. Perhaps they can help.

She was delighted that we tell each resident that this is their home and they can have visitors whenever they want. They can invite friends and family to dinner whenever they want and they can hang pictures on the walls and stay up till they want to go to bed. They even get up when they want to get up in the morning.
When people first walk into Oceanview, they don't realize that it is a nursing home. There are no rules and regulations posted on the walls, only art. There are no names posted by each bedroom. Everyone sits at one big long table for all meals and the staff eat with them just like at home.
We encourage families to drop in anytime and if it's meal or tea time, they eat with us. We celebrate individual birthdays, just like at home. The only thing we do have in common with institutions is that each bedroom has a number in case of an emergency.

We will be able to consult a dietitian to make sure our residents receive the proper nutrition.

story:
We're here to raise money for Malea Tabora medical expenses,treatment, adaptive equipment that her insurance doesn't cover.

 

Malea is a 2 year old little girl. Her mom found her not breathing January 1st 2012 and has been  determined to have had a stroke somewhere between birth and 9 months old. She now suffers from seizures and spasticity in both legs which she needs to wear braces on both legs. At nights she wears a monitor to measure her oxygen level and sets off an alarm if it drops to low.. She has had 2 surgeries and has been hospitalized 5x in the  last 2 years.

 

She has recently been diagnosed with Periventricular Leukomalacia, Cerebral palsy and epilepsy. Malea also receives Physical Therapy 2x a week, Speech 2x a week and attends a group therapy 1x a week.

 

We are hoping to raise money to cover expenses for her medical that aren't covered.

*Buy an oxygen machine 

*New leg braces

*Attachments to her monitor she wears at night so her parents don't have to keep re using and taping the old ones on.

 

Yesterdays Neurology appointment Maleas family was told that since her muscles were getting worse there is a good chance she will eventually end up in a wheelchair..

 

I understand not everyone is able to donate but anything is helpful. Even a dollar or just toshears this link on your page.  And THANK YOU!

story:
I'm Christopher Bell, and this is the story of one of the greatest men in my life, my step-father, Daniel Gonzalez.

Danny was diagnosed in September 2012 with Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma, a type of Throat and Sinus Cancer. This diagnoses has hit our family like a freight train. So many thoughts and emotions have run wildly through our heads, thoughts of "What is going to happen to Dad?", "How could this happen? He's never smoked a cigarette in his life, and he doesn't drink alcohol." to "How in the world are we going to pay for our medical expenses??". Danny's doctor, Dr. Katz and Dr. V has said that this is a curable form of cancer. They said that it reacts very well to Radiation Treatment.


I started this campaign to try and help with our costs for his medical bills. Even though he has medical insurance, our co-pays and out of pocket expenses are going to be astronomical! Everything from his Radiation treatment, Chemotherapy, CT Scans, Prescriptions, and anything over-the-counter that he is going to need.

Our family has banded together and started to pool all of our money to help with these costs, but we all know that it won't be enough to cover everything.

Let me give you a little background on Danny. He was born in New York City in 1964 and grew up in the Bronx. He is the son of Audrey and Nelson Gonzalez, both moved here from Puerto Rico. When Danny graduated high school, he enlisted in The Air Force where he served as an Air Traffic Controller for 10 years as Active Military. After a decade of service he went into The Air National Guard. He was stationed at Vance Air Force Base where he met his first wife, and the mother of his 3 children, Austin, Jordan, and Kelsey. Unfortunately Danny and his first wife went their separate ways and Danny was re-located to Biloxi, Mississippi where he met his second wife, Dawn and her 3 children, Christopher, Michelle, and Joshua. After 20 years of Active and Reserve duty, Danny was Honorably Discharged from the Air Force. Since his discharge, he has started working as a restaurant manager at Cheddar's Casual Cafe. Dan is very passionate about his work.

Danny is a God fearing, dedicated father to his children and step-children, and a loving and faithful husband. Danny has always looked at his step-children as if they were his own.

What we need.

We are looking to raise anywhere from $3000 to $5000 (if we raise more, that's fantastic!) for Danny's medical expenses. Now I know what you are thinking, how is $3000-$5000 going to pay for all of his medical bills?? The answer is, it's not. We are not looking for all of his bills to be paid for by contributors, we are just looking for some help, something to "Cushion" us if you will. That way we can still put food on the table, pay our rent, pay our electric bill. Something to help ease us financially. I know that times are hard right now for a lot of people. And to be honest, we really can not afford this by ourselves.

Where will your contributions go?


I will be setting up a savings account for the contributions. 100% of the contributions will be going to Danny's medical bills, Doctor visits, CT Scans, Biopsies, Radiation treatment, Chemo Therapy, Prescriptions, Over-The-Counter Medications, and any Hospital stays. 

Whether we reach our $3000 goal or not, 100% will go to his medical expenses.

Whether you can donate $1 or $1000, any little bit of help will not go unnoticed and is very gratefully accepted. And we warmly thank you for anything that you can spare!

Can't help financially but still want to help?


I understand that these times are hard for a lot of families out there, and even if you can't help financially but still want to help, I ask that you please share this story with other people. I want the world to see what a great man my step-father, Danny, really is. This man has given his family everything he has. He has given the shirt off his back, the last dollar out of his wallet just to help other people. This man is full of love and happiness. Meet the man once, and he will leave a very memorable, life-lasting memory with you. 


In closing, I want to reach out to everyone reading this and say thank you, from the bottom of my heart. Any form of help that you can give to our family is very appreciated. Cancer is a very tough thing to deal with, and I would never wish it on anyone. But if we can all come together and share our resources, we can beat this demon known as cancer!

Thank you for lending me your time and may God bless everyone of you,

Christopher Bell

Cure 2012!

story:
So many people have asked me what they can do for my dad during his treatment. First and foremost, he has been overwhelmed with all of your prayers, positive thoughts, and well wishes he has received. PLEASE keep them coming, as they help him stay positive from day to day!

Secondly, he could use a little financial help. He is pushing through like a trooper but he has not been able to work since treatment started and he has about a month to go. Maybe all his loving family and friends he has made throughout the years can give him one less thing to worry about as he focuses on KICKING CANCER'S BUTT!!! Due to tough times, I realize not everybody can donate, but PLEASE continue to keep him in your thoughts and prayers!

Thank you!! (If you know my dad, he is probably going to kill me for doing this! ;)  )

 

Melissa <3 XoXo <3

story:
My 10 year old niece Jaelyn and 5 year old nephew Kasen, have Cystic Fibrosis (CF).  CF is a genetic disease affecting most critically the lungs but also pancreas, liver, and intestine.  Early July, Jaelyn was diagnosed with diabetes, another side effect of CF.  On July 19th, Jaelyn was admitted to the hospital with psuedomonas aeruginosa - an infection in her lungs.  Psuedomonas is an especially bad infection for those with CF because of the amount of damage it does to the lungs and how resistant it is to antibiotics.  Jaeyln has been released from the hospital but will have a PICC line in for about another week, receiving strong antibiotics 4 times a day.   Jaelyn is one of the strongest people I have met!  While she has her moments, for the most part her spirit has been positive!

Fortunately, my sister Rachel, brother-in-law Jason, and their oldest daughter Makenzie (15) were able to be with Jaelyn in the hospital.  Unfortunately, Rachel cannot return to work until the PICC line is removed.  Jason and Rachel's time off work has been and will all be unpaid.  You can imagine the stress it would be to go without 2 weeks of pay in a normal situation, but when you couple that with the medical bills associated with this hospital visit and CF in general, it is compounded greatly.

My sister is not one to ask for help - even when she really needs it.  So I am asking for help to address some of these recent medical expenses. Any amount you may be able to donate would be extremely helpful!!  If you can only help with prayers - we are extremely grateful for them too!


Thank you so much!

Jaelyn and Kasen's Aunt Maria

story:
Seniors Should be Gardening, too!

Sage Gardeners, a federally registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization was founded in 2010 by master gardener Jonquil Nelson. Raised on an Indiana farm and a granddaughter to a man that lived for tilling the spring earth and salting his sun-kissed tomatoes, Jonquil realized that she needed to give gardens back to the many seniors that once put their hands through the soil. Many grand and wonderful organizations focus on farm to school and farm to table, but Jonquil couldn’t find one in Montana that focused on reconnecting seniors to their gardening roots.

Sage Gardeners provides accessible, raised organic vegetable gardens to disadvantaged seniors in both senior retirement communities and private residences in Montana. Our goals as an organization are simple: provide gardening to disadvantages seniors as an opportunity to enhance their quality of life. Some benefits for seniors who garden: improvement in nutrition by eating fresh, clean vegetables, reducing isolation with social interaction with volunteers, neighbors, and other community members, increase in mental stimulation, and improvement in mobility and flexibility by increasing physical exercise.

What it Takes to get a Senior Outside and Gardening - Not Much!

Sage Gardeners focuses primarily on two program areas: retirement communities and private residences. Not only do we build, fill, and assist in planting, but we aide in maintaining these gardens indefinitely. Our goal is to get elderly seniors independently gardening; though we modify each garden and assistance to the senior’s ability. We serve elderly, aging, seniors with low- moderate income; veteran seniors, minority seniors; and disabled seniors; we do not discriminate. We offer our services to any senior that wants our help and shows a need. 

2012 was met with much success that we have a waiting list for this year’s garden recipients. We have three retirement communities that need our help and several private residences on a wait list, just for 2013 alone. We need your support to get the garden built!

Any funding received goes straight into Sage Gardeners senior gardening program to help build gardens for seniors. Funds will be used for program support, greenhouse support, materials for building and constructing accessible pathways and gardens (lumber, hardware, or old feeding tanks/troughs); gravel; fill: organic garden soil and compost, mulch; organic starts (small vegetable plants) and seeds, purchasing small hand tools, gloves, hoses, sprayers, and if needed sun shades or trees for the retirement communities. We will also use funding for additional supplies that seniors may find useful and helpful while gardening. We will continue to build gardens as funding is received even as late as September or October… that just means an earlier start for next spring to plant peas, carrots, and greens!

       

The Impact

Many studies have been done on healing environments and elderly. Through these studies, they have found both psychological and physical benefits from incorporating natural environs, ie gardens, into peoples lives. Sage Gardeners works to bring purposeful activities into seniors lives to therefore increase their quality of life. We serve elderly, aging, seniors with low- moderate income; veteran seniors, minority seniors; and disabled seniors; we do not discriminate. We offer our services to any senior that wants our help and shows a need.

Other Ways You Can Help, it's Not just about a Donation!

Please, help us grow and consider supporting the work and growth of Sage Gardeners. 

You can contribute in one of the following ways: 

  • Volunteer this upcoming season, 
  • Spread the word of Sage Gardeners' work,
  • Visit our website to learn more: www.sagegardeners.org,
  • donate today through indiegogo.com

Many seniors will be impacted by your generosity, and for that, we thank you!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jessica McKay and I'm passionate about healing! I'm a spiritual teacher and an intuitive guide who offers healing messages from spirit guides through intuitive readings. I've always wanted to go further, and offer relief to people who are struggling with physical issues, but never had the tools. I struggled for many years with debilitating chronic conditions of my own, which inspired me to keep looking for answers. I finally found a brilliant healing system that I've used on my friends, family, and clients, and it's a dream come true. 

I'm launching this campaign to raise the funds to get certified as an official "Body Code" practitioner. The body code is a comprehensive healing system that is already working wonders on my own health and the health of my loved ones.

If you contribute to this campaign, it will allow me to work with my clients in a new and exciting way, and take my intuitive practice to a higher level.

Body code certification is two-fold. First, I'd need to get certified as an Emotion Code practitioner, which costs $697. After that, I'd be eligible to apply for certification as a Body Code practitioner, which costs $1,297. Anything I collect from this site is going to this goal.  

For too long, I've watched my clients and family members suffer with health issues. For the first time in my life, I feel like I finally have something to offer them. The body code system allows me to connect with anyone who wants healing, and create a connection with their subconscious mind. The subconscious mind has all the answers, and it knows what imbalances are causing the symptoms. The best part, is that the body code system has a way to release those imbalances right then and there, without needing the client to be present physically or on the phone. 

I have already seen massive results with this, and it's so encouraging. I don't want people to suffer if they don't need to. Whether someone is coming down with a virus, or dealing with chronic back pain, this system can help. I just received this testimonial from someone I worked on yesterday.

"I am amazed!  I have had years of pain and limited mobility in my right hip, which has gotten worse with age.  After just one distance healing session with Jessica I noticed immediate relief and the pain in my hip is completely gone! I am delighted that this condition has been relieved with such a simple and non-invasive method." ~ Lori Arrechea

Thank you so much for reading/watching my video! 

With Blessings,

Jessica

I've always wanted to go further, and offer relief to people who are struggling with physical issues, but never had the tools. I struggled for many years with debilitating chronic conditions of my own, which inspired me to keep looking for answers. I finally found a brilliant healing system that I've used on my friends, family, and clients, and it's a dream come true.

For too long, I've watched my clients and family members suffer with health issues. For the first time in my life, I feel like I finally have something to offer them. The body code system allows me to connect with anyone who wants healing, and create a connection with their subconscious mind. The subconscious mind has all the answers, and it knows what imbalances are causing the symptoms. The best part, is that the body code system has a way to release those imbalances right then and there, without needing the client to be present physically or on the phone. 
I have already seen massive results with this, and it's so encouraging. I don't want people to suffer if they don't need to. Whether someone is coming down with a virus, or dealing with chronic back pain, this system can help. I just received this testimonial from someone I worked on yesterday.


"I am amazed!  I have had years of pain and limited mobility in my right hip, which has gotten worse with age.  After just one distance healing session with Jessica I noticed immediate relief and the pain in my hip is completely gone! I am delighted that this condition has been relieved with such a simple and non-invasive method." ~ Lori Arrechea
Thank you so much for reading/watching my video! 
With Blessings,
Jessica

story:
Why qFoods?

All the science is embedded in this app.  Actual fact-based science, research, and development on the latest in the field of nutrition.  We routinely update our algorithms and methods to best serve our customers.

qFoods allows you to eat the foods you like. We all know quick fixes and fads do not work.  This is well-established and can seem unfortunately daunting as dieting is hard and daunting.  Also, healthy eating is more effective if food and meal suggestions align with people's personal preferences.

Millennials eating habits are not good... research is showing that millennials diets are worse than older generations, meaning that overweight and obesity, and the physical and health issues that come with it, will not be far behind.

but food consumptions applications aren't geared for this generation.  Millennials do appreciate quality foods, a quality corporate culture, and do want to contribute to the general well-being of the environment.

qFoods targets the tech savvy customers with an easy solution for people to get tailored meal suggestions with a tap of a button that can ensure healthier eating.

Whether you’re tired of the daily food rut and looking for better meal choices, trying to impress your date or significant other, or figure out some new healthy meals to make for your kids, qFoods ensures you’ll get the best selections possible.

What the app does

Initial setup

Like any application, we need to know a little bit about what you like to eat.  Some set up is required, but some is optional.  Eventually, the system will learn what you like anyway, but the more you tell us, the faster that gets.

At minimum, all you need to do is...

Download the app (Google Play and App Store from Apple)

Pick cuisines you like (Italian, Greek, American, Mexican...etc.)

Optionally, if you want to fill out more information on foods you eat, we can help guide you even further.  And hey, for your efforts, we'll score your current diet so you can see how you improve right from day 1.

We'll be in the app stores, so we won't be collecting any financial information or any personal information from you.  You've already given that to Apple or Google, we don't need it.  We just need to know what you eat.

Daily use

Once the simple set up is done, all you need to do is....

Tap a button for meal suggestions.

If you like the suggested meal, eat it! If you don’t, swipe left on the food and see another option. 

Once you’re done, tell the app if you ate the food.

It's that simple!

The application uses the qCal methodology to rate the quality of foods eaten, and we will track changes to your dietary diversity and healthy eating over time

Tracking progress

You can track your progress over time, seeing how your diet quality and diversity changes.  Set weekly goals and alerts to ensure you get what you need.  

Community challenges

We will build functionality for many communities, starting with:

qConsumer Community

Challenge your friends to win contests.  We all love wining fitness challenges, and now we can win these challenges too.   

qContributor Community

Contribute to a community of food recipes to unlock special app features and deals. Do you think you have a recipe that the world will love?  Prove it!  If your recipe gets attention, so will you.  You'll not only be featured on our newsletter and web site, but you will get great prizes and unlock special features that only our super contributors can access.

Risks and challenges

The main risk of any new idea is whether or not there is a market, and then the subsequent challenge of how to most effectively engage that market and meet their growing demand. In our marketplace, an estimated $30 billion is spent each year by Americans alone trying to lose weight. 73% of people claim to take steps to eat healthier, and 78% of people also consume a food because it makes their life easier. Assuming we target the American market first before reaching out globally, then there are 96 million Americans aged 18-40 (most likely age group to use a smartphone app and/or web site), and based on the above percentages, a potential serviceable market of roughly 72 million people initially. If we can reach just 0.1% market share in the first year, the product will be profitable and able to set the stage to fund other products, research, and projects along the food supply chain over time. To meet the challenge of engaging that market, our market adoption plan includes targeting 4 events: the Institute of Food and Technologists Trade Show (24,000 attendees), the Food and Nutrition Conference and Expo (10,500 attendees), the Americas Food and Beverage Show and Conference (12,000 attendees), and the American Food Fair (60,000 attendees). In addition to these events, we also have an advertising approach that will focus on podcasts frequently listened to by our target audience and by targeted online advertising with high impressions, reach, and engagement rates. We will also measure click-through rate but feel that the first three KPIs are better measures of an advertising campaign's success.

Another risk is true of anyone doing software development, bugs and troubleshooting. We will have a work plan with milestones, progress, and we will keep all of our backers updated along the way. So, if delays come up, you will know when we know, and you'll know what steps we're taking to overcome any issues along the way. We have developed commercial projects before and host all of our customer-facing projects in the cloud (typically AWS) ensuring security, and all transactions from the subscription fee for the app are handled by Apple and Google through the App Store and Google Play, so we won't be collecting anyone's personal financial information through the app.

Lastly, as with any other commercial product, we have to worry about liabilities. We have a law firm who have worked with us previously on our operating agreement and will be with us to put together our terms of use and protect our intellectual property and trademarks to ensure we mitigate any and all legal risks that may arise.

story:
The AFIXT is a simple yet powerful magnetic holder for your bottle.

With its patent-pending simplistic design, industrial strength magnetic grip, and its adjustable band the AFIXT is equipped to carry the load of any size shaker or bottle thrown its way.

Press Buzz

 

Stay Active. Stay Hydrated. 

Afixt is the perfect partner in the gym. Just attach it to any piece of equipment within arm's reach. Hydrate quickly and complete your workout sooner.

Never Spill Your Protein Again.

Say goodbye to cleaning up messes. Afixt prevents spills and unwanted messes by keeping the bottle upright, out of the way and secure!

Listen To The Experts!

Don't take our word for it, just watch what the experts have to say! 

We have been developing and testing the AFIXT for two years.

It doesn’t matter whether you’re a pro bodybuilder, a personal trainer, an avid Cross-fitter, or someone who likes to work out, AFIXT is a great addition to your gym bag. 

Any Size. Any Style.

The AFIXT adjustable band fits perfectly on bottles of every shape and size.

 

Take Your Pick!

We are offering THREE color options first on Kickstarter.

Order Now & SAVE!

We are excited to bring the AFIXT to the Kickstarter community first at a special discounted price!

 

Stretch Goals

Pre-order your AFIXT today. Help us reach our funding goal so we can release more color options to backers!

At $30,000 in funds raised, we will release Green and White as color options!

AFIXT Works Anywhere!

INSERT USE CASE COLLAGE

Whether you are the hitting gym hard, playing at the park, cooking out or taking the kids to store, Afixt works for you everywhere.

 

What's in the box?

Each AFIXT includes:

Polycarbonate Housing with Neodymium magnet

2" Elastic Band with adjustable velcro.

Shaun's Story

Hey Kickstarter! My name is Shaun Hansel, I’m the founder of Attract Iron and creator of AFIXT. Here is my story.

While living a healthy lifestyle and spending countless hours in the gym I continued to run into the same problems over and over again with my shaker bottle. 

I was tired of having shaker problems. So I started developing a solution.

In collaboration with Bigger Tuna Design Studio in Columbus, Ohio we designed the injection molded housing that holds the powerful Neodymium magnet.

Once we had a solid direction with the housing design I began 3D printing samples to test.  During development, I printed over 100 prototypes!

With my 3D printer, I built from a DIY kit and my grandma's sewing machine I took over my wife's kitchen and started prototyping. 

Once we have perfected the design we hired a local mold maker to cast some high-end prototypes for our campaign. 

Check out my development timeline!

My team has successfully established great relationships with our manufacturing partners and now we are ready to push go. 

Now, this is where you come in! :)

Support My Campaign

If you’ve been living with “shaker problems” and are fed up like the rest of us I encourage you to try AFIXT!

To get your AFIXT click on the button that says “Back this project” and claim your discounted price now.

Take advantage of this limited time offer while you still can. Make your pledge now to help me bring AFIXT to the global market!

Spread The Love! 

If you made it this far then kudos to you! You have just read about the last several years of my life. If you like my project please take a moment to share on social media so others can discover my new gizmo.
