story:
My Story
My name is Jay Schnell. I'm from Columbus, Ohio.
I never knew how to explain what I felt, how I knew that my outside and inside did not match.  Until one day in middle school there was a visitor to my classroom.  He was a former student of my teacher, and he just stopped by out of the blue to visit.  After he left, my teacher explained to us that the boy who visited was transgender, and what that meant.  I finally had a label to explain what I felt.  After that, I remained in denial, and have tried everything to stay female for a long time out of fear of what might happen or what others might think. But I have finally decided to show my true colors.  I have denied myself the opportunity to be the real ME for long enough, and I am proud to say that I am a man.  
Over the past 9 months, I have gradually come out to people, and have been living as a male "full time" in public. I began hormones and have been seeing a therapist to support me throughout the process.  The next step for me is "top surgery" (full mastectomy) on March 16, 2012 in Cleveland, Ohio. It will be done by Dr. Medalie.. a very well-known and well-regarded doctor in the field of plastic surgery, especially in surgeries for transgender patients.
 
The Impact
 
Many transgender guys who have not had top surgery wear a "binder" to flatten their chest.   I have tried this for the past 9 months, but have been struggling to wear the binder for any longer than 3 hours at a time.  I have had Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) since I was seventeen years old. I have tried a bunch of medications (and none of them work), and have been admitted to the hospital a few times. I am constantly eating TUMS to try and prevent my symptoms from being unbearable.  I cannot wear tight clothes, especially binders or sports bras.  This kind of compression on my chest makes my GERD symptoms even worse than usual.  Here is what it is like, when I wear a binder:

First 30 minutes- not too bad. (but also not very comfortable..imagine wearing one of those elastic knee braces around your chest. Its kind of like that.)

1 hour- I start to get nauseated...my stomach hurts and I feel like I canâ€™t get a deep breath.  Once, when I was 6 years old, my sister and I were playing and she locked me in a cabinet and couldnâ€™t find the key.  I was there for over an hour until my mom rescued me.  Wearing my binder for an hour feels just about that claustrophobic.

2 hours- I start to have acid refluxâ€¦it is really hard to explain how uncomfortable it is to have what feels like hot lava erupting from my stomach and up my esophagus.  Its kinda hard to carry on a conversation with someone when you feel like your throat is on fireâ€¦

3 hours-  This is when I start trying to find scissors or the jaws of life to get me the hell OUT of my binder.  After three hours, running around topless almost seems like a preferable option to how horrible I feel.

So, as I am sure you can understand, the reason I am trying to get the top surgery done soon is because to finally get rid of this painful part of my life.  The physical pain of wearing the binder is making things miserable; and not only that, I am ready to take the next step in my transition.  Bras and binders have caused me physical and emotional pain ever since I got my first training bra when I was 9.  I am ready to be free from this, to take a deep breat, and to be my real self.  I canâ€™t wait to finally have the body on the outside that matches how I feel on the inside.

What We Need & What You Get

The surgery costs $6,000, but I am trying to raise $4,000 of it via this site.  Any donations are greatly appreciated, no matter what the amount.  You can choose to donate the amounts listed on the right and receive a perk (or can choose â€œno perkâ€) OR you can choose any other amount youâ€™d like.  Either way, you will be helping me get one step ncloser to my goal, which is the most amazing gift I could ever ask for! 

Thank you for your support -- I appreciate it more than I can say!!!

story:
FANTASTICK DGX Application Viedo

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We have done researches with famous kinematics specialists & professors over professional drum players who are in their 20s & 30s, for how their biometrics are recorded as to their drum playings

Fantastick DGX has turned out to burn 300 kcal for 30 minutes of playing.This result doubles the carlories burning from power walking & bicycling, and it is almost equal to doing sit-ups & skpping rope

Data from these researches were analyzed to build biometrics database, and FANATASTICK DGX is personalized as to your usage, to show how your calories are being burnt while you play the drum.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

-  Tax & Shipping excluded ( Customs duty and surtax varies by country. Please contact your country's Customs. )

-   Upgraded products in design or upgraded product features may be shipped.

-  Free smartphone application is available at Google store & Apple Store

-  FATNASTICK DGX recommends you to use your own mobile phone for personalization & private records history

-6MONTH WARRANTY

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

FANTASTICK DGX MAKING VIDEO

 

 

 

 

 

 

“One of my dreams is to share my experience as a professional drumming player who have experienced the exercise effect and fun from playing the drum. So people can be artists

 while they can live healthier lives, working out with fun”

I am Yun-sung Jee, the establisher of FANTASTICK DGX, and CEO of HAERA, a Korean musical drumming performance corporation.

I was one of leading performers of Nanta, the most famous drumming performance musical in Asia, 10 years ago. While I was changing my role as an actor of the musical to the creator & business man of my own company, there came along a chance of lifestyles: I was burnt out with meeting people with alcohol, and lesser time of working out for myself.

I tried many things to get back in shape: cycling, fitness, climbing mountains, but these series of trial out only gave me pain or got me bored easily. After sleeping on how I could regain my health or get back in shape, and I’ve found a solution right beside me: at my own company!

Professional drumming performancers are practicing the drum 1 or one and half hours for 4~5 days in a week. And so were my actors and myself in the past as well. Those regular practices always make actors in shape.

As soon as I realized the answer hidden right beside me, I wanted to share this to people around me or to the world. Then I faced some prejudice or barriers that some people thought drumming was just drumming, not exercising.

Breaking the prejudice & barriers, I have met many professionals who helped me to realize my dream. As every great thing as a small beginning, I hope this can change the way of working out.

FANTASTICK DGX.

I wonder how FATASTICK DGX will change the world, and I heartly welcome all of you to the incredible universe of FANTASTICK DGX.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

As with any smart hardware project, there are natural risks and challenges in engineering and manufacturing. We've done our best to minimize risks for backers: while designing Fantastick DGX, we visited numerous manufacturers for quality and took into consideration the production process of Fantastick DGX’s head and body. 

In addition, we have already chosen the best contract manufacturer in South Korea to begin designing the fantastick DGX.

Our team is confident that we can meet our projected dates for production and delivery. However, unexpected delays can occur due to manufacturing issues, component shortages, and possibly more. We promise to do our best to be as transparent as possible, keep you updated during the process, and work diligently to resolve any issues as they arise.
story_txt: FANTASTICK DGX Application Viedo            We have done researches with famous kinematics specialists & professors over professional drum players who are in their 20s & 30s, for how their biometrics are recorded as to their drum playingsFantastick DGX has turned out to burn 300 kcal for 30 minutes of playing.This result doubles the carlories burning from power walking & bicycling, and it is almost equal to doing sit-ups & skpping ropeData from these researches were analyzed to build biometrics database, and FANATASTICK DGX is personalized as to your usage, to show how your calories are being burnt while you play the drum.         -  Tax & Shipping excluded ( Customs duty and surtax varies by country. Please contact your country's Customs. )-   Upgraded products in design or upgraded product features may be shipped.-  Free smartphone application is available at Google store & Apple Store-  FATNASTICK DGX recommends you to use your own mobile phone for personalization & private records history-6MONTH WARRANTY        FANTASTICK DGX MAKING VIDEO      “One of my dreams is to share my experience as a professional drumming player who have experienced the exercise effect and fun from playing the drum. So people can be artists while they can live healthier lives, working out with fun”I am Yun-sung Jee, the establisher of FANTASTICK DGX, and CEO of HAERA, a Korean musical drumming performance corporation.I was one of leading performers of Nanta, the most famous drumming performance musical in Asia, 10 years ago. story:
When we discovered that most of the world's Noni was not being grown organically and less than 1% of all energy shots are made with fair-trade ingredients and that Hawaii's number one export is genetically modified corn seed and that 99% of all energy shots contain harmful preservatives, we did something crazy...

We created an organic, fair trade, vegan, gluten-free, GMO-free, energy shot made from over 75% real superfruit juice from plants that can be grown sustainably in Hawaii and caffeinated it with organic mate & green tea.

We're calling it Hawaiian Ola (oh-la) and maybe it's a longshot but we have a hunch that we're not alone. We think people are tired of colored sugar-water with synthetic caffeine and chemical preservatives so we're bringing this idea to you for the support we need to make it real. 

Over the last year our team has come a long way. What started as a simple idea to create a healthy way to energize our bodies and support organic Hawaiian agriculture has grown into an incredible family of loving supporters and a product that we're truly excited to share with the world.

Creating the blend was our first challenge. We knew we wanted Noni to be our first ingredient after learning about its story of coming to Hawaii by boat over two thousand years ago and being used by the natives as the island's main source of medicine. So we worked hard to create a flavor that balanced its 'distinct' :) taste with a mixture of mango, acai, goji, passion fruit, and other organic fruits until we had something that tasted right. We're proud of this because most Noni is sold as a concentrate and is rarely, if ever, blended in a way that tastes this great.

Getting certified was our next goal. We wanted to create a product that people could trust was safe and only made from the best ingredients. So with some much appreciated capital from friends and family we raised enough money to not only certify Ola USDA Organic, but we also paid to have our bottler certified too! We didn't stop there, we also worked to source ingredients from farmers who are paid fairly for their goods and become fair trade certified by Fair Trade USA. The kicker, Ola is currently working to become a B-Certified corporation- a way of making sure our company never loses focus of our commitment to taking care of all of our stakeholders and never putting profits ahead of people.

Making it pop was important to us. This spring the Ola team worked with designers and creative experts in our community to develop a presence that would help us stand out with a great label, Ola gear, a new website and window art for merchants who plan to carry our product in their stores.

How you can help:

Now Ola is ready to share; we're all set to bottle our first 50,000 shots in July 2012 and need you to help prove this product is something that the people really want. All we're asking is that you support what we're doing by making a contribution to our project in exchange for some really cool rewards.

Aside from being one of the first to try Ola, by making a contribution you'll be supporting the social and environmental changes that our team is working hard to create.

FAQ for Contributors:

Payments are processed through Paypal which ensures the security of your transaction. That does not mean that you need to have a Paypal account nor that you have to create one. You can use any Credit Card.

Shipping costs will be added to all contributions that require shipping. If you're in northern California for our summer release party, you can skip shipping costs and simply pickup your rewards in person. We'd love to have you, so if you can make it, email contact@hawaiianola.com for details.

If you can't afford to contribute financially but still want to support the Ola mission, the best way you can help is by passing this on to a friend using the indiegogo share tools above or by visiting our website, liking us on Facebook, or following us on Twitter. Anything you can do to help get the word out helps; many thanks for checking out our project.

story:
IMPORTANT - For those of you in Fiji wishing to donate, the local donation account is

ANZ Nadi Branch

Shiveel Munith Narayan

Acc: 11942348


The Day Manisha's world stopped

Manisha is 19, she recently graduated top of her class from beauty school and has scored herself a great job working as a beautician. She's a happy young woman, beautiful inside and out and genuinely loves life.  So...imagine getting the news you have cancer, more specifically Acute Myeloid Leukaemia. Terrible right? What if you were told this bad news and found out that the country you live in didn't have treatment for you to fight this deadly disease? Devastating!

This is Manisha's story.  2 weeks ago, after 2 months of feeling sick, she was admitted in hospital. After many tests and blood transfusions she was given the terrible and scary diagnosis, blood cancer.

Manisha lives in Fiji, it's a beautiful country with beautiful people but the reality of living in this developing country is that life saving treatments are not available.  Her only hope to survive this disease is treatment, which means travelling abroad to get it.  It's expensive (we're not even sending her to nearby Australia or New Zealand as that would be 3 times the cost) and its a long and painful treatment plan. We are desperately trying to raise funds to get Manisha to India where she'll have the opportunity to get the appropriate treatment and beat the disease.

What We Need & What You Get

Treatment for Manisha is in stages, it will be aggressive & long and she will need to be away from home for 6-12 months having chemotherapy and possibly a bone marrow transplant.  We've chosen India as it's a more realistic target to finance. Manisha is Indo Fijian so the added bonus is that culture and language will be what she'll know.  We've also worked with doctors in Fiji and researched it extensively to discover India has top medical facilities and doctors for the kind of treatment she needs.  Total cost for treatment including airfares, accommodation etc will be in the vicinity of $60,000-$80,000AUD depending on how she responds to the treatment.

We're not asking you to finance the whole treatment.  We just want some help.  So that's why we've set a reasonable goal in order to keep the fees low.  Indiegogo keeps just 4% to power this campaign if we hit our goal.  $5000 is really only a fraction of what we need, but blowing a goal out of the water makes EVERYBODY feel good.   So lets obliterate that number. DOUBLE IT, TRIPLE IT, MULTIPLY IT!  All the funds will go to Manisha's treatment, travel and stay in India and if we are so lucky to get more than we need, then we will donate it to other Fijian's who may need to go abroad to get treatment.

Why donate to this family?

Manisha's family comes from a poor rural area of Lautoka, Fiji. She is one of 4 children (only girl in the family) and her father has always worked hard to provide for his family.  They are loyal, generous people who don't have much but are always willing to help others in whatever way they can.  Now it's their time to accept help and they truly need it.  It's humbling to see that no matter where you live in the world and how many material possessions you have, it doesn't matter, so long as you have the right morals and ethics to live by. This family sure has that. All four children in the family were given the opportunity to get an education to ensure they will be able to get good jobs to support themselves through life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help us spread the word that we are desperately trying to raise funds to send Manisha overseas so she can get the treatment she needs to fight this deadly disease. Please share this link, tell your friends, colleagues, strangers, anyone who will listen. You never know who might be able to donate to save Manisha's life. The family would be eternally grateful.

story:
Mambo!

My name is Nadine Goldau and I am a german medical student in the 10th semester. I will do an internship of a month in  Litembo Hospital, Tanzania, this October. 

Since I worked as a volunteer in a namibian bridging school in a township after my high school diploma, I know that donations are always welcome, but that some are really needed and thus very much appreciated and others are just plain useless. 

That is why I asked my contact person to send me a list of things that they need and that I could take with me. All the things that i can transport in my luggage I found on amazon and ordered it. 

Since I am a student, I don't have much money so I thought I could maybe find some people that would like to contribute a euro or two to a cause that will have a direct impact.   


What I need and what I give in return

It will cost 1000 Euro to buy all the equipment that I can possibly fit in a bag or backpack.

The list of things that I can transport is:

Haemoglobinometer 2
Hanging scale 25kg x 100g 1
Baby scale 16 kg x 5g 1
Pulsoxymeter (NPB40) 3
Airway Güdel Rubber child 67mm 1
Airway Güdel Rubber infant 54 mm 1
Endotracheal tube disp. S. 4 1
Endotracheal tube disp. S. 3,5 1
Ambubeutel (mit Kindermaske) 4
Canular G24 1000
Canular G22 1000
Suction Catheter G10 200
Suction Catheter G12 100
Sphygomanometer (BP Machine) 10
things that i  cannot transport but if someone feels like he would like to send some of it via mail to the hospital:

Suction Machine 1
ECG 1
manually powered centrifuge 2

Mikroskop Binocular Motic B1-220 A 2
Oxygen Concentrator 2
Incubator 1
Emergency/ Recovery Stretcher 2
Examination Bed 1
Screen folding with curtains 1
I don't have any perks but if somebody is interested in knowing what will be done with the equipment, what the hospital in Litembo is like or how a community hospital in Tanzania works, I would be happy to send you a personal email with some pictures and a letter with my experiences there. 

all the money will be used for the equipment -- no matter if it is only a euro or 1000 in the end. 

Consequences

My project is only a small piece in a big puzzle or a drop on a stone but I believe that it already makes a difference. It DOES make a difference if a newborn that has diffuculties to breathe can be intubated -- or not because the skills and knowledge and staff is there but the equipment is missing. It does make a difference if drugs can be administered by sterile intravenous ways, it does make a difference if someway can be resucitated because the airway can be managed. It makes a difference if the oxygen level and blood pressure of a pacient can be correctly measured. I am sure that all the staff is perfectly trained and motivated -- but the best professionals just can't do their work without the appropriate equipment. 


risks & challenges

If nobody supports me, I will still buy as much of the eqipment as I can afford. The more people that support my idea the more I can buy and take with me. 


other ways to help

If you think that friends or collegues of you would like to add a little amount, please share the campain on facebook, or twitter, send them an email or use the indiegogo tool for it.

Thank you for your interest and support!

Let's change the world little by little and step by step and make it a brighter place!

story:
Short Summary

So hello there everyone my name is John i'm 18 years old and i'm  trying to help a girl from my school who needs a spine surgery in Austria she suffers from a very advanced form of scoliosis where her spine has the shape of an S  ,her parents don't have the money and already covered how much they could but it's not enough,some students including me donated 1$ or 4$ or how much we got,well i donated my lunch money too that was becouse i could hang in there without food a couple of hours but she needs this surgery as fast as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

The surgery costs around 22.000 euro butIt's a win situation anyway it doesn't matter how much we raise even it it's 1$ it's still something,sometimes that 1$ makes the difference so i am confidend that this one will too,

    I can run off with your money,so many did this i don't know if you think i am different,i may or i may not be this is a test of trust into a complete stranger so will you take that chance?

story:
Almost at the InDemand goal--thanks!

-----
Amid the heat of North Carolina in July, six cars line up for one of the heat races for the Global Rallycross Championship round at the Dirt Track at Charlotte Motor Speedway. A lady in black crosses to the center of the start line and holds up a simple sign: 30. Thirty seconds to the start. She waits a bit, then flips the sign around and gives one more wave in front of the drivers: 10. Ten seconds, walking off, 9, 8, 7, the drivers anticipating the start. After those ten seconds come the lights: a sequence of five red lights, one after the other, the illumination of which causes the field of cars to stop sounding like cars and start sounding like something resembling Satan's popcorn machine. The crackling and backfiring continues until the red lights cease, and a set of green lights unleashes 3500 horsepower--six cars as much power as thirty of their showroom-floor siblings.

As the cars moved off the small patch of pavement onto the dirt and clay that made up most of the rest of the circuit, the two Subaru Imprezas of Sverre Isachsen and Bucky Lasek pulled ahead from their front row starting positions and bore toward the inside part of the first corner, with Lasek converging on the other front row starter, Patrik Sandell. Sandell, trying to hold his Ford Fiesta's position against the charging Volkswagen Polo of Tanner Foust, was bumped by both Foust and Lasek, sending him straight into the water-filled barrier on the inside of the turn. Sandell's car was lodged in the barriers, forcing the officials to stop the race to remove the crippled car. With the Swede irritated and his car disabled, then, the race was restarted with the space between Isachsen and Lasek empty.

As the green lights came on to start the race, Isachsen pulled ahead, with Lasek behind. Once again, Lasek moved inside, once again Lasek found another car--this time Foust--and once again the car found the barrier. This time, however, Foust continued, despite hitting both the obstacle and immediately being collided into by the Ford of rookie Austin Dyne. As the cars continued to complete the first lap of the heat, the barrier sat in the middle of the track, in an even more prone position than Sandell's car earlier. Above the racing surface, in the press box, the status of the race puzzled some of the press corps, accustomed to the stock car and sprint car races that run at the speedway complex the rest of the season. In any other form of racing, the race would have either been slowed or stopped by this point. Series media director Chris Leone reassured the booth that this was not the case: "This is rallycross. We don't believe in yellow flags."

Sure enough, the battle for the lead--with Isachsen being hounded by the Ford of 2013 Lites class winner Joni Wiman--had to go through the mangled barrier and the trail of debris surrounding it, with Lasek getting a piece of the action a couple seconds later to ensure that every car in the heat had hit the now-useless lump of plastic. This is rallycross: a form of racing that has existed in one form or another in Europe for decades. At its most basic form, in the "folkraces" of Scandinavia, it really is a borderline demolition derby involving past-their-prime road cars. In greater Europe, though, it was developed as made-for-TV entertainment: an all-star motorsports filler product, combining drivers in pavement racing and dirt rallies.

Stateside, rallycross started as such, but in both cause and effect has become potentially something bigger: a bellwether for not just motorsport, but the whole relationship between sport and commercialism and culture. This is rallycross: a genre of motor racing imported to America as part of the premier showcase for youth-oriented action sports that has sustained a hold on the under-30 demographic to such a degree that, five and a half years after first being contested, more manufacturers, sponsors, and racing teams are looking to get involved as the championship itself successfully spreads its wings from the ESPN mothership from which it was spawned.

This budding success story is as much about favorable conditions outside the sport as it is about the people inside the series who have turned it from a niche event in a festival of niche events into the only racing series running a full schedule on broadcast television; a racing series with more manufacturer representation than NASCAR; a racing series with a more functional track for young drivers to ascend to the top; and a racing series that attracts star power the likes of which other series can scarcely match. This is rallycross: a victory of quality over quantity, a series with just over a dozen full-time drivers and a relative skeleton crew in charge, but with any one of those drivers having a shot at winning, and the series becoming increasingly influential with every move made.

The Global Rallycross Championship has evolved; whereas every race except the X Games round in 2012 was supporting either a NASCAR or Indycar race, by 2015 the entire championship schedule is a series of 12 main events, no longer playing second fiddle to any other racers. As the 2015 season approaches, the series stands at the starting line in as great a position as ever to win over the racing public and put their mark on the automotive world once and for all. This is rallycross: fresher than NASCAR, more relevant than Formula One, and poised to take advantage of both series' missteps and vault into the limelight.
-----
The Global Rallycross Championship represents a major intersection in American culture: at a point when mainstream automotive journalists fret over the loss of interest in the younger "Millenial" generation in cars, the series aims squarely at them by doing everything that mainstream series like NASCAR and Indycar don't: use real, practical cars (well they start off that way) in short heat races on diverse, mixed-surface courses. It's not simply "go fast and turn left", but left, right, and a bit of up and down as well. The result: in just five years, the series has a national TV deal, a title sponsorship with Red Bull, the involvement of four manufacturers (and counting!), and the interest of the whole racing world.


About the author
Lenny Sundahl is a West Virginia-based sportswriter who got his first taste of rallycross last season for his Speed Smorgasbord motorsport blog. By popular demand, he's giving the crowdfunding thing another go around, starting small to start ($500 will get airfare to Austin and Daytona for X Games and the next rounds of this season's GRC schedule) so InDemand can kick in and he can work on funding the real doozies in the schedule out west.
story_txt: Almost at the InDemand goal--thanks!-----Amid the heat of North Carolina in July, six cars line up for one of the heat races for the Global Rallycross Championship round at the Dirt Track at Charlotte Motor Speedway. A lady in black crosses to the center of the start line and holds up a simple sign: 30. Thirty seconds to the start. She waits a bit, then flips the sign around and gives one more wave in front of the drivers: 10. Ten seconds, walking off, 9, 8, 7, the drivers anticipating the start. After those ten seconds come the lights: a sequence of five red lights, one after the other, the illumination of which causes the field of cars to stop sounding like cars and start sounding like something resembling Satan's popcorn machine. The crackling and backfiring continues until the red lights cease, and a set of green lights unleashes 3500 horsepower--six cars as much power as thirty of their showroom-floor siblings.As the cars moved off the small patch of pavement onto the dirt and clay that made up most of the rest of the circuit, the two Subaru Imprezas of Sverre Isachsen and Bucky Lasek pulled ahead from their front row starting positions and bore toward the inside part of the first corner, with Lasek converging on the other front row starter, Patrik Sandell. Sandell, trying to hold his Ford Fiesta's position against the charging Volkswagen Polo of Tanner Foust, was bumped by both Foust and Lasek, sending him straight into the water-filled barrier on the inside of the turn. Sandell's car was lodged in the barriers, forcing the officials to stop the race to remove the crippled car. With the Swede irritated and his car disabled, then, the race was restarted with the space between Isachsen and Lasek empty.As the green lights came on to start the race, Isachsen pulled ahead, with Lasek behind. Once again, Lasek moved inside, once again Lasek found another car--this time Foust--and once again the car found the barrier. This time, however, Foust continued, despite hitting both the obstacle and immediately being collided into by the Ford of rookie Austin Dyne. As the cars continued to complete the first lap of the heat, the barrier sat in the middle of the track, in an even more prone position than Sandell's car earlier. Above the racing surface, in the press box, the status of the race puzzled some of the press corps, accustomed to the stock car and sprint car races that run at the speedway complex the rest of the season. In any other form of racing, the race would have either been slowed or stopped by this point. Series media director Chris Leone reassured the booth that this was not the case: "This is rallycross. We don't believe in yellow flags."Sure enough, the battle for the lead--with Isachsen being hounded by the Ford of 2013 Lites class winner Joni Wiman--had to go through the mangled barrier and the trail of debris surrounding it, with Lasek getting a piece of the action a couple seconds later to ensure that every car in the heat had hit the now-useless lump of plastic. As the 2015 season approaches, the series stands at the starting line in as great a position as ever to win over the racing public and put their mark on the automotive world once and for all. story:
Most of us reach for the wrong foods at the wrong times. Often we skip breakfast (the most important meal of the day), only to grab a quick cup of coffee or a doughnut on our way to work. While that coffee and the sugar in that doughnut give us that quick boost of energy, within a few hours it's back to the familiar midday crash.

NuBello was born out of the desire to create a real solution to the Morning Blues by providing complete, sustainable and wholesome nutrition that doesn't quit on you when you need it most. The stress-reducing and calming blend of super fruits, vegetables, vitamins, minerals and antioxidants give you everything you need to function at your best.

Keith Bashaw, a Wall Street trader and real estate professional, and Tracy Schroeder, an interior designer, were looking for a convenient, comprehensive and all-natural nutrition solution to give them the energy, focus and calm to tackle the responsibilities of their equally demanding lives.

Most mornings they barely had time to finish a cup of coffee, let alone eat a well-balanced breakfast. The stresses and non-stop pace of their lives began affecting their health and happiness, but rather than look for a quick fix for their problems, Keith and Tracy sought to target the problem at its core. Both realized the vital importance that nutrition plays in a person’s life and overall wellness, and embarked on the holistic journey that would lead to NuBello.

Not satisfied with the artificial, high calorie, and high sugar breakfast shakes on the market, they designed a plant-based protein powder containing all the heart-healthy, anti-aging oxidants lacking in the Standard American Diet (SAD).  NuBello is the easy to get the benefits of a healthy and pure diet in one simple step, making it a balanced meal when you don't have time. 

NuBello was created with the help of health experts and delivers a stress-reducing, raw sustainable source of energy. It cuts down bad food cravings and reduces feelings of persistent hunger. NuBello is a natural appetite suppressant, and makes an ideal weight loss aid for anyone that tends to skip meals or overindulge. It contains natural mood-enhancing B Vitamins to help you stay calm, cool and collected throughout the day.

NuBello has no chemicals, harmful additives, unnatural sweeteners, and is free of the most common allergens. NuBello is more than an ordinary energy booster, it's complete nutrition in one simple drink. 

We know you can't always eat right... but by adding this convenient, cost-saving nutrition solution to your diet, you’ll feel the difference in your mood, energy, and productivity.

NuBello has everything you need to lose weight and feel great. NuBello offers natural and pure energy unlike the high sugar, highly-caffeinated meal replacement drinks and powders available today. 

NuBello contains the vitamins, minerals and antioxidants the body naturally produces to help you lose weight the safe and healthy way. What you put into your body is important and at NuBello we believe that chemicals aren't a part of the solution.

How Does NuBello Help You Lose Weight?

NuBello offers complete low-calorie nutrition, so it's ideal for anyone who is looking to  lose weight. Unlike most snacks or meal replacements on the market, NuBello offers balanced nutrition that boosts your metabolism, and keeps you feeling fuller longer- making it easier to resist unhealthy food choices.

"NuBello offers complete nutrition in with low-calories..."

NuBello is free of artificial sweeteners. It's sweetened with stevia, a natural sugar that has been used in South America for centuries.

NuBello promotes weight loss through natural means by giving you the nutrition you need to control cravings, reduce persistent hunger, boost mood and energy to motivate you on your weight loss journey, helping you achieve real results. 

NuBello is more than a weight loss supplement or an appetite suppressant. It offers a long-term health and weight loss solution that naturally works with your body to boost weight loss and energy. NuBello isn't a quick fix, rather it's about giving you more of the nutrient dense foods you need in one simple drink. 

Calcium - Not only great for healthy bones, calcium helps you lose fat while preserving muscle, and acts as an important calorie and fat-burning aid.

Fiber - helps reduce your appetite by keeping you feeling fuller, longer- making it easier to resist bad foods; generally, reducing your overall calorie consumption.

Vitamin D - is a essential nutrient that many of us are lacking. Vitamin D not only promotes strong bones, muscles and joints, but helps you lose weight.

Vitamin B12 - plays a role in how well your body uses the calories it consumes. B12 also boosts energy and enhances mood, giving you the energy you need to adopt a more active lifestyle, which is essential to long-term health and wellness.

Protein - helps curb hunger and preserve muscle mass to help you lose weight. 

At NuBello we designed a super-blend of over 30 fruits and vegetables that has more of what the body and mind needs to help you loss weight, stabilize your metabolism and boost your energy to achieve long-term wellness.

We’re all familiar with the ancient grain of wisdom that "Health is Wealth," but given the hectic pace of our lives, we can't always make the best food choices, and that's where NuBello comes in...

NuBello is a quick, delicious, easy solution to great nutrition. 

Convenient and ideal for an on-the-go lifestyle, NuBello was designed for more diets and nutrition needs than ordinary protein powders. Featuring a unique proprietary blend of over 30 super fruits & vegetables, NuBello is the Nu Wave in Health, Stress & Weight Loss Management.

A Complete Meal- NuBello is one of the lowest calorie, super fruit and veggie blends available. It's a complete meal that's perfect for your on-the-go lifestyle.

Sweetened with all-natural stevia, this gluten-free, no soy, no dairy, delicious plant-based protein is a nutritional powerhouse with stress-reducing vitamins & antioxidants that not only boost your mood and memory, but gives you a concentrated source of energy to help you get through your busy day.

Raspberries - Loaded with antioxidants, raspberries provide a rich source of Vitamin C, Fiber and Manganese, a super fruit with anti-cancer and anti-aging properties.

As a low sugar and low calorie fruit, raspberries play an important role in weight loss management. They release natural sugar slowly, and are sweet enough to help satisfy cravings to prevent sudden spikes in blood-sugar levels.

B Vitamins: B1, B2, B6, B12, Folic acid - Many of us don't get enough Vitamin B, an essential nutrient that helps boost mood and memory. Vitamin B helps the body manage stress levels, reducing anxiety and symptoms of depression while providing a remarkable source of vital energy.

Atlantic Kelp - Is a sea plant packed with heart-healthy nutrients, including manganese and iodine to help regulate thyroid function and aid weight loss.

Vitamin D - D3 is an important vitamin that is mainly obtained by exposure to sunlight. Most foods are low sources of Vitamin D, so with this added dietary supplement, you'll get the convenient health benefits of strong bones, calcium balance, reduced risk of depression and improved kidney function.

Stevia - Stevia is an all-natural sweetener that's the perfect replacement for sugar and artificial substitutes. Stevia has a low glycemic index, making it a great option for those following low carb lifestyles.

Should I drink NuBello with my meal or as a meal replacement?

Packed with a full spectrum of plant-based proteins and complex carbs, NuBello is designed to stand on its own as a meal and will keep you feeling full and energized. 

Can I add it to anything besides just water? 

Yes! You can stir it into your favorite juice, iced black or herbal tea, almond milk, hemp milk or even blend it with your favorite smoothies... the possibilities are virtually endless. 

How does it compare to other meal replacement drinks?

NuBello provides clean, plant-based fuel that can nip the effects of stress by providing you with a full and complete meal in one simple drink. And we're totally junk free: none of the most common dietary allergens - soy, gluten, nuts, and dairy.

What's actually in NuBello?

• Easily digestible plant-based protein with amino acids

• Complex carbs from cruciform vegetables like broccoli, kale, spinach, plus legumes and algae

• Naturally occurring enzymes to ease digestion

• Powerful and protective antioxidants from sourced like apples, oranges, and pineapples to help reduce free radicals caused by stress and pollution 

• A robust amount of the daily recommended servings of fruits / veggies

• COQ10 for heart health - B-complex vitamin for energy and vitality

• 400 mg vitamin D3 for mood support, bone density, overall health 

What happens if we exceed our stated goal?

We will increase our order size from our manufacturer to fulfill our Indiegogo perk demand. 

Is NuBello currently in production?

NuBello Raspberry is currently in production and is projected to be ready for distribution by the end of the year. We are hoping to fulfill shipments before the Holiday Season. NuBello will make for a perfect compliment for this time of year.  It will also make for a great gift! 

How can you help?

Thank you for your interest and participation in our journey to bring NuBello to the world. Please spread the word about NuBello and we will be extremely grateful! Have a wonderfully nutritious day!

story:
The Alabama Institute of Medicine (AIM)
The Alabama Institute of Medicine's (AIM) mission is to support and advance stem cell research and regenerative medicine under the highest ethical and medical standards for the discovery and development of cures, therapies, diagnostics and research technologies to relieve and provide treatments for people suffering from chronic disease and injury.

AIM is a private/public partnership to support regenerative medicine in Alabama, the Southeast, and the United States of America. The talent and technology is in place to foster regenerative medicine into twenty first century personalized medicine. When this happens, depends on the funding - This is where Your Help comes in! That's our AIM!

About AIM's First Stem Cell Research Grant
AIM Will provide our first embryonic stem cell grant with your help. Help us raise $10,000 so we can fund our first grant and give it out to support top stem cell science.  This will be a directed grant to the stem cell science that can have the most impact immediately for any disease, injury or ailment.

story:
The Caring Coupon Idea

When Denise Jefferson was diagnosed with cancer for the second time, she knew she'd have to fight, again. And she will win, again. But not without first enduring the painful regiment of chemotherapy.

Of course, being pumped full of chemo, it wasn't long before people started to recognize a change in our vibrant, hands-on, go-get-em woman. As her friends started to see Denise's energy level slow and as they read her open diary detailing her treatment plan, people began to ask "How can I help?"

The thing is, it isn't always easy to think of a quick response when someone says, "What can I do for you?"

But then, Denise had an idea! What if there were coupon books that cancer patients could carry around and when someone did offer to help they could rip out one of these "Caring Coupons" and give it to that person, right there, in the moment, when the offer for help was being made? Brilliant idea if you ask me! Which is why I jumped on the offer to design the books.

But more important than the design, was really knowing what people needed help with. Denise had that covered, too. She and her daughter, Ashley, interviewed a room full of cancer patients at a local chemo clinic, and in just a short while they had 40 different coupon ideas.

These ideas that came straight from those that would need the help as they were more focused on fighting for their health and their life to manage some of the other jobs that seem so easy to most of us.

Caring Coupon Goal

The goal is to have 100 Caring Coupon books printed in time for Denise to give out to her cancer-fighting warrior friends on her final day of chemotherapy treatment. That last day of her chemo is slotted for March 20, 2014!
  • We would like to raise money to have caring coupon booklets printed - a quantity that would use all $500 raised.
  • You would feel good about contributing to an amazing act of kindness to local cancer patients and to the American Cancer Association.

The Impact

We will all be contributing toward something that will make the life of a cancer patient a little less overwhelming. Not only will there be a gift in giving the coupon books out to those that shared their wishes for help, but more gifts to follow each time they are able to share a need for something to be done for them. 

In addition to the printed coupon booklets, we will also make an electronic copy of the caring coupons that can be posted and available on websites, including the American Cancer Society, so that those who do not receive on of the printed booklets will be able to print from home.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money right now to contribute, that's alright! Maybe you would be willing to share our campaign with family and friends in hope they are able to give toward a good cause.

The thing is, it isn't always easy to think of a quick response when someone says, "What can I do for you?"But then, Denise had an idea! What if there were coupon books that cancer patients could carry around and when someone did offer to help they could rip out one of these "Caring Coupons" and give it to that person, right there, in the moment, when the offer for help was being made? Brilliant idea if you ask me! Which is why I jumped on the offer to design the books.But more important than the design, was really knowing what people needed help with. Denise had that covered, too. She and her daughter, Ashley, interviewed a room full of cancer patients at a local chemo clinic, and in just a short while they had 40 different coupon ideas. These ideas that came straight from those that would need the help as they were more focused on fighting for their health and their life to manage some of the other jobs that seem so easy to most of us.Caring Coupon Goal
The goal is to have 100 Caring Coupon books printed in time for Denise to give out to her cancer-fighting warrior friends on her final day of chemotherapy treatment. That last day of her chemo is slotted for March 20, 2014! 
We would like to raise money to have caring coupon booklets printed - a quantity that would use all $500 raised.

You would feel good about contributing to an amazing act of kindness to local cancer patients and to the American Cancer Association.

The ImpactWe will all be contributing toward something that will make the life of a cancer patient a little less overwhelming. Not only will there be a gift in giving the coupon books out to those that shared their wishes for help, but more gifts to follow each time they are able to share a need for something to be done for them. In addition to the printed coupon booklets, we will also make an electronic copy of the caring coupons that can be posted and available on websites, including the American Cancer Society, so that those who do not receive on of the printed booklets will be able to print from home.Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have the money right now to contribute, that's alright! Maybe you would be willing to share our campaign with family and friends in hope they are able to give toward a good cause.

story:
How You Can Help:

  • Give! Every dollar counts and will go directly towards helping people in need get the medical care they deserve.
  • Share this campaign through email & social media by clicking the share buttons above. Share link anywhere you want- Email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+, Pinterest, etc!
*All donations are tax-deductible. See bottom of page for more info.

About The Clinic

Cornerstone Charitable Clinic provides free healthcare to people with no other alternatives. 


The Cornerstone Charitable Clinic, a program of Cornerstone Assistance Network, was established in 1998 to create a medical home for uninsured patients of Tarrant County in need of health care. 

While the Affordable Care Act has improved access to healthcare for many, there is still a great need for charitable clinics. According to an estimate by the Congressional Budget Office, approximately 30 million people will remain uninsured in the United States. In addition, with Texas opting out of Medicaid expansion, an overwhelming amount of people will continue to go without health coverage. 

Without basic preventive care available, the amount of emergency room visits will undoubtedly increase in coming years and will be costly to the community in addition to decreasing the community’s overall health. The Clinic aims to fill the gap in our health care system by providing the necessary preventive care for this population.

Due to changes in the funding of recent health care initiatives, this medical assistance is in danger of going away. YOU can help us change that!


The Impact


What We Need

In order to continue providing medical care, we must raise $250,000. Funds will go towards clinic programs, staff and medical supplies. 

The establishment of the Clinic as a medical home has been the primary source behind the Clinic’s success in expanding access to healthcare and improving patient health outcomes. While our volunteer healthcare providers are valuable, our staff is critical to maintaining the medical home model that allows patients to have comprehensive care. Without our director, staff nurse and two patient advocates, the Clinic could not function as a medical home. The staff is vital for maintaining day-to-day operations including patient charting, follow-ups and documenting client data to improve overall outcomes. With sustained support, the Clinic can continue providing high-quality health care to those who need it most.

*Any funds raised beyond our goal of $250,000 will go directly towards other programs at Cornerstone Assistance Network.
*All donations are tax-deductible. After contributing, you will receive a receipt through email from FirstGiving, Indiegogo's nonprofit payments processor, confirming the tax-deductible status of your contribution.


Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

UCSB Disc Golf is coming off a hot 2013 season. Heading into our Regional Qualifier, we were an unranked and a brand new club, nobody knew who we were. In the Regional Qualifier, we fell to Regional rival CSUMB, at their home course, by a slim margin of one point in the Match Play finale. 


Ramping up to Nationals, captain Mike Sale sought to break the World Record to get his team to the 2013 Collegiate National Championships, and did. On February 10th, 2013, Mike Sale set a new Guinness World Record, aiding his team in raising more than $1,000 to get out to Nationals. 


At Nationals, UCSB finished at 15th in the Nation, making it all the way to the final round on the devastating Old Glory Black course. Captain Mike Sale finished second in the overall competition, a stroke short of being the Individual National Champion as a Freshman. He earned First Team All-American honors. 


This year, UCSB Disc Golf has been hard at work, and is looking poised to make a run at a National Championship. This is the year to do it, as Seniors Dylan Nickerson and Jason Cortella will be graduating. In the off-season, UCSB Disc Golf added Russell Jackson, a fresh face in the Disc Golf scene at UCSB, and an extraordinary asset to the team. If any year is the year, this is the one.


But we need your help! Fundraising for a sport that there is little known about is a difficult task when it isn't surrounded by the aura of a Guinness World Record. Although we posted a goal of $500, realistically we will need around $2,000 to head out there. Every dollar helps and we are grateful for each and every one!


So, please aid us in making our highly anticipated trip out to Augusta, South Carolina, to give us a shot at a Collegiate National Championship! 


If you make a generous enough donation and wish to have one of our jerseys as a perk, please include the size of the jersey you would like with the address you wish us to send it to!


If you have any questions or want to contact the UCSB Disc Golf Team, please email us at Mikesale3@gmail.com

story: Hi, my name is Jamie, I am 25 years old, I come from a low income family. My parents also come from low income families. Growing up in a low income household can be tough. We had love, and support from eachother to make it through our hard times, but recently we found out about our grandmother, who recently developed cancer, needed to be treated out of state. Being low income, and having family members helping her out times are getting even harder for her. There are so many costs going through treatments, paying for medications, travel expenses ect. that it is getting very hard for her to come up with the money for her medical expenses. We are trying to raise $5000 for her for her operation, treatments, medications, travel expenses, a motel room for the few weeks she will be there, and anything else related to her condition with cancer. Even if we do not meet our goal of $5000 the money will still go twards her treatments. I live out of state and my immediate family is also very low income. We cannot be there for my grandma in person, I would really love to be there for her but with living expenses and providing for my family we do not have the extra money to travel to New York from Florida. This is my way of trying to help my grandmother, I thank indiegogo.com for making it easy for me to help her, this is the only site that I have found that i could trust. If you could please help my grandmother get the treatments she needs we, (grandma and the family), would be greatly apprecieative of your help and support to make her treatments possible. Thank you for the time you took to read about my grandmother, and thank you for helping me raise the money it takes to make my grandmother healthy again.

story:
Our Story

Our mother turned 62 this year but this year has been different from any other. December 2010 my mother woke one night vomiting blood. I rushed her to the hospital due to the amount of blood. The doctors confirmed what we thought, she had a stomach ulcer. The next day the doctor came in and informed us that something was strange on my mother's X-ray and the hospital was not equipped to diagnose the issue and would transfer her to Greenville, but refused to tell us anything. After arriving at Greenville and several test later we were informed that my mother has cirrhosis of the liver, stage 4 caused by hepatitis C. The doctor informed us that in the late 70's and early 80's many people contracted Hepititis C due to blood transfusions because this was not checked by hospitals back then. p>


The Impact

At stage four the only hope my mother has is a liver transplant but currently her insurance will not pay for a transplant. Without a transplant my mother doesn't have a long time left but with a new liver she could live to be 90 plus. Mom has a 6 year old granddaughter and we want her to be a part of her and our life for as long as possible. We are taking as many steps as we possibly can by changing her diet and increasing exercise but this will only help so much. Currently she takes 8 different medications (some insurance doesn't pay) plus shots. Mom is seeing the doctors now every 2 months. She has been hospitalized 3 times since finding out this news. This has changed our lives and we are trying to do everything we can to make her happy and keep her going. Sometimes we forget that she has this awful stuff going on in her body but then we will quickly be reminded by doctors or emergency room visits. Mom has the best attitude and keeps pushing herself to stay in the best health she can. p>


What We Need

All the money we raise will be used to pay for Moms medical bills and treatments. Every dollar helps no amount too small.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word about this campaign, we need all the support we can get! Share this page with everyone you know, www.indiegogo.com/Cindy-Browning Thank you for your generosity!

story:
My name is Aaron DeTienne and I'm originally from Northern Colorado.  I joined the Air Force last year and in order to maintain the best shape I'd ever been in (basic training), I got into triathalons.

As most of you know the government has cut a lot of the normal funding for troops.  Normally there is enough money in the budget to hold an event for our deployed troops coming home.  This year, however, there isn't enough money.

I will be competing in the Boise 1/2 Ironman and I'm askng for pledges.  100% of the money donated will be given to the "Warrior Club" who puts on the "Coming Home" event.

THE EVENT

The 1/2 Ironman consists of the three parts of a triathalon.

1) 1.2 Mile Swim

2) 56 Mile Bike Ride

3) 13.1 Mile run (1/2 marathon)

The timer starts when you hit the water and stops when I cross the finish line after the run.

The maximum allowed time is 8 hous and 30 minutes

 

For more info on the Boise Iron-Man check out this link:

http://www.ironman.com/triathlon/events/ironman-70.3/boise.aspx#axzz2VDTWYWYS

story:
Short Summary

The documentary “Ayurveda: Healing the victim and the slayer” serves as a medium to inform and awaken the public concerning the issue of Ayurveda, the ancient Indian therapeutic method. Moreover, demonstrates facts of the imminent danger faced by one of the primary botanical gardens of Southern India which hosts plants of exquisite pharmaceutical value. Ayurvedic and Yunani ( Ionian-Greek) therapeutical Art is based on these rare plants which are threatened by extinction.

Indicative is the fact that Yunanian Medicine/Healing method is a descendant of the therapeutic methods that Hippokrates used in ancient Greece, a few parts of which are still preserved in Greek Phytotherapy.

Both Ayurveda and Yunani therapeutic methods are consider either complementary or alternative healing methods in the Western world, and are being adopted by 83% of the Indian population nowadays.

To continue with, Dr. Aithal (the main therapist protagonist of the documentary) shows us his personal journey through the creation of his prototypal botanical garden as well as the therapies he offers his fellow citizens and animals free of charge. He also reveals his therapeutic “discoveries” and secrets, since he considers knowledge to be a product of God’s wisdom and not his.

The Impact

This project is very important for the world to know, because it shows that by using alternative medicine/natural methods we are able to cure illneses that can't be cured with classical methods even nowadays that medicine has progressed so much.

Your contribution will make a big difference to the world by helping us completing this documentary. Give us the oportunity to inform the people that there are alternative ways to deal with their medical problems without having to pay a huge amount of money to hospitals and chemical drugs. They should know that they have a choice. 

Moreover  Dr. Aithal casts enormous effort in spreading his knowledge of Ayurvedic medicine to the new generations so it won't be lost in the future.

Our production team in order to help Dr. Aithal we are commited to donate 10 % of our current funding budget and 15% of all future gains from the documentary to sustain his botanical garden and his school of Ayurvedic medicine.

Because Indieggo can't recognise web site names with dash in between the name,

please check the websites www.vfx-post.com for more information about Dimitris Kadis

and www.homeopathy-vletsi.com for our Scientific advisor Dr. Evangelia Vletsi 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We will need a distributor after the documentary is finished. Anybody interested please feel free to contact us.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools! and spread the word.

Thank you very much for your support.

story:
Thanks so much to our contributors, so far!  You are each an amazing and wonderful person.

We are still working to improve The 'Spring, and we've placed the first oil order for fulfillment.  Exciting stuff!  We won't be placing another oil order until the end of the campaign, and we only did this first, smaller order because we were out of a couple of oils, anyway.  

So please, tell all your friends!  1000 people donating $5.00 each is just as great as 50 donating $100.00... together we can move mountains and bring the benefits of The 'Spring to everyone who needs them.

Don't forget - some of the services can be provided from a distance!  Theta healing is available over the phone or skype, for instance, as are card readings.

Please remember us come payday and take advantage of the wonderful perks we've offered!  

Updated: 10-18-12

__________________

Hello!  My name is Grandma Tilly and I am the owner and operator of The Wellspring Center for Holistic Healing.  I am many things to many people, including spiritual advisor/minister, wife, mother, lesbian activist, grandma, sister, friend, and so much more.  I am also a Theta healer and energy healer.  

I love running The 'Spring because it affords me the opportunity to work with and help so many people in our community, and through the wonderful world of skype and the 'net - people from around the country.  

The campaign we've started on Indiegogo is incredibly important for the future of our business.  When we opened, we were charging the "going rates" for services, and discovered that most people can't afford to pay $60.00 bucks an hour or more for Reiki or Theta when their insurance will cover a visit to the local pain clinic for a co-pay of $20.00.  Would they love to have holistic healing as a part of their recovery or wellness process?  Yup.  Can they afford it?  Not really.

With the funds raised here on Indiegogo, we're going to incorporate The Spring as a non-profit organization and hire a grant-writer to help us fund the center for an even wider service protocol; including holistic substance abuse treatment services to help the local drug and alcohol addiction treatment centers!  How exciting is that?  We think it's pretty dang exciting!

By contributing to our campaign, you will be helping us to help many others.  Every dollar you contribute is exponential in its ability to heal and project goodness to those who so desperately need our help. 

What We Need & What You Get

The 501-c-3 costs will come out of the $5000.00 first and foremost.  This will put us on a playing feild where local and outside businesses and individuals can contribute to our center and receive the tax deduction for their gift.

Next, we'll hire a grant writer for roughly $1500.00.

All of these processes take time, of course, so the remainder of the funds raised from this intial campaign will keep The 'Spring in full swing as we iron out the details of our incorporation and search for grants and programs for which we might qualify.  

Currently, our rent is only $350.00, but we need to expand. We can rent a second room in our building for $200.00 that will become our new treatment room, and expand our retail space to offer more multi-faith goods to our community.  Remember, all of the proceeds from the retail shop go to support The 'Spring, as well.  (See, there's that exponential investment again.) We'll pay for three months of rent from the funds raised here, for a total of $1650.00.

The remaining $1350.00 will be used for stipends and other expenses (insurance, internet bills - our electricity is included in the rent for the office space, yay! - and to purchase the supplies necessary for the perks).  We should have enough to meet our obligations to you, our investors, as well as sundry expenses for at least three months.

If we do not meet our funding goal, we'll use the funds for these same expenditures in the order they are listed.  First - we'll put it aside for the incorporation, next: the grant writer, then: rent and other expenses.  The very last thing the funds would be used for is stipends.

If we fund more than we're planning, we'll use the excess funds to create new programs earlier than expected and create working partnerships with other services in our community - such as the local hopsital, the drug courts, and the mental health services department. 

The Impact

There are many people in the world who know how awesome and powerful holistic healing is.  We see it every day.  

Last week, one of our clients stopped by for an energy healing session before she underwent brain surgery.  She was frightened, as you can imagine.  She had arranged to take several months off work and planned her convelescence at her mother's home prior to her last day at work, and was worried about how long she would be "under the weather." 

After an hour of intensive energy work with three experienced practitioners, she was confident, relaxed and ready to take on the world - and the surgeon.  

On the day of her surgery, she spent less than one hour in recovery and less than 2 days in the hospital.  One week later, and she was ready to return to living on her own - actually, she was ready long before that, but her mother insisted she stay a while longer.

We did not charge this woman a single dime for the services we provided.  She needed the work, and her insurance doesn't cover it. She has enough expenses to worry about with co-payments on incredbily expensive surgery and follow-up care/treatments.  

When you help us set up this holistic healing center in the way we've planned, you'll help us provide this type of service to a great number of individuals who truly need it; who can benefit from it; and who deserve it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially at this time, we completely understand.  But you can share - you can talk to your friends and family and let them know what we're doing here.  Please, use the tools on this website for just copy and paste the link into your facebooks, tumblrs, anywhere you can to help us spread the word.

Hello!  My name is Grandma Tilly and I am the owner and operator of The Wellspring Center for Holistic Healing.  I am many things to many people, including spiritual advisor/minister, wife, mother, lesbian activist, grandma, sister, friend, and so much more.  I am also a Theta healer and energy healer.  
I love running The 'Spring because it affords me the opportunity to work with and help so many people in our community, and through the wonderful world of skype and the 'net - people from around the country.  
The campaign we've started on Indiegogo is incredibly important for the future of our business.  When we opened, we were charging the "going rates" for services, and discovered that most people can't afford to pay $60.00 bucks an hour or more for Reiki or Theta when their insurance will cover a visit to the local pain clinic for a co-pay of $20.00.  Would they love to have holistic healing as a part of their recovery or wellness process?  Yup.  Can they afford it?  Not really.
With the funds raised here on Indiegogo, we're going to incorporate The Spring as a non-profit organization and hire a grant-writer to help us fund the center for an even wider service protocol; including holistic substance abuse treatment services to help the local drug and alcohol addiction treatment centers!  How exciting is that?  We think it's pretty dang exciting!
By contributing to our campaign, you will be helping us to help many others.  Every dollar you contribute is exponential in its ability to heal and project goodness to those who so desperately need our help. 
What We Need & What You Get


The 501-c-3 costs will come out of the $5000.00 first and foremost.  This will put us on a playing feild where local and outside businesses and individuals can contribute to our center and receive the tax deduction for their gift.
Next, we'll hire a grant writer for roughly $1500.00.
All of these processes take time, of course, so the remainder of the funds raised from this intial campaign will keep The 'Spring in full swing as we iron out the details of our incorporation and search for grants and programs for which we might qualify.  
Currently, our rent is only $350.00, but we need to expand. We can rent a second room in our building for $200.00 that will become our new treatment room, and expand our retail space to offer more multi-faith goods to our community.  Remember, all of the proceeds from the retail shop go to support The 'Spring, as well.  (See, there's that exponential investment again.) We'll pay for three months of rent from the funds raised here, for a total of $1650.00.
The remaining $1350.00 will be used for stipends and other expenses (insurance, internet bills - our electricity is included in the rent for the office space, yay! - and to purchase the supplies necessary for the perks).  We should have enough to meet our obligations to you, our investors, as well as sundry expenses for at least three months.
If we do not meet our funding goal, we'll use the funds for these same expenditures in the order they are listed.  First - we'll put it aside for the incorporation, next: the grant writer, then: rent and other expenses.  The very last thing the funds would be used for is stipends.
If we fund more than we're planning, we'll use the excess funds to create new programs earlier than expected and create working partnerships with other services in our community - such as the local hopsital, the drug courts, and the mental health services department. 
The Impact


There are many people in the world who know how awesome and powerful holistic healing is.  We see it every day.  
Last week, one of our clients stopped by for an energy healing session before she underwent brain surgery.  She was frightened, as you can imagine.  She had arranged to take several months off work and planned her convelescence at her mother's home prior to her last day at work, and was worried about how long she would be "under the weather." 
After an hour of intensive energy work with three experienced practitioners, she was confident, relaxed and ready to take on the world - and the surgeon.  
On the day of her surgery, she spent less than one hour in recovery and less than 2 days in the hospital.  One week later, and she was ready to return to living on her own - actually, she was ready long before that, but her mother insisted she stay a while longer.
We did not charge this woman a single dime for the services we provided.  She needed the work, and her insurance doesn't cover it. She has enough expenses to worry about with co-payments on incredbily expensive surgery and follow-up care/treatments.  
When you help us set up this holistic healing center in the way we've planned, you'll help us provide this type of service to a great number of individuals who truly need it; who can benefit from it; and who deserve it.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to help financially at this time, we completely understand.  But you can share - you can talk to your friends and family and let them know what we're doing here.  Please, use the tools on this website for just copy and paste the link into your facebooks, tumblrs, anywhere you can to help us spread the word.

story:
In 2006, I spent time volunteering in Phnom Penh Cambodia.

I met Sambon - a teenage orphan living with my Khmer teacher and her family in poor circumstances. She had nothing and was fortunate to have a roof over her head. She earns her keep my helping around their home. Sambon was grateful for a few T-shirts and a pair of sandals I bought her.

Her biggest health issue was that she had absolutely no teeth (reasonably common in Cambodia). This also affected her confidence and chance of finding a job, a husband and having her own family - finally some independence.

My mum and I paid for a full set of new teeth for her and took her to all her dentist appointments.

Recently my Khmer teacher - Samnang - has contacted me again to say that Sambon's teeth are starting to need work, totalling a few hundred dollars. In a country where many people still live on a dollar a day, this is a big deal.

I am hoping people will help me to get Sambon's teeth fixed! Ultimately I would also like to help her get some English lessons and some training - but one step at a time!

Anything you could spare would really help to make a difference.

story:
About me

Hi, my name is Tangliang, i am from China. We are the cubieboard team.

About Cubieboard

 

Cubieboard is a low cost high performance ARM board, featuring the following:

  • 1G ARM cortex-A8 processor, NEON, VFPv3, 256KB L2 cache
  • Mali400, OpenGL ES GPU
  • 1GB DDR3 @480MHz
  • HDMI 1080p Output
  • 10/100M Ethernet
  • 4GB Nand Flash
  • 2 USB Host, 1 micro SD slot, 1 SATA, 1 ir
  • 96 extend pin including I2C, SPI, RGB/LVDS, CSI/TS, FM-IN, ADC, CVBS, VGA, SPDIF-OUT, R-TP..
  • Running Android, Ubuntu and other Linux distributions

 

What can cubieboard be used for

Lightweight Linux Desktop - With USB mouse and keyboard and HDMI monitor to cubieboard, you can use it as a light weight linux desktop. Cubieboard support most of the ARM linux distributions such as Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, Arch ARM Linux, Puppy etc.

Android TV - Connect wifi dongle and the wireless air mouse to cubieboard, and HDMI output to TV. You can enjoy Android with Youtube, Netflix and many more apps on cubieboard.

NAS - Cubieboard can drive 2.5 inch hard disk, you can use it as a home network file server.

Home Automation - There are 96 pin expansion headers on cubieboard, most of them can be used as GPIO. With network access, you can control a lot of things.

 

 

Why we need your help

The cubieboard team is a small team and if we want to make the cost of the board go down, we must make many at a time. We need to fund enough money to make 1000 boards.

story:
Meet Brooks :) He is the youngest of my 4 children (2 boys, 2 stepdaughters) in his family, having turned 4 in Jan 15/2013. Brooks is a child that no matter what life throws at him, has a smile on his face, and a gleam in his eye.  He is one of the funniest, caring children I have ever known.  In 2012, Brooks was diagnosed with Cystinosis. 

Cystinosis is a rare genetic disorder[2] that causes an accumulation of the amino acid cystine within cells, forming crystals that can build up and damage the cells. These crystals negatively affect many systems in the body, especially the kidneys and eyes.

By about age two, cystine crystals may also be present in the cornea. The buildup of these crystals in the eye causes an increased sensitivity to light (photophobia). Without treatment, children with cystinosis are likely to experience complete kidney failure by about age ten. Other signs and symptoms that may occur in untreated patients include muscle deterioration, blindness, inability to swallow, impaired sweating, decreased hair and skin pigmentation, diabetes, and thyroid and nervous system problems.

Brooks has started a new medicine (combined with the other 10 he takes throughout the day) Called Cystagon.  Since starting treatment, his blood levels have gone up considerably, and his body is reacting nicely.

The Cystinosis research foundation was established in 2003 (Natalies wish) The CRF is committed to find better treatments for Cystinosis and to a find a cure for this devestating disease. 

The past few years the research foundation has made considerable headway in finding a cure, however, like most foundations, the proper funding is required in order to make this possible,

All donations made on this page will be placed with the Cystinosis Research Foundation (CRF) No donation is too small.  Please help Brooks and other children like him be able to live a long, happy normal life, like all children should.

The website says that perks are a great way to "Boost" your campaign, and while that may be true, the only perk I can really offer is my warmest and most sincere thank-you to each and every one of you that takes the time to give their support.
