story:
Hi and Thank You for visiting my campaign! 

My name is Makayla Pasco and I have scoliosis.  Scoliosis is a medical condition in which a person's spine grows curved from side to side.  Although it is a complex deformity, on an X-ray, viewed from the rear, the spine of an individual with scoliosis may look more like an "S" or a "C",  as you can see in my x-ray above.  

Now a little about me!  I have always loved sports, especially soccer.  Soccer has always been one of my passions and I began playing when I was 5.  I quit at 15 but after being inspired by the 2010 World Cup, I decided to try out for my junior college soccer team.  After two semesters of training, I made the team!  I knew that it would be alot of work to get back into shape but it felt like my body was rejecting all of my efforts.  Breathing was really difficult and recovering from a short sprint was almost impossible.  Deep, painful cramps would pinch my sides, making running really hard and my knees felt like they were always in the wrong direction.  One day after practice, I went to visit my step mom and half brother and I complained that my back hurt.  When I bent over to stretch it out, my step moms face was filled with horror at my lobsided back.  Her shock influenced us to schedule x-rays and that's where we discovered that my scoliosis had worsened.

 

Here we are now a year later, scheduling my surgery!  

I was diagnosed with scoliosis at a young age and endured 4 years of bracing.  My treatment required me to wear a day brace and a night brace, only taking it off to shower or play sports.  The day brace I had was smaller but permanently disfigured my waist line.  Because of my day brace, I had to buy large clothes that would fit over it.  I felt so insecure that I usually wore really large sweatshirts, even when it was hot outside.  Sometimes, that gave me rashes from the hot plastic rubbing up against my skin.  My night brace was much larger than the day brace and rendered me imobile during the night. It forced my hips straight but tilted my upper body, making sleeping very difficult.  I fell asleep crying from the discomfort most nights.  At 13, I was freed from the brace and told by my doctor that I did not need to come back because I was finished growing so there was nothing more the brace could do for me.  Since then, my back has progressed from 35 degrees to 50-55, depending on who is reading the x-ray.  This is because I have progressive scolisosis.  I've been told that it is extremely rare and most patients who are treated by bracing do not experience this.  As a result of this condition, my lungs are being crushed by my deformed rib cage, my heart is not in the correct cavity, and I have shrunk an inch!  In addition, my  hips are rotated causing my spine to rotate and my surrounding muscles are very tight.  I have had knee surgery on my left knee, possibly because of the way my scoliosis is twisting my legs.  Everyday activities are painful such as sitting, walking, running, and standing.  If i am not treated by surgery soon, it will continue to progress 1-2 degrees a year for the rest of my life!   

 

Your contribution to my surgery and recovery would give me a chance at living a life without pain and discomfort.  I would have the opportunity to play soccer at my full potential or do anything physical that I could not before!  With surgery, I also will grow a couple of inches so that would be really cool too :)

 

Examples of expenses I will need help with:

Surgery co-pay, hotel for my family, physical therapy for 6 months to a year, home care, and im sure other things i havent thought about!

 

 

A Note from my Mom!

Hi everyone and thank you so much for reading Makayla's indiegogo page.  As a mother, you only want the best for your children.  Makayla was always a leader with her friends when she was in grade school.  When the back brace was implemented, I watched my sparkling leader shrink into the backround.  Her outspoken confidence went inside her somewhere and was replaced by uncertainty and self conciousness.  My little leader became a wall flower.  I would love nothing more for Makayla's pain and deformed back to be replaced with a straight spine and straight forward, outgoing, confident personality once again.  She is so beautiful to me inside and out and deserves a life free of pain and discomfort.  We just need some assistance with the overwhelming expenses of this surgery and recovery costs.

 Thank you again, Barbara

story:
InciteYourself

Have you ever needed information so important it could save your life? Information that you knew was there but was just out of your grasp? I know I have.

In the world we live in today we are recording everything we do and yet we don't have easy access to this data or the insights it might provide. If large advertising companies, grocery stores, university research scientists, politicians have access to models that represent us why don't we? During my search for answers I discovered it was because no one has built it yet. Until Now

The story

When my youngest daughter was a few weeks old my wife and I noticed that something was wrong, our daughter wasn't gaining weight and appeared to be in pain constantly. We read and researched, studied and connected with other families, talked to our friends and doctors. We ended up with a bunch of guesses and no answers. But we did have a supportive community to help us try new things and vet suggestions. Eventually my wife and I started to notice a pattern. Our daughter would suffer the most close to feedings. This was fantastic we finally were able to find a pattern.  What we needed now was a way for mom to stay nourished, eating enough calories to provide for mom and baby while at the same time discover the offending foods. InciteYourself was born out of a need that I had that I could not find. We needed a way to record what food mom ate when while also recording what reactions baby had at what times of what severity so I could ask a few simple questions, what are the top 10 ingredients eaten 4, 6, 8, or 10 hours prior to the most sever reactions in baby. 

What took weeks of trial and error could have been discovered with a few days of recording. We eventually discovered that even the slightest amount of dairy was causing major discomfort to this baby we loved so much.

The more I thought of the engine I wanted to build the more I thought of information about myself that would prove valuable.

What we are building

InciteYourself is a pattern finding prediction and query engine using the same big data resources available to large corporations but specific to YOU. Empowering you to make informed decisions, discover your habits so you can break them and help incite the change we desire through insight into ourselves. 

InciteYourself is an online web application and mobile platform that ties together the plethora of metadata we generate about ourselves through questions you ask. Some answers are predictions, some might be charts, some might be a distinct NO, while others might be a reminder or encouragement. But each answer will be distinctly yours, calculated against your fitbit data or your withings scale, your web browsing habits or the weather. 

Using arbitrary data sources you can learn some very exciting things about yourself. Some questions you might ask are: 

  • What day should I take my test?  
  • What was the weather like on the day I walked the farthest?  
  • What sites have I looked at on rainy days in the afternoon?  
  • What are the five most common things I eat prior to an abnormal glucose test?
  • Here is an example of some potential alerts.
  • Let me know if I've had more than five days in a row with less than five hours of sleep.
  • Let me know every time I beat my previous step record.
And one of my personal favorites: 
  • Let me sleep 45 minutes longer on days it's raining. 

How we do it

By leveraging the vast data stores we collect about ourselves combined with cutting edge big data visualization techniques you can get information you understand. 

Hardware sensors and Apis we will support out of the gate:

  • HumanAPI
  • Body media
  • Fitbit
  • Moves
  • Health graph
  • Glooko
  • Emotive EEG
  • iHealth
  • 23andMe
  • National weather prediction
  • Google Predict
  • RescueTime
  • Melon
  • Geo location Apis
  • Instagram
  • Twitter
  • 4square
  • Fred
  • National Census
  • Nest

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funding to help grow the application quickly and to get the word out. Essentially we need you, we need to know what information is important to you, what would you have liked to know sooner, what might have been prevented if it were caught earlier. 

Most of the funding will go to pay hosting and CPU cost, software licenses to bring the richest user experience we can provide and to hire top notch talent to help with the building of this exciting platform.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone has the means to contribute financially. But that doesn't mean we don't need you! In order to make the most diverse questions we need to hear from you, what questions would you add? What data would you like to add? Follow is on Facebook or Twitter and start the discussion about what would incite you using the hashtag #InciteYourself

story:
Solace for the Children provides medical care, as well as education and leadership development for the children of war-torn countries. Since 1997, our organization has been inspiring volunteers to take children in to their homes and see that they have their critical medical needs met.

Wherever children are affected by war, Solace will offer the children healing and tools for bringing lasting peace, beginning with the children of Afghanistan.

This year God put it on my heart to start a Solace for the Children branch in Southern Pines, NC. We started late (December) so we focused on getting good host families and good volunteers first. Now we have to get the funding for transportation.

It cost over $3000 per each child just for the transportation and travel related expenses to bring them to the USA. This year Southern Pines,NC branch will be bringing six children starting on June 21, 2003. 

We have run out of time, the host families are set, the plane tickets reserved, the medical providers are preparing for their arrival. To make this happening I am doing something crazy, I'm selling my "Truck for Buck". For the first 300 donors that donate $60 or more to Solace for the Children-Southern Pines their names will be entered into a drawing. On July 20th, I will have one of the kids draw from a maximum 300 names and that person will have the right to buy my used Toyota 4Runner (in picture above) for one dollar. We are giving 60 opportunities for donors to the public through Indiegogo. 

Contact me at bart.clark@solaceforthechildren.org or 910-420-0814 if you have any questions.

story:
The Yoga Project

Dear friends,

I have a story, but that's not what this is about. Sure I've had my share of hardships and the side dishes of anxiety, escapism, insomnia and depression that have challenged me. I am sure you have too. I have found that it is not the story that matters, but what I do with what I've learned. We all have difficulties, but there is always someone who is facing something harder. Kids, especially deserve our attention.  In our overstimulated, overstressed world, where lockdown drills are part of their educational experience, kids deserve a safe place. A place where they can connect with who they are and what they want to become. If their world is rife with stress or violence, it affects many people, and eventually, many more. So, instead of telling my story, I am taking action to become part of a larger community story, to contribute towards better options through the health practice of yoga. My goal is to train to teach and offer yoga therapy to mothers and kids who are experiencing stress or hardship.

As I’ve worked through difficult periods in my life, with the accompanying stress and anxiety, I have gained a deeper appreciation for suffering. I have found strength through yoga. It has literally been the pathway to peace and given me a sense of being at the wheel of my life. It has given me tools to work with in times of weakness and despair, and helped me find rest. This has inspired me to become a lifelong student of the practice and pursue teaching. I know firsthand that the practice of yoga can ease suffering in mind, body and spirit. I want to put that knowledge to use and become a resource in my community. I aim to offer yoga to people who might normally have no access to it due to economic hardship or circumstance. I want to bring yoga into schools and shelters, and eventually integrate with health providers. I specifically want to offer this health option to women and children.

Yoga has proven beneficial effects, and is now a widely accepted health practice by the medical community. Yoga promotes many health benefits for both adults and children, including:

  • Improved ability to focus
  • A healthy and balanced sense of strength
  • Emotional balance
  • Increased flexibility and cardio strength
  • Decreased anxiety and insomnia
  • A sense of calm and quality of life

My long term intention is to be a yoga therapist and create more access to this health practice. I want to concentrate my efforts towards those who are encountering significant stress or illness. I am particularly inspired by people working with kids who face great difficulties just growing up. 

About Me

I am a mother, raising an amazing son, a creative professional and a lifelong student of health and nutrition. Making a contribution to society is important to me, especially investing in the kids. I have practiced yoga in a sporadic way for the last 20 years in an attempt to find peace and balance. The last few years, as I faced some extraordinary challenges, while being a mother to a young child, I finally got it. As I turned more and more to yoga, I learned the nourishment and healing that this very basic practice can provide. It offered me a path to peace through my body and calmed my anxious, chattering mind. I still find my time on the yoga mat to be challenging, yet the benefits continue to spread out like concentric circles through my life and offer rewards in a very measurable way.

Vision

This campaign is the first step towards becoming a certified yoga therapist, beginning with my 200 hour teacher training this summer. I'll then pursue my 500 hour training and specialized yoga therapy certification.

I want to bring the empowering potential of yoga practice into communities that are experiencing need, but have no access to yoga, or peace and quiet.  Specifically, I want to work with mothers and children who may find themselves up against great odds, due to economic hardship, divorce, domestic violence, PTSD, bullying at school or work, depression or illness. I want to offer a way to access inner strength through a mind-body practice that can be done anywhere, for free. 

Plan

I plan to complete my first level of yoga certification this summer through intensive workshops. I've been studying with a gifted set of teachers at a studio in Austin who's training is accredited by the Yoga Alliance, which means they are legit. I will continue my full time job and arrange my time around the intensives. I will need to raise $3000 to achieve this goal, and $300 to facilitate this effort, which I hope to raise through this campaign. I will pay forward every cent.

Once I complete this training, I will get my sea legs as a teacher by offering yoga for free through a community yoga project, which brings yoga to domestic violence and children’s shelters in Austin. I will also connect with a few local teachers who are bringing yoga to kids in after-school programs.

Details

The training costs $3000, which I intend to pay forward as outlined on the right. For every dollar given, a connection will be made, a gesture of support, strength and healing.

The inspiration to help others comes from my own experience. I understand. Its as if I  have found a flashlight in a dark tunnel. It shines on a pathway that leads out into the light. I want to share that path I have found to standing in the sun, connected to a strong self, to others and to life. 

How You Can Help

Donate if you can, and you will be rewarded by the knowledge that you helped someone somewhere achieve a little peace in a difficult world, or at least gave your energy towards that end. You can also share this campaign with people you know. I will honor every gesture of good will sent my way.

Thank you for your time spent reading this, your support and encouragement.

Sincerely,

P.A. Hastings

story:
Giving Back - Running a half Marathon!

I will be running in the Hooters Half Marathon, in Fort Myers. The Hooters Half is raising money for cancer research through the Moffitt Cancer Center.  In preparation for this event, I will be doing some fundraising of my own.  The proceeds I raise will go towards Moffitt Cancer Center and my yearlong mission trip traveling around the world.  

 

Your donation will be helping me reach my dream of world missions as I share Gods love to others around the WORLD, and benefit Cancer research, which impacts many family and friends all around us.

 

Please jump on mission with me to give back!

 

20% of Your donation will go towards the Moffitt Cancer Center for Cancer research, the rest will go towards my yearlong mission trip, The World Race.

 

I will be running the 13.1 miles in Fort Myers on March 4th. This will be the farthest I have ever ran, and trust me, 13.1 miles is no joke!! I have been training for 8 weeks, and have about 4 weeks to go. 


 What I am Doing: 11 in 11 

I'm going on a year long mission trip to 11 different countries in 11 months, spending one full month in each country. I will be serving as a missionary with Adventures in Mission, participating in a program they offer called "The World Race." During these 11 months, my team and I will be partnering with multiple ministry contacts around the world. We will be serving in churches, helping with church planting, evangelism, working in orphanages, and teaching children. In addition, we will have many opportunities to work with and bring hope to women and children caught in prostitution as a result of human trafficking. 

I am very excited to see what God will do in and through me in these places. This is an experience of a lifetime that will change my life dramatically. I will obtain a lot of different experience, and an ample amount of various culture exposure.

 I will be leaving in July 2012, and returning May 2013. The countries that I will be serving in consist of: Ireland, Russia, Ukraine, Mozambique, Tanzania, Kenya, India, Nepal, Cambodia, Malaysia, and another un-named country in Asia.



What I need

Let us get down to the nitty gritty! 
For The World Race, I need to raise &15,000 dollars. This will cover ALL of my expense for the whole year while on the field. That means housing (sometimes requiring tents), food (sometimes may include fried bugs?), and transportation (I will be flying and train riding through many different countries to get to our next location.). 

As of now, I have $14,000 left to raise. 

For this Giving Back campaign I would love to see at least $1100 raised in honor of my 11in11.

Please consider helping me in this campaign. I am really excited to be running my first half marathon, and am excited about my trip. I know I cannot do it without you all, and would be honored to call you my ministry partner!

Again, 20% of your donation for my fundraising will be going to the Moffitt Cancer Center!


Other Ways You Can Help:

This is not the only thing you can help me with! - First and foremost, please please post this everywhere!! Send it to anyone you think may be interested in supporting me either in this Half marathon, or in my trip in general!

Next please visit my World Race blog. There is a link on my Go Go page but here is a link too. This is a way you can donate directly to my World Race account if you would rather, and a way to stay connected and involved in what I am doing.
 I will be blogging prior and during my trip. Jillianmangoni.theworldrace.org

Finally, consider supporting me through out my trip. I am in need of support in 3 different ways

1. Prayerfully - I will need lots of prayer and encouragement though out this process

2. Financially- I need $14000 more for me to go on this trip. - Please consider supporting me in the way.

3. Gear- Camping and travel gear, Im looking for a bunch of things, if you could help out that would be great!!

story:
MOUTH MIRROR THAT WORKS AS SUCTION ALSO

A unique and innovative idea! These mirrors feature suction on the bottom and front sides to free up your hands and save you time.

  • Fewer instruments in the oral cavity
  • Less obstruction for the dentists and dental hygienists
  • Cleaning brush for the hose to remove debris
  • 6 holes in the mirror head - rapid suction while preventing suction on cheek and tongue
  • Color coded handles for easy identification
  • 100% stainless steel
  • Sure-grip autoclavable silicone handles

ME ,MY DESIGN AND DENTISTRY

I am Dr sarman shah and here is my humble contribution to field of dentistry

  • i am practicing dentist in India with 4 clinics and i am passionate about new ways and methods to improve dental treatment
  • we are selling these suction mouth mirrors in india and everybody who uses it loves it so here we are to give it to remaining world.

we are shipping now !!!!!

RND DONE . PROTOTYPES MADE . TESTING DONE ON PATIENTS . PRODUCTION FINISHED. WE ARE READY TO SHIP .

OUR PRODUCTION PARTNER IS CAPABLE OF MAKING 500 KITS A DAY SO YOU DONT HAVE TO WEIGHT FOR YOUR KIT TO ARRIVE.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BUY IT NOW AND STILL THINK THIS IS GOOD DESIGN BE SURE TO SPREAD THE WORD

 

LIVE LONG AND PROSPER

story:
I have never spearheaded one of these fundraiser and yes I am a little embarrassed that I can't just pull my check book and pay for this by myself but truth is - I can't. So I am reaching out to all of you to see if you can help.

Liyani's boyfriend Alex is going through a bit of a rough patch at the moment. He has an incredible passion for skateboarding and to tell you the truth I think he is really good and has great potential. He attended a skate camp once a while ago and loved it so much and when I ask him what his favorite memory in life is - he says those two weeks at Element Skate Camp. I have written to all imaginable possible sponsors I could think of to try and get him sponsored to attend this camp but they have not responded and time is running out.

Here is the link of the camp: My goal amount would be for two weeks of camp.

http://elementymcacamp.com/us/

It is sponsored from the YMCA but they are very strict as to who they give scholarships to and these only go to residents of the county where the skate camp is located. I have also written to Element directly but have not received a response either.

If you are interested here is a video of Alex that I "stole" off You Tube. He does not like to ask for help and would be embarrassed if he knew that I was doing this and that is why this is a private event.

This one is pretty old:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OyhNcMR82HQ

This one is newer:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yaY6ETCvs54

All I can say is thank you. Anything helps and know that you are making a difference? And on a sidenote - if you know Alex. Please don't mention this to him. If we reach the goal I will make sure he knows who his funders were but I do not want to make him uncomfortable about people coming together to help him out or his friends knowing about it and mentioning it to him....

Viji

story:
I got out of bed to make this video sorry for looking like a mess but this situation is stressful very. And remember anything you dontae for this cause you can always wright it off in your taxes.

Hi Folks im trying to get my mother from a poor country to America  i have done most of her immigration paper works im on the final step i have to pay for her physical and also her flight to come to America. I have not seen my mother since i was 18 im now 27.You can imagine how much we miss eachother i got straight to the point because the USCIS every application is time base if you miss one appoimtment they close your case and i already spent over one thousand dollars on my mom citizenship paper work. All i need help with now is help with the money for her phycical and the flight please folks.

And remember anything you dontae for this cause you can always wright it off in your taxes.

http://www.uscis.gov/portal/site/uscis

Once my mom comes to Ameraica i can take better care of her health like eating organic just being happy living a better life in America.

story:
Cause kids cant fight cancer alone

Welcome to my Team Little Fighters page, in memory of our little friend Javiercito Lopez-Watson AND

In honor of a close friend Alex Rivera AND my son Anthony Windauer a leukemia warrior! Our team will work together to raise money for a great cause. My son Anthony was diagnosed with A.L.L two years ago on- 11/27/09. A.L.L. is one of the many types of blood cancers that we desperately need a cure for, and this is why I fundraise. I am passionate about my fundraising, and know that I am making a difference to help find a cure! No chid will lose their battle to cancer or go through the pain of chemotherapy and everything that goes along with chemo therapy.

I ask you to donate what you can and in my heart I believe every penny counts! Anthony has 8 months left of treatment and he will be a success story -your donation will help make other endings as successful, so please donate today! I have set a goal to raise $2500, and I will not stop until a cure is found!

Light The Night Walk is The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's annual fundraising walk to pay tribute and bring hope to people battling cancer. Hundreds of thousands of participants raise funds for lifesaving research and patient services.

For more than 60 years, The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) has been solely focused on people with blood cancers. Presently, we have more than $250 million committed to research across the United States and in ten other countries. Every dollar is provided by concerned donors. We invest in the best, outcome based science:

  • Anywhere, with no geographic or institutional boundaries
  • Without profit incentive
  • To meet unmet Medicare needs of people with blood cancers

And LLS funded advances are helping patients beyond those for whom they were originally developed, including people with solid tumors and auto-immune diseases. In the past decade, nearly 50% (19 out of 39) of the cancer drugs approved by the FDA were approved as treatments for blood cancer patients. Twelve are already approved for people beyond those for whom they were first developed. With your help, we are saving lives.

  • A donation of $25 provides patients and their loved ones with FREE booklets that contain up-to-date information on their disease and help them make informed decisions about their treatment options.
  • A donation of $50 makes possible a Family Support group with a trained facilitator where comfort can be found and experiences can be shared among patients and family members.
  • A donation of $100 helps supply laboratory researchers with supplies and materials critical to carrying out their search for cures.
  • A donation of $1,000 makes possible one- on-one conversations with health care specialists who provide patients with information about their disease, treatment options, and helps prepare them with questions for their health care team.

Please join our team's effort today by registering to walk or by making a donation. Your participation in the Light The Night Walk will help save lives. Be sure to check our team Web site frequently to see our progress, and thanks for your support

 

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Cause kids cant fight cancer alone
Welcome to my Team Little Fighters page, in memory of our little friend Javiercito Lopez-Watson AND
In honor of a close friend Alex Rivera AND my son Anthony Windauer a leukemia warrior! Our team will work together to raise money for a great cause. My son Anthony was diagnosed with A.L.L two years ago on- 11/27/09. A.L.L. is one of the many types of blood cancers that we desperately need a cure for, and this is why I fundraise. I am passionate about my fundraising, and know that I am making a difference to help find a cure! No chid will lose their battle to cancer or go through the pain of chemotherapy and everything that goes along with chemo therapy.
I ask you to donate what you can and in my heart I believe every penny counts! Anthony has 8 months left of treatment and he will be a success story -your donation will help make other endings as successful, so please donate today! I have set a goal to raise $2500, and I will not stop until a cure is found!
Light The Night Walk is The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's annual fundraising walk to pay tribute and bring hope to people battling cancer. Hundreds of thousands of participants raise funds for lifesaving research and patient services.
For more than 60 years, The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) has been solely focused on people with blood cancers. Presently, we have more than $250 million committed to research across the United States and in ten other countries. Every dollar is provided by concerned donors. We invest in the best, outcome based science:

Anywhere, with no geographic or institutional boundaries 
Without profit incentive 
To meet unmet Medicare needs of people with blood cancers

And LLS funded advances are helping patients beyond those for whom they were originally developed, including people with solid tumors and auto-immune diseases. In the past decade, nearly 50% (19 out of 39) of the cancer drugs approved by the FDA were approved as treatments for blood cancer patients. Twelve are already approved for people beyond those for whom they were first developed. With your help, we are saving lives.

A donation of $25 provides patients and their loved ones with FREE booklets that contain up-to-date information on their disease and help them make informed decisions about their treatment options. 
A donation of $50 makes possible a Family Support group with a trained facilitator where comfort can be found and experiences can be shared among patients and family members. 
A donation of $100 helps supply laboratory researchers with supplies and materials critical to carrying out their search for cures. 
A donation of $1,000 makes possible one- on-one conversations with health care specialists who provide patients with information about their disease, treatment options, and helps prepare them with questions for their health care team.

Please join our team's effort today by registering to walk or by making a donation. Your participation in the Light The Night Walk will help save lives. Be sure to check our team Web site frequently to see our progress, and thanks for your support

 
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Summary

Erik Rush is a New York-born columnist, author and speaker who writes sociopolitical commentary. In February of 2007, Erik was the first to break the story of President (then Senator) Barack Obama’s ties to militant Chicago preacher Rev. Jeremiah Wright on a national level, which ignited a media firestorm that smolders to this day.

We're working to launch Erik's radio show, FULL-CONTACT on the italkUS streaming network. For a long time, fans have wanted to get this author and Fox News regular on air. Now's the chance to help!

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we we require some last-minute gear purchases (which will be covered by the funds in the goal, of course):

  • One Telos One x Six talk show telephone module
  • One Telos switch console
  • One Comrex BRIC-Link audio-to-IP convertor
  • Studio sundries

In return for your support, you will have the satisfaction of knowing you’ve helped to get the unvarnished message out about the political left and the Obama administration! For contributions of $50 or $100, we have reserved signed copies of Erik’s most recent books!

The Impact

If you're a concerned conservative or libertarian and you know Erik's work, you know that he's one of the few peole out there who tells it like it is! Imagine what we could do if we could get that word out to a large streaming and radio audience. Now you can help us to do that!

Other Ways to Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. You can still:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Distribute the link to this campaign
  • Remember, every little bit helps!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello ,

 

My name is Donald Castellano, some know me by my nickname D.J. and here’s my story. Originally married in 1997 at the young age of 17 , over the course of 8 years being a father to five beautiful children I knew life would be full of adventure and hard work ahead to support these children. Working a single job still wasn’t enough to support the family, devastatingly only to end in a divorce in 2007 due to irreconcilable differences. Going our separate ways and allowing her to have the children fulltime while I worked, still getting nowhere in life, I decided to continue my education I originally started before my marriage in 1996.

                While attending school during the daytime (Criminal Justice degree), I also attended night time schooling on my days off (Business & Management degree) to complete it in 2009. I was super proud of finally getting somewhere in life ,being successful towards my children’s future and well being that I decided to take my Criminal Justice degree even further. Moving from one school to the next (due to capacity of finishing an A.S to a B.S.), I stayed steady pursuing my dreams of being a CSI Forensic Examiner for Department of Homeland Security. I knew I would be a big role model to my children, to look up to and wonder why I pursued what I did in matters of my family’s Law Enforcement history. To cherish and be passionate about everything I loved doing, serving the community, protecting their safety, teaching right from wrong while protecting the States from terrorist activities, to say the least, I was there.

                Till one day I got a phone call from my oldest daughter, Hailey’s teacher. Walking into the room I was in shock to see their Mothers new Mother-In-Law, teacher & State Case Worker all at the table. I was in awe, confused and distracted of my children being in harm’s way. The time I had spent trying to become a better father through education, paying my Child Support & becoming a better role model, was the time that they were being hurt… Physically, emotional and traumatically, the living conditions they were in were horrid. The reports were novels long, lice infested hair, loss of weight due to starvation, abuse marks found on them from the nurse but no notification to me from the school. Their mother had kept it all a secret only to fuel herself of addictive habits with the child support & food stamps she received from the State of Florida for over 2 ½ years. A change had to come, this couldn’t be happening to my children.

                With the help of the State of Florida, I was awarded FULL CUSTODY in Early 2010 of all FIVE children miraculously. Something rarely unheard of, being a REAL father and taking the stand of both role models with inspirational outlooks, I was in for a longer road ahead. Devastatingly that year, June 2010, I took two HUGE blows to my family. 1) We lost a most wonderful cousin, whom was a State Trooper for the State of New Jersey which in turn 2) Caused me to lose my job, of being on Bereavement, to return to work early since my mother flew to New Jersey instead of me. I was in shock, in denial that this was happening the way it was in such a moment in my life of turmoil and disbelief, it couldn’t be.

                I took charge, liquidating all of my assets, focusing on raising my children the correct way and getting them back on track since they missed quite a few months of schooling and some. I took a leave of absence with my Bachelors degree at my current University with only a year left, the children needed me the most at this critical timing of their lives.  Three of my children were left back that year in school; my oldest daughters THIRD time being left back almost in a row due to lack of education and attendance being her main problematic area. Additional tutoring after school from myself, additional therapists twice a week ordered for them , family group counseling with the six of us over the course of a couple years was in place and last but not least speech therapy for two of my children due to problematic issues while growing up that was not addressed. They were progressing, F’s,D’s to C’s and up to their current point now of being Honor Roll students, the hard work was paying off. They were creative, developing stories for school that were amazing, awards brought home for best effort and dedication in anything they did, it was a priceless.

                Around the middle of 2011, I started becoming fatigued and in pain. Already bearing a single solitary kidney, always taking good care of my health already, something was wrong for this to happen. I went to my Primary Health Physician to be immediately rushed to the hospital due to high blood pressure. 200+/150+ at first it started… The pain was unbearable; they placed me on one blood pressure medication, only to temporarily work while figuring out what’s going on. Going to a Urologist, Nephrologist to Gastrologist, test after test, it seemed hopeless for a few months. Within a six month time period my Primary Care Physician placed me on 3 different types of blood pressure medications only to refer me to a pain clinic, since the blood pressure medications weren’t totally fixing the problem. Attending the Pain Clinic, I was originally placed on powerful Morphine doses twice a day with another pain medicine in between to resolve my problem from the pain that proceeded to start. 5 medications in total it took for my blood pressure to come back to somewhat a normal range and out of the stroke(or even death) levels they were at for months straight on end.

                I thought it was over, 6 months straight of tests and no resolution but medications that I would have to take for possibly the rest of my life, only being 31 now, it would be a long time. I had already visited the E.R. 17 times at this point, becoming frequent even with the Doctors in the Emergency section alone! Finally finding out what was going on, my Gastrologist had the results. February 2012 I had undergone a Colonoscopy to find out I had a tight, kinked bowel at the hepatic flexure with possible hernia(s) also developing. This was serious, the tests I have been through and also finding out I have kidney stones again (Third time in 10 months) the pain totally is almost indescribable.  2 months into taking the morphine my blood pressure started rising again, 5 medications later and still no permanent resolution, I returned back to my Primary Care once again.

                Upon multiple visits and tests again with the new specialist, the doctor declined to do surgery as a resolution on this matter.The rarity of my single kidney was causing my bowels to shift towards the right causing the very painful kink currently there at this moment. I don’t smoke, drink or use drugs but still stated due to the onset of the illness it was more of a risk then benefit.Too much of a “Maybe” was the results of everything and from the inconsistency of the problem the responsibility of surgeon,it was too much of a liability for a single doctor to handle this.

               This is where we are today, the present day and why I ask for your help. I am in desperate need for assistance so I can get back to doing what I do best, raising my children. I am sick and tired of being sick and tired, there has to be hope out to the public. I have no insurance,noone else to care for my children and therefore it seems where I need to be is what I cannot afford. I have given everything I earned since my childhood to my children, to help them be where they are today only to be stuck at a dead end with my health at a steady declining rate. I have nothing left to give to proceed at this point, so I am hoping for a miracle. Your donations will be used to help support my health issues in the following way:

1)      Travel costs to Shands hospital in Jacksonville,Florida for multiple visits and specific surgery from the team of doctors assigned.

2)      Medical costs for the doctor’s services on anything that would not be covered

3)       Caregiver assistance for my children during the 4-7 months downtime(I would need to hire a nanny as I don’t get much help with my children due to many reasons)

4)      Lodging expenses during the time period near the doctor’s offices for the timing in-between surgeries set.

5)      Bills accumulated at this time – See attached paperwork as I already received an eviction letter due to NO INCOME coming in to pay all of the bills. We received some donations from last fundraiser to help towards the bills but it only covered ¼ of them at this time!

6)      With recently obtaining shared cost Medicaid as insurance , some of the monies raised will be used for assistance in my monthly medication list and also any doctors that need funding before shared cost goal is met. We also have last months medical bills UNCOVERED at this time that will be paid for also.

 

** This is an updated fundraiser we are restarting due to us not meeting our previous goals. Currently to date we had a scheduled appointment on 8/14 @ Shands hospital that we used the previous funds for travel to meet with an assigned team of doctors on our case due to the intensity of the matter. We also found out ontop of the kinked bowel , the doctor performing a second physical found a large hernia (possibly two) set on the right side flank which is causing the increase in pain/elevated blood pressure scenario also. This is a HUGE find and the reason we set the fundraiser for the assistance to get a TEAM of doctors to find out the EXACT problem(s) and resolution to this alarming matter. I also had a SBS procedure done on 20th of July to get back the diagnosis of Crohn’s ontop of everything since I have had the pain start 3+ years ago, I am in the age range of this disease since it runs in my family history also. It is slowly developing but due to the anemia results + blood tests show the inflation is in my right side bowels and also affecting my Cecum too which is inflamed. Our next visit on the 28th of August will determine when the surgeons will operate to either remove some of the bowels to alleviate the pain somewhat or go from there. Attached you will find the denial letters I have received from the county to obtain assistance in help at this time and the 3 day notice of eviction I received today due to no money coming in. My attached letter shows me on bed rest due to my elevated blood pressure levels and I cannot do anything at this time, things are becoming serious!**//Some areas are blurred out for legal matters due to public media bindings that made my pain doctor/personal doctor discharge me due to this issue but the letters attached are as real as they come!

 

Our goals are around this rough ballpark at this time - Bedrest for 5-7 months from today and already it's been 3 months so approx 10 months of rent = $6500. Previous medical bills and co pays are around $4000 at this time due to shared cost insurance( the criteria met is $565 month in medical costs BEFORE it kicks in/does not include medications out of pocket seperately). Electric/Water for 5-7 months which is $2100 approx,travel to Tampa + Jacksonville at LEAST 3 more times scheduled $200-300 in travel costs and misc as needed. So roughly this time go around we need to raise $13000 + to be comfortable at this time, the previous bills are still lingering around so anything more than that would be used for them! This is an achievable goal that we can gain to by the supporting company helping with the fundraiser! Any questions please ask me in between surgeries or an admin assigned to the account. Thank you and GOD BLESS!

 

 

 

Your help is greatly appreciated; me and my children have a lot of love to give. They have always been taught with manners, respect and to give better than receive. If you cannot donate for the cause, please share also! Use the fantastic sharing tools that Indiegogo has to offer. Sharing is the best love anyone can have and we have a lot of it. We appreciate anything that you have to offer by just being, yourself. Talking over with my children, we thought of many ways to pay the community with the funds we receive and would go as follows. We created a Facebook page due to the criticalness of my health for daily updates which your name would be placed as a memorabilia from helping us. Also higher donors would be compensated an autographed picture in the donating range stated above, last but not least a PERSONAL card/drawing from us to you, thanking for supporting us in this timing. We hope you enjoy the perks as I am always fascinated as the artistic incline my children provide in drawings to me, directly from their heart. Please keep in contact with me and the children, we love SUPPORT also! Thank you and God bless!

 

*********************************************************

P.S. Sidenote section in relation to the sponsored perks.

Money Savings Card $10 Donations

More info for the $10 Money Savings card can be found here , questions and concerns can be addressed right from the sponsors website. This is an amazing deal per the sponsor, its FREE! 

http://www.moneysavingscard.com/

 

 

Sears Portrait Giftcards Information

Our Sears Portrait Studio fundraising cards are a great way to get family portraits at an amazing price. Cardholders get a $54.95 package including 3 portraits and Free sitting when they present the card. No hidden fees!

 

Walmart PictureMe Giftcards Information

The holder of the card is entitled to a FREE 8 x 8 portrait and two enchanced 5 x 5 portraits. And there is No Session Fee. It is a package with a retail value of $36.96!! No hidden fees!Here is an example link to the company sponsoring us - This is an idea of the products they offer! http://www.pictureme.com/cpi/en-US/Home.htm

 

 

With love,

Donald Castellano Sr.

Donald Castellano Jr.

Hailey Castellano

Austin Castellano

Emily Castellano

story:
About my Mum,

For much of my life i have seen her give to others. She is always the first to offer to help or take care of someone no matter who they are.

From helping kids in Bahamas with special needs that needed to just to be loved and supported, to including her patients in family events and giving her time and resourses to be sure that they were cared for properly to heling through wellness awareness as a nurse to being such a rock for her family and comminity, my mum has help so many. And more importantly given help to so many.

Her ablitly to love and help her comminity has inspired me my whole life. I have watched her get her Universtity degree while working and raising 5 kids! Yet during that time she always made time for us and showed us that your choices are imortant. She always said "You can not chose what happens to you, but you can always chose how you handle it". words I have live by my whole life. I always looked up to her for following her passions and or standing up for others. Especially for people who found it hard to do so. She has been a voice of advocacy for many years and helped so many.

Now is a time to give to her and it is my hope that with this site combined with our online auction site, We can help reaise the funds we need so she can have the choice to create a helaing treatment plan that works for her.

Mum has had to deal with canser alot in her life and she has always been able to come through it stronger then ever.

I admire her so much and support her choices. I hope that together we can all help reach this goal for her so that the finacial part of this can be taken away.

What We Need & How YOU can help

Together we can reach this goal!

  • Share this site with your community! Every donation counts.
  • Share you support through words....kind words of support help more then you know!
  • Make a bid on one of our online auction items at:
    • www.32auctions.com/helpingphyllisheal

100% of the funds raised go to my mum and her healing journey

Thank You!

Your contributions, either by words, funds or donations for the auction help so much in so many ways. This is a time of life where commonity matters more then ever and it is a time to give to a woman who has speant her whole live giving to others.

Our family thanks you for taking the time to read this and for your support !

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financialy, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Send words of support and share this with others. Sometimes shareing a storey like this can inspire others to help or give them the hope they needed.
  • Make a donation to our online auction site

With great love and kindness, we thank you!

story:
September 5, 2013 Update: I am completely overwhelmed by the outpouring of support this campaign has received. I reached my funding goal in 2 days. Thank you all so much - words can't express my gratitude. Anything raised over my initial goal will go to further transition healthcare costs. This medical care is expensive, and this fundraiser was originally set up to cover only specific portions of what I pay. Any help beyond the initial $2000 is incredibly appreciated and makes a big difference. This financial support takes a huge weight off my shoulders and means I can access the healthcare I need. Thank you thank you thank you.

---

My name is Jos Truitt, I'm a writer, Editor at Feministing.com, speaker, consultant, printmaker, baking enthusiast, and also a trans woman. I've started this fundraising page because I need help paying for expensive healthcare that's part of my transition and that's not covered by insurance.

I am currently undergoing $1,000 worth of laser hair removal. While I have been out for years now, hair removal has often been financially inaccessible to me. I was also screwed over by one laser company that stole money from a lot of clients. I have spent well over this $1,000 on hair removal, but this round of laser will go a long way to making me much more comfortable existing in public. I have very dark facial hair that's hard to hide and makes me feel like a target because it undermines my intended gender presentation. Unfortunately, hair removal is not considered necessary medical care for me and is not covered by insurance. With your help I will be able to complete this important part of my healthcare.

I am also going through another aspect of my transition that also costs $1,000. I am less comfortable discussing this part of my care in public, but it is also necessary medical care that is also not covered by insurance. 

I am uncomfortable with the current trans fundraising paradigm, including for reasons Janet Mock outlined in this great post. Fundraising works best for folks who are part of a network of people with money, which, given systemic inequalities, means it's mostly a successful approach for white trans folks from relatively class privileged communities. Additionally, individual fundraising does nothing to advance the cause of making trans healthcare accessible for all. It is a temporary fix and drain on our communities in the face of systemic inequality. Yet I have to reconcile these facts with the reality that I need help, now. That's why I'd like to ask that anyone who donates to this fundraiser consider a matching donation to an organization that works for justice for the trans community. I suggest sending matching donations to Transgender Gender Variant Intersex Justice Project (TGIJP), which focuses on the needs of trans, gender non-conforming, and intersex people of color who are caught up in the prison system. So for example, if you give me a $20 donation, please also consider donating $20 to TGIJP here.

Thank you for your help and support. It means the world to me.

story: ----------

Byrd was born a biological female. For the last twenty years, Byrd has identified as transgender. For most of Byrd’s adult life, he has practiced chest binding, a technique that flattens breast tissue to create a male-appearing chest.

As an alternative to binding, many trans men seek bilateral mastectomy, also called "top surgery." The procedure consists of the removal of the breasts and the shaping of a male contoured chest.

Byrd is scheduled to undergo top surgery in May 2013.

The cost of this transformation, including recovery time, is $10,000

It is Byrd’s desire that through his path others may be inspired to find their true selves.

As an alternative to binding, many trans men seek bilateral mastectomy, also called "top surgery." The procedure consists of the removal of the breasts and the shaping of a male contoured chest.
Byrd is scheduled to undergo top surgery in May 2013.
The cost of this transformation, including recovery time, is $10,000
It is Byrd’s desire that through his path others may be inspired to find their true selves.

story:
About my Grade 1 Teacher

Chuchi was my Grade 1 Teacher. She was an elementary school teacher for over 30 years and had touched many lives with her passionate approach to educate children. With 4 children of her own to raise, a husband to take care of, she had been a good example to her peers and has always shown compassion to her family's needs. On July 18, 2013, at the age of 59, she was found unconscious and had cardiac arrest. She was also diagnosed to have had TB and pneumonia. After 1 Pulmonologist, 1 Neurologist, 1 Cardiologist, 1 Internist, 2 Surgeons (1 for her Tracheostomy and 1 for her Percutaneous Endoscopic Gastrostomy operation), and over 2 months in Intensive Care Unit, she was still unconscious leaving her family a hospital bill of 1 Million Philippine Pesos (23,200 USD) . On September 28, 2013, she was released to her family for home care citing severe brain damage with very poor chances of recovery as seen in her latest EEG result. She is currently in a stupor state of consciousness and is being taken care by a caregiver with occasional laboratory tests and visits by doctor who specializes home care.

With her grandson, Gab.


Where Your Contribution Goes 

Teacher Chuchi's family and friends have been raising funds for her hospitalization from the start as there was no full coverage from her insurance company. Though released from the hospital, there is a balance of a little over 300,000 PHP (6,959.70 USD) which has been kindly scheduled to monthly installment payments. We set the goal to a realistic 10,000 USD, just enough to pay for the hospital bill balance and two weeks of home care expenses. 

Hospital Bill 

  • Total Professional Fees of all the Doctors involved - 265,000 PHP (6,146.95 USD)
  • Total Hospital Bill (ICU + Medicines incurred) - 590,000 PHP (13,687.40 USD)
  • Total Medicines purchased off pharmacy  -145,000 PHP (3,363.40 USD) 

Home Care Daily Expenses 

  • Nurse - 1,100 PHP / day (25.50 USD / day)
  • Medicines - 1,000 PHP / day (23.15 USD / day) 
  • Oxygen - 700 PHP / week (16.20 USD / week)
  • Supplies & Food - 3,000 PHP / week (69.50 USD / week)
  • Physical Therapist - 500 PHP / session (11.60 USD / session) 2 - 3 times a week
  • Home Care Doctor - PHP 1,500 / visit (34.75 USD / visit) 

The first 300,000 PHP (6,959.70 USD) will go to the hospital bills while the remaining funds raised will be of good help to relieve her family from her daily home care expenses for at least two weeks. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Although monetary donation are highly appreciated, non-monetary assistance are equally appreciated and it does not mean you cannot help at all. Here are some ways to help Teacher Chuchi

  • Get the word out about the fundraising EASILY, share publicly on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, and others. Indiegogo has SHARE TOOLS! Just click and share and feel good about helping! 
  • Pray for Teacher Chuchi's recovery. Miracles do happen.
  • Send Teacher Chuchi's family an encouraging message, positive energy, and some sunshine on the COMMENTS section. 
  • If you would like to visit, contribute, and get in touch directly with Teacher Chuchi's family, you may go to this page. 

What Happens Next

Updates of Teacher Chuchi's state, hopefully about her recovery, will be provided on the UPDATES section. Encouraging messages posted here will be read out loud to Teacher Chuchi. The family believes she is somehow conscious about her surroundings and could hear them when they speak to her. She brightens up and shows a slight smile when she hears her only grandson speak. Most importantly, the real perk we can offer to each contributor is our heartfelt gratitude. Every penny is highly appreciated. To all the contributors, please know that you are a blessing to Teacher Chuchi and her family, a very big THANK YOU to you and your kind hearts.

story:
Summary

Meg is 24 years old and lives in Texas after coming to the United States last year from the United Kingdom to be with her husband.  She is a licensed wildlife rehabilitator, animal shelter volunteer and artist.
 
In August 2014 during a routine dental appointment to have her wisdom teeth removed, the preliminary X-rays showed an “ameloblastoma” tumor in her jaw.  The good  news is that it was benign, the bad news is that treatment required removing half of her lower jaw.

Meg had the surgery on September 29th, removing the affected jaw and in its place they inserted a titanium plate around a sponge material containing a compound of “bone morphogenetic proteins”, stem cells from her hip and cadaver bone.  Over 9 - 12 months the sponge will absorb into her body and a new bone will have grown in its place.  This procedure has a good success rate of over 80% but if the graft is rejected a second surgery will be required.

Her jaw was wired for the first month and a soft diet during jaw rehabilitation is expected for a further five months. Full recovery and rehabilitation is expected to be 12-15 months.  She will be unable to go back to work full time during most of this period, though is expected to be able to work at home with her art after a couple of months. While Meg and her husband do have insurance, it is limited coverage and the bills so far total over $10k. This does not yet include hospital bill for a five-day stay, two of which were in ICU.

This is where we ask for your support. If you chose a “perk” we'll require a mailing address or email for contacting you.  If you chose to donate without choosing a perk then Meg and her husband would like to offer their most sincerest thank you.  The support of everyone reading this truly means the world to both of them!♥

All perks (except the postcards) will start being created after January 1 2015 due to recovery time.  If Meg and her husband are able to start them earlier they will most certainly contact you!   These rewards aren't "commissions" but instead are their effort to say a special "thank you" to those who have helped.

For pictures of the postcards and examples of the art and chain mail pieces go to this link:
http://ink-dog.co.uk/rewards

story:
Shots for Shots

The opportunity to shoot your friends and make new ones.  This is a new club, to take on Archery Tag, get physical and have fun in Los Angeles with a great crew of enthusiastic fun people

  • Zak Knight- Lead instigator of Archery Tag meetup in Los Angeles
  • This is a campaign to buy equipment to start our own Archery Tag Club in Los Angeles and bring it out to Black Rock City and other fun places around the year.
  • Contributors will bring to reality a fun monthly event for Angeleno's made up of Burners, crazies and competitive spirited people. 
  • We want to change the rules, and bring it wherever we want whenever we want.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We Need Equipment.  We will use the money to get the Bow's and Arrows, Face Masks, ARMGUARDS (definitely a need) and blow up barriers.
  • You choose your level of involvement.  A Small donation is a lifetime membership into the club.  Play every outing or just once, it's totally worth it.  
  • Full Membership, guest passes, Leadership (Full Access to set up extra events.) Party Day's (Throw your own private days, B-Days, Fundraisers ETC)
  • If we don't make our complete goal we will buy the most complete sets of Tag gear that we can.

Risks & Challenges

We have to find the proper equipment at the proper price, and obtain the quality equipment to make the game fun and safe.  

  • We have extensive experience bringing group games and events to fruition, from LA and our PedalBump project, to our Red Nose District in BRC
  • Amazon, Amazon, Amazon oh yeah and the inter=webs seem to have a good grasp on this game

Other Ways You Can Help

Get in touch with Shot for Shot on facebook

  • Make some noise about this campaign and share it around
  • Hit us up about parks, places, groups and events where we'd fit in.

story:
Visit us at:
www.myzerodegree.com

 

MOOD + FOCUS Enhancer

Zero Degree: Aromatic Herbal Inhaler  is an all-natural, award-winning portable aromatherapy on the go that provides a refreshing & cool sensation to revitalize the body & mind. Inspired by traditional herbal remedies.

As Featured on 

All Natural Ingredients

Zero Degree: Aromatic Herbal Inhaler is a modern day twist of aromatherapy. It is clinically proven by FDA and safe for use. Embody with a modern aromatic blend of soothing cool mint scent that has this clean & balance composition of Eucalyptus oil and also other exciting mix of natural herbs to give the Zero Degree its distinctive scent that is totally unique. 

 

 

How can Zero Degree help you

It is important to understand the science of how human body works. By doing so our collaborators and us carefully engineered the best possible formula that could tackle some of the daily encounters that people face daily. We carefully consolidate several herbs together that would combine to become not only a scent, but a therapeutic scent that can engage and aid the body. The benefits of what Zero Degree could do as illustrate in the infographics chart below. 

As and when its needed!

These are some of the situations we might face everyday. Situations that present itself unexpectedly in today's fast pace society. Then we see how society turns to alternatives that do not address the problem. Zero Degree might be the answer to your daily needs. 

How to use ZERO DEGREE

Simply twist the inhaler, inhale deeply the aromatic herbal scent and you are ready to continue whatever you left off with a refreshing start. 

Clinical Aromatherapy

Aromatherapy is arguably the most fundamental approach of therapeutic methods. It is also one of the simplest way to integrate because when we inhale air, we simultaneously inhale aroma.

Efficiency of Inhalation

90% of the air we breathe in goes into our nasal passage and the rest of the 10% via our mouth. Inhalation is the best & fastest way to stimulate the neurons in the body as compared to other methods such as absorption & ingestion. The ‘Olfactory receptors’ sitting inside our nose that is responsible for transmitting the scent molecule directly to our brain.
A simple experiment to indicate this is just simply drinking lemon juice while pinching your nose. You will eventually only get a weak sour as compared to drinking lemon juice normally. The tongue collaborates with the nose to bind together the taste & smell of lemon.

How Scent works?

As the brain is known as the 'central nervous system' consisting of the brain & the spinal cord. It integrates information it receives from & coordinates. It also influence the activity of all parts of the body. That is why scent plays an important role in influencing someone well being as it ts open to therapeutic treatments.

How Zero Degree came about

Back in the olden days, apothecaries or natural pharmacies in Asia formulated several natural herbs put together in sachets for people as a form of remedy to aid nasal & breathing problems. They later also discovered that the same herbal sachets provides them mental acuity & focus which gives them the extra boost they needed to perform their physical jobs.

As time goes by, herbalist started curating more exciting & intricate blend of aromatic scent. They started blending natural herbs with essential oils. That's when the glass jar came about. So we want to take the ancient practice of aromatherapy to the next level. Therefore our journey to great innovation start from here...

We have gone through a very thorough process to come out with Zero Degree. We search high & low for the top notch experts to provide us with the best solution for our product, be it at design or our formula. We ran into lots of organisations, companies, freelancers, and more to find the most suitable & reliable collaborators to work with. We spent almost 3 years going through this painstaking process so as to uphold quality.

Formulating Zero Degree

Creating our scent profile was one of the challenges that we face. We want to formulate a blend that has character. A recognisable fresh and clean scent that is rich yet contemporary to suit the modern day people. 

We took some time off to understand the fundamentals of botany and how the whole process from how plantation works to harvesting and formulation. We were amazed of the endless benefits of what these natural herbs can help us with our daily life. We then went on to further study various different types of botanical sources of oils and herbs with different types of benefit.

For ensuring the best quality, we had gone through FDA for certification & intensive testing to make sure is safe to use.

Design & Development

Market Research & Analysis

We design the inhaler with the objective of understanding what our users require. We begin the design process by doing some market research & analysis. We brainstorm, conceptualise several designs and streamlined it to the finest and most refine design ever.

Concept & Design

The concept behind Zero Degree is a one piece design construction. We want it to be non-detachable product so as to stay minimal and to prevent any missing cap issue. Importantly it has to be brilliant, stylish & simple to use. 

With a simple twist, air from outside then enters the chambers through the openings located at the back of the inhaler & flow past its unique blend of herbal extracts. It will let the scent waft up through the top openings.

Testing & Prototyping

We’ve done tremendous amount of testing to come up with the best design with numerous prototypes to give the ‘Zero Degree’ inhaler the right proportion, contour, colour, function & importantly an holistic experience for the user. 

Aromatherapy on the go

We designed Zero Degree with the intention of having it portable so as to benefit the user of carrying it anywhere. Portability is one of our priority when designing the Zero Degree. We look into several situations and environments such as in a crowded bus, office spaces, intervals of gym time, or probably cycling at the park. How this aromatherapy on the go is cater to the lifestyle of the modern people. 

Anyone, Anyplace & Anytime

 

Visit us at:
www.myzerodegree.com


Timeline

About Us

We’re a group of passionate designers and always dream of creating our very own product that could benefit people from all walks of life. We truly believed with the simple touch of design & aromatherapy, we could make a big impact on society so as to let them enjoy life to the fullest. We would like to take this opportunity to thank Indiegogo for this platform that we could demonstrate our fullest potential and let us share our endearing passion with the rest of the world. 

Why we need your support?

Making ZERO DEGREE is the most challenging part of our journey. We need your help to let us live our dream. The funds we are raising will go to covering the manufacturing costs & logistics. With your support we can give our manufacturing partner a thumbs-up to proceed with the manufacturing process. With your contribution also we get to share ZERO DEGREE multiple benefit that it can offer.

Help us get the word out

Spread the word around and do support our campaign to make this project come true. So that we can achieve our goal by benefiting millions of people around the world simply by the touch of design & aromatherapy.  There is another way for you to contribute to this campaign by sharing our campaign via social media with your friends & families and other people may know . Not only that will it keep people going through their daily lives but also bringing the joy to them and their loved ones.

Visit us at:
www.myzerodegree.com
story_txt:
Visit us at:www.myzerodegree.com
 MOOD + FOCUS EnhancerZero Degree: Aromatic Herbal Inhaler  is an all-natural, award-winning portable aromatherapy on the go that provides a refreshing & cool sensation to revitalize the body & mind. Inspired by traditional herbal remedies.As Featured on All Natural IngredientsZero Degree: Aromatic Herbal Inhaler is a modern day twist of aromatherapy. It is clinically proven by FDA and safe for use. Embody with a modern aromatic blend of soothing cool mint scent that has this clean & balance composition of Eucalyptus oil and also other exciting mix of natural herbs to give the Zero Degree its distinctive scent that is totally unique.   How can Zero Degree help you It is important to understand the science of how human body works. By doing so our collaborators and us carefully engineered the best possible formula that could tackle some of the daily encounters that people face daily. We carefully consolidate several herbs together that would combine to become not only a scent, but a therapeutic scent that can engage and aid the body. The benefits of what Zero Degree could do as illustrate in the infographics chart below. As and when its needed!These are some of the situations we might face everyday. Situations that present itself unexpectedly in today's fast pace society. Then we see how society turns to alternatives that do not address the problem. Zero Degree might be the answer to your daily needs. How to use ZERO DEGREESimply twist the inhaler, inhale deeply the aromatic herbal scent and you are ready to continue whatever you left off with a refreshing start. Clinical Aromatherapy


Aromatherapy is arguably the most fundamental approach of therapeutic methods. It is also one of the simplest way to integrate because when we inhale air, we simultaneously inhale aroma.


Efficiency of Inhalation
90% of the air we breathe in goes into our nasal passage and the rest of the 10% via our mouth. Inhalation is the best & fastest way to stimulate the neurons in the body as compared to other methods such as absorption & ingestion. The ‘Olfactory receptors’ sitting inside our nose that is responsible for transmitting the scent molecule directly to our brain.A simple experiment to indicate this is just simply drinking lemon juice while pinching your nose. You will eventually only get a weak sour as compared to drinking lemon juice normally. The tongue collaborates with the nose to bind together the taste & smell of lemon.
How Scent works?
As the brain is known as the 'central nervous system' consisting of the brain & the spinal cord. It integrates information it receives from & coordinates. It also influence the activity of all parts of the body. That is why scent plays an important role in influencing someone well being as it ts open to therapeutic treatments.

How Zero Degree came about

Back in the olden days, apothecaries or natural pharmacies in Asia formulated several natural herbs put together in sachets for people as a form of remedy to aid nasal & breathing problems. They later also discovered that the same herbal sachets provides them mental acuity & focus which gives them the extra boost they needed to perform their physical jobs.

As time goes by, herbalist started curating more exciting & intricate blend of aromatic scent. They started blending natural herbs with essential oils. That's when the glass jar came about. So we want to take the ancient practice of aromatherapy to the next level. Therefore our journey to great innovation start from here...
We have gone through a very thorough process to come out with Zero Degree. We search high & low for the top notch experts to provide us with the best solution for our product, be it at design or our formula. We ran into lots of organisations, companies, freelancers, and more to find the most suitable & reliable collaborators to work with. We spent almost 3 years going through this painstaking process so as to uphold quality.Formulating Zero Degree

Creating our scent profile was one of the challenges that we face. We want to formulate a blend that has character. A recognisable fresh and clean scent that is rich yet contemporary to suit the modern day people. 

We took some time off to understand the fundamentals of botany and how the whole process from how plantation works to harvesting and formulation. We were amazed of the endless benefits of what these natural herbs can help us with our daily life. We then went on to further study various different types of botanical sources of oils and herbs with different types of benefit.

For ensuring the best quality, we had gone through FDA for certification & intensive testing to make sure is safe to use.

Design & Development
Market Research & Analysis
We design the inhaler with the objective of understanding what our users require. We begin the design process by doing some market research & analysis. We brainstorm, conceptualise several designs and streamlined it to the finest and most refine design ever.
Concept & Design

The concept behind Zero Degree is a one piece design construction. We want it to be non-detachable product so as to stay minimal and to prevent any missing cap issue. Importantly it has to be brilliant, stylish & simple to use. 

With a simple twist, air from outside then enters the chambers through the openings located at the back of the inhaler & flow past its unique blend of herbal extracts. It will let the scent waft up through the top openings.


Testing & Prototyping

We’ve done tremendous amount of testing to come up with the best design with numerous prototypes to give the ‘Zero Degree’ inhaler the right proportion, contour, colour, function & importantly an holistic experience for the user. 

Aromatherapy on the go

We designed Zero Degree with the intention of having it portable so as to benefit the user of carrying it anywhere. Portability is one of our priority when designing the Zero Degree. We look into several situations and environments such as in a crowded bus, office spaces, intervals of gym time, or probably cycling at the park. How this aromatherapy on the go is cater to the lifestyle of the modern people. 
Anyone, Anyplace & Anytime
 
Visit us at:www.myzerodegree.com
